translated: By this, he explains that in seeing, the existence of apprehended and apprehender is also non-conceptual.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The explanation is as follows:

original: rnam par rtog pa dang 'dres pa'i mthong ba can de ni mngon sum yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang 'dres pa'i mthong ba can de ni mngon sum yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The one who sees mixed with conceptual thought is direct perception, and just because of that,

original: rtog dang bral ba grub pa yin no //üîΩde ltar na de ni rnam par rtog ba dang bral ba'i bdag nyid yongs su bcad nas skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog dang bral ba grub pa yin no // de ltar na de ni rnam par rtog ba dang bral ba'i bdag nyid yongs su bcad nas skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he is established as free from conceptual thought.üîΩThus, having eliminated the nature of conceptual thought, he is born.

original: de ltar na mi dmigs pa las rtog pa dang bral ba grub pas na /
analyzed: de ltar na mi dmigs pa las rtog pa dang bral ba grub pas na /
translated: In that way, since he is established as free from conceptual thought through non-apprehension,

original: rjes su dpag pas grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt he established by inference?

original: ji ltar na 'di mngon sum nyid kyis grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di mngon sum nyid kyis grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could he be established by direct perception?

original: bden te / mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: bden te / mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: It is true that non-apprehension

original: rnam par gcod pa tsam ma ma /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa tsam ma ma /
translated: is not merely an elimination,

original: med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: and it is not a proof of non-existence.

original: 'on kyang ma yin par 'jug pas gzhan dmigs pa yin no /üîΩmthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid @169a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma yin par 'jug pas gzhan dmigs pa yin no / mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid @169a * //
translated: However, since it engages in non-existence, it is the apprehension of another.

original: kyis med pa grub pa yin na yang rmongs pa la tha snyad 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: kyis med pa grub pa yin na yang rmongs pa la tha snyad 'jug par byed do //
translated: Even though non-existence is established by the nature of seeing, it is used as a convention for the confused.

original: de ni gzhan du rgyas par dpyad zin pas 'dir yang ma spros pa de ltar na skyon med do //
analyzed: de ni gzhan du rgyas par dpyad zin pas 'dir yang ma spros pa de ltar na skyon med do //
translated: Since this has been analyzed extensively elsewhere, I will not elaborate on it here.

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ston par byed do //
translated: He shows the characteristic of the object with ‚Äúall‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad la ni dpyod bsdus nas /
analyzed: thams cad la ni dpyod bsdus nas /
translated: Having analyzed all,

original: yul thams cad las rnam par rtog pa bzlog nas so //
analyzed: yul thams cad las rnam par rtog pa bzlog nas so //
translated: having turned away from all objects,

original: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo med pas //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo med pas //
translated: without wavering internally,

original: yid dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo ma lus pa nub par gyur pas so //
analyzed: yid dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo ma lus pa nub par gyur pas so //
translated: the mind, name, and all conceptual natures have disappeared.

original: gnas na'ang mig gis //
analyzed: gnas na'ang mig gis //
translated: Even while dwelling, with the eye

original: mig gi dbang po'i blo gang yin pas gzugs dag ni skyes bus mthong ba'i blo de dbang skyes yin mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i blo gang yin pas gzugs dag ni skyes bus mthong ba'i blo de dbang skyes yin mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: the cognition of the eye faculty, the cognition that sees forms is a cognition arisen from the faculty, a direct perception free from conceptuality.

original: dbang po'i blo la rnam par rtog pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo la rnam par rtog pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there is conceptuality in the cognition of the faculty,

original: 'on kyang nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not ascertained.

original: de ltar rtog ba med pa'i gnas skabs las dus phyis skyes bu yang cung zad cig rnam rtog pa kho bo'i rnam rtog de 'dra 'gyur ces rigs de gal te dbang po'i shes pa de yin par gyur na sngar yang nges par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar rtog ba med pa'i gnas skabs las dus phyis skyes bu yang cung zad cig rnam rtog pa kho bo'i rnam rtog de 'dra 'gyur ces rigs de gal te dbang po'i shes pa de yin par gyur na sngar yang nges par 'gyur na /
translated: If that were the case, then the sense consciousness would have to be ascertained earlier.

original: sngar bshad gnas skabs kyi /
analyzed: sngar bshad gnas skabs kyi /
translated: But it is not ascertained earlier.

original: rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang po la rtog pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang po la rtog pa med do //
translated: The sense faculty at the time when thought is withdrawn does not have thought.

original: dbang po'i rnam bar shes pa la nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam bar shes pa la nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not ascertained in the sense consciousness.

original: des na de de la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de de la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that it does not exist in that.

original: 'dis kyang mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral ba kho na yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩkhyad par gcig la mthong ba ni //
analyzed: 'dis kyang mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral ba kho na yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / khyad par gcig la mthong ba ni //
translated: In order to demonstrate that direct perception is only free from thought,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe seeing of one attribute,‚Äù and so on.

original: don gang la sgra sbyor ba na /
analyzed: don gang la sgra sbyor ba na /
translated: When a word is applied to an object,

original: de'i ming de dang 'dres pa'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i ming de dang 'dres pa'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur na /
translated: it is apprehended by a consciousness that is mixed with its name.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not applied to its own characteristic.

original: de ltar na gcig la cig car sgra sbyor ba las thams cad du don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'di sbyor ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na gcig la cig car sgra sbyor ba las thams cad du don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'di sbyor ba yin na /
translated: Thus, since it is applied to a single thing at one time, it is applied in order to make known the object.

original: khyad par gcig la bye brag la /üîΩmthong ba ni brda'i dus na yang yul la sogs pa /
analyzed: khyad par gcig la bye brag la / mthong ba ni brda'i dus na yang yul la sogs pa /
translated: But when one sees a particular in a specific instance,

original: gzhan 'ba' zhig la mthong mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan 'ba' zhig la mthong mi 'gyur /
translated: at the time of the convention, one does not see only another object, etc.

original: de ltar na dbang pos gzung ba'i don tha snyad kyi dus na nye bar sbyor ba can ma yin pas de la sgra sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang pos gzung ba'i don tha snyad kyi dus na nye bar sbyor ba can ma yin pas de la sgra sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, since the object apprehended by the sense faculty is not present at the time of the convention, the word is not applied to it,

original: 'di ni tha snyad kyi don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni tha snyad kyi don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the convention.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig tha snyad kyi dus na rjes su 'gro ba'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa'i don de la ni tha snyad 'dogs @169b pa po dag gis sgra sbyor ba byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig tha snyad kyi dus na rjes su 'gro ba'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa'i don de la ni tha snyad 'dogs @169b pa po dag gis sgra sbyor ba byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The word is not applied by the one who makes the convention to an object that is not present at the time of the convention.

original: dper na don gzhan la tha snyad kyi dus na yod ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na don gzhan la tha snyad kyi dus na yod ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like another object that is not present at the time of the convention.

original: khra mo'i khyad par gcig kyang yul dang dus gzhan gyi ba lang gi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs ba'o //
analyzed: khra mo'i khyad par gcig kyang yul dang dus gzhan gyi ba lang gi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs ba'o //
translated: And the particular of the cow is not the referent of the term ‚Äúcow‚Äù in another place and time. This is the non-observation of the omnipresent.

original: gang gi tshe phan tshun ldog pa'i ngo bo can gyi khyad par sgra mi sbyor ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phan tshun ldog pa'i ngo bo can gyi khyad par sgra mi sbyor ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the term is not applied to the referent, which has a nature that is the opposite of that of another,

original: ji ltar na mthong bas de dang 'dres par rang bzhin khyad par can gyi don 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na mthong bas de dang 'dres par rang bzhin khyad par can gyi don 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: how could the seeing apprehend the referent that is mixed with that?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la sgra mi 'god pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la sgra mi 'god pa de ni /
translated: The application is this: That which is not expressed by a term

original: khyad par can gyi don de 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi don de 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: does not apprehend the referent that is qualified by that.

original: ba lang gi rdzas rta'i sgra ma sbyar ba can khyad par can gyi rta 'dzin pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi rdzas rta'i sgra ma sbyar ba can khyad par can gyi rta 'dzin pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the substance of the cow, which is not expressed by the term ‚Äúhorse,‚Äù does not apprehend the horse, which is qualified by that.

original: ba lang gi khyad par la yang sgra mi 'god pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi khyad par la yang sgra mi 'god pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the term is not applied to the particular of the cow. This is the non-observation of a cause.

original: spyi la sgra 'god par khas len pas kyang grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi la sgra 'god par khas len pas kyang grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if one accepts that the term is applied to the universal, this is not an establishment of what is already established.

original: 'di ltar khyad par de las spyi gzhan tha dad pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par de las spyi gzhan tha dad pa /
translated: In this way, a universal is not a different object from the particulars.

original: tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa'am rtag pa gcig pu dbang po gcig gi gzung bar bya ba gsal ba'i khyad par rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir spyi'i ngo bo yod min /
analyzed: tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa'am rtag pa gcig pu dbang po gcig gi gzung bar bya ba gsal ba'i khyad par rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir spyi'i ngo bo yod min /
translated: It is not the same as the particulars, nor is it a permanent, unitary, and imperceptible entity that is the object of a single sense faculty and that is the common locus of the various particulars.

original: gang la sgra sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: gang la sgra sbyor bar byed /
translated: To what object do you apply the term?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: blo tha dad med phyir spyi 'di dang de dang ldan pa 'di zhes bya ba ltar sna tshogs par snang ba can gyi blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo tha dad med phyir spyi 'di dang de dang ldan pa 'di zhes bya ba ltar sna tshogs par snang ba can gyi blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of a universal does not appear as a variety, as in the case of the cognition of this and that which possesses this and that.

original: 'dis ni spyi med ba'i tha snyad rtogs pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyi med ba'i tha snyad rtogs pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the non-observation of nature is the basis for understanding the conventions of universals without universals.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar spyi med pa dang khyad par la sgra mi 'god pa dang / 'dis 'di ming dang ma 'dres pa nyid mthong ba de'i phyir khyad par yul can nyid /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar spyi med pa dang khyad par la sgra mi 'god pa dang / 'dis 'di ming dang ma 'dres pa nyid mthong ba de'i phyir khyad par yul can nyid /
translated: Since a term is not applied to a universal, nor is it applied to particulars, and since it is seen that this is not mixed with the name, therefore the cognition of a particular is the basis for understanding the conventions of universals without universals.

original: ming dang 'dres pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa thams cad dbang po las skyes pa yin zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang 'dres pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa thams cad dbang po las skyes pa yin zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all those which are not in the state of being mixed with names are produced from the sense faculties.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar khyad par rnams la phan tshun 'dre ba can ma yin pa rnams la sgra rnams ni 'jug la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bas snga ma nyid gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par rnams la phan tshun 'dre ba can ma yin pa rnams la sgra rnams ni 'jug la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bas snga ma nyid gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: Because, in this way, sounds do not engage with the particulars which are not mutually mixed, as it is said, ‚Äúthey do not exist.‚Äù This is the established position.

original: ci'i phyir sgra rnams khyad par la 'jug pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgra rnams khyad par la 'jug pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do sounds not engage with particulars?

original: khyad par rjes 'gro med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: khyad par rjes 'gro med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no following of the particulars.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gcig la khyad par mthong ba tha snyad kyi dus su nye bar 'jog pa med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de la brda ni 'jug pa ma yin no //üîΩ'dis ni gang zhig tha snyad kyi dus na rjes su 'gro ba'i ngang @170a * //
analyzed: gcig la khyad par mthong ba tha snyad kyi dus su nye bar 'jog pa med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de la brda ni 'jug pa ma yin no // 'dis ni gang zhig tha snyad kyi dus na rjes su 'gro ba'i ngang @170a * //
translated: Because the cause of the non-establishment of the seeing of the particulars in one at the time of convention is that the convention does not engage with that.

original: tshul can ma yin pa'i don zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul can ma yin pa'i don zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the meaning of the application ‚Äúthe object which is not in the state of being followed at the time of convention.‚Äù

original: sgra rnams yul yang gang de nyid don la sgra de rnams nyid ni sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: sgra rnams yul yang gang de nyid don la sgra de rnams nyid ni sbyor bar byed /
translated: And the object of the words is just that meaning, and the words are applied to it.

original: don 'di'i sbyor bar byed pa ni 'di yin pa de ltar na gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: don 'di'i sbyor bar byed pa ni 'di yin pa de ltar na gzhan ma yin no //
translated: And the application to the meaning is just that, and not anything else.

original: dbang po'i don rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin pa ni sgra rnams kyi yul ma yin pa de ltar na de la sgra 'god pa ma yin zhing mi 'god pa'i phyir de yang des don khyad par can 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i don rjes su 'gro ba can ma yin pa ni sgra rnams kyi yul ma yin pa de ltar na de la sgra 'god pa ma yin zhing mi 'god pa'i phyir de yang des don khyad par can 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The object of the sense faculty is not the object of the words, and so the words are not applied to it. And because they are not applied to it, it is not a special meaning that is apprehended by them.

original: des ni / gang zhig gang la sgra mi 'god pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni / gang zhig gang la sgra mi 'god pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: He shows the application of the words ‚Äúthat which is not applied to that by the words‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub par 'god par byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub par 'god par byed de /
translated: He shows that the reason is not established by ‚Äúits this‚Äù and so on.

original: don de'i rjod par byed pa 'di yin no zhes 'brel ba shes par byed pa na 'brel pa byed pa'i rnam bar rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa de rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po'i don snang ba ni gang yin pa'i dangs po de dag nyid ni 'brel ba yin /üîΩbrjod par bya ba 'di'i rjod par byed pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: don de'i rjod par byed pa 'di yin no zhes 'brel ba shes par byed pa na 'brel pa byed pa'i rnam bar rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa de rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po'i don snang ba ni gang yin pa'i dangs po de dag nyid ni 'brel ba yin / brjod par bya ba 'di'i rjod par byed pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The relation is the very thing that appears in the conceptual consciousness that produces the relation, and in the word.

original: 'chad pa bo dang nyan pa po'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes bdag la snang ba'i sgra'i don mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'am de dag la sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chad pa bo dang nyan pa po'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes bdag la snang ba'i sgra'i don mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'am de dag la sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: The relation is not the appearance of the word and the thing in the consciousness of the speaker and the hearer, nor is it the connection between them.

original: ci'i phyir dbang po'i shes ba nyid la 'brel pa mi byed ce na de ni dpyod par byed pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang po'i shes ba nyid la 'brel pa mi byed ce na de ni dpyod par byed pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Why does the relation not consist of the sense-object of the word that appears in the consciousness of the hearer?

original: dpyod par byed pa med par ni 'brel ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa med par ni 'brel ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relation is not understood without the operation of conceptual thought.

original: dbang ba'i shes pa ni so sor nges pa'i yul can nyid yin pas na des gzung bar bya ba'i sgra'i don dag la 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang ba'i shes pa ni so sor nges pa'i yul can nyid yin pas na des gzung bar bya ba'i sgra'i don dag la 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness that is the appropriator is the one that has a particular object, and therefore it does not relate to the meanings of words that are its objects.

original: de dag la 'brel bar shes pas 'dzin pa med par phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la 'brel bar shes pas 'dzin pa med par phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not grasp them, it does not relate to them.

original: yul du ma byas pa la 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba sbyor ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul du ma byas pa la 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba sbyor ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to apply the expression ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù to what is not an object.

original: sbyor ba ni gang ngag 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba byed pa'i shes pa la snad ba med pa de dag ni shes pa des 'brel ba byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang ngag 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba byed pa'i shes pa la snad ba med pa de dag ni shes pa des 'brel ba byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The application of the expression ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù is not the activity of the consciousness that relates the word to its meaning, because that consciousness does not appear in the application of the expression ‚Äúthis is that.‚Äù

original: dper na ba lang gi sgra dang don dag gi 'brel ba shes pa la rta'i sgra dang don dag mi snang ba shes pa des 'brel pa byed pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi sgra dang don dag gi 'brel ba shes pa la rta'i sgra dang don dag mi snang ba shes pa des 'brel pa byed pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the consciousness that relates the word cow to its meaning does not relate the word horse to its meaning, because it does not appear in the application of the expression ‚Äúthis is that.‚Äù

original: rang gi dbang po'i shes ba la snang ba'i sgra dang don gyi rang bzhin dag de'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba byed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes @170b ba la snang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi dbang po'i shes ba la snang ba'i sgra dang don gyi rang bzhin dag de'i 'di zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba byed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes @170b ba la snang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the sound and the object that appear to one‚Äôs sense consciousness are the referents of the mental consciousness that makes the connection ‚Äúthis is that.‚Äù This is the non-observation of a cause.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na don snang ba gang yin pa de dag nyid la 'brel pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na don snang ba gang yin pa de dag nyid la 'brel pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Because it is like that, the connection is with those very things that appear as objects.

original: 'brel pa'i dus na /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i dus na /
translated: At the time of the connection,

original: dbang po'i spyod yul min /
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul min /
translated: the object is not the domain of the sense faculties.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don 'brel pa byed pa'i yid kyi rnam bar shes pa la snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don 'brel pa byed pa'i yid kyi rnam bar shes pa la snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The object that has the characteristics of form, etc., is not the referent of the mental consciousness that makes the connection.

original: de bas na de la sgra sbyor ba ma yin pa de ltar na brjod ba dang 'brel pa med pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pa nyid kyis don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de la sgra sbyor ba ma yin pa de ltar na brjod ba dang 'brel pa med pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pa nyid kyis don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the connection is not with that sound. In that case, the object is cognized by the sense consciousness itself, which is not connected with expression.

original: 'brel pa byed pa'i shes pa la dbang po'i spyod yul snang ba'i phyir 'dir brda byed nyid yin pa de ltar na yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa byed pa'i shes pa la dbang po'i spyod yul snang ba'i phyir 'dir brda byed nyid yin pa de ltar na yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The cognition that is related to the object appears as the domain of the sense faculty. Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po'i spyod yul gyi don gsal bar ni snang ba can 'brel pa byed pa'i dus de tshe snang ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul gyi don gsal bar ni snang ba can 'brel pa byed pa'i dus de tshe snang ba med phyir ro //
translated: Because the object that is the domain of the sense faculty appears clearly, but at the time of the related cognition, it does not appear.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la /
translated: The conceptual cognition

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mi gsal bar snang ba mthong ba bzhin du gsal ba'i ngo bor snang bam yin pa de ltar na brda byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mi gsal bar snang ba mthong ba bzhin du gsal ba'i ngo bor snang bam yin pa de ltar na brda byed pa ma yin no //
translated: does not appear as a clear entity, like the seeing of an unclear appearance of an intrinsic identity. Therefore, it is not related to the object.

original: de ltar na brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa mthong ba dang thos pa las 'das pa yin na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa mthong ba dang thos pa las 'das pa yin na yang /
translated: Thus, the object and the expression are beyond being seen and heard.

original: phyis 'ga' zhig las nye bar mtshon pas 'brel ba byed pa nyid yin te don nye ba la yang sgra sbyor ba dmigs nas /
analyzed: phyis 'ga' zhig las nye bar mtshon pas 'brel ba byed pa nyid yin te don nye ba la yang sgra sbyor ba dmigs nas /
translated: However, later, by the indication of another, the relation is made. The application of the word to the object is observed.

original: de la sngar brda ma byas pa can rang nyid kyis dpyad nas 'brel pa byed pa'i phyir dang / dbang po bya ba med pa can gyi yang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dbang po'i don la brda byed na phyis kyang mthong ba bzhin du sgra las shes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sngar brda ma byas pa can rang nyid kyis dpyad nas 'brel pa byed pa'i phyir dang / dbang po bya ba med pa can gyi yang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dbang po'i don la brda byed na phyis kyang mthong ba bzhin du sgra las shes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related by the one who analyzes it, having not previously made a sign, because it is related by the one who does not have a functioning sense faculty, and because if one makes a sign for the object of a sense faculty, then it follows that one would know it from the word even later, just as one sees it.

original: snang ba tha dad na yang yul gcig pa can nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad na yang yul gcig pa can nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if the appearances are different, it is not logical that they have the same object.

original: 'di ltar shes snang tha dad pa'i yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes snang tha dad pa'i yang /
translated: Because of that, even if the appearances of consciousness are different,

original: dngos rnams khyad par med pa yin //
analyzed: dngos rnams khyad par med pa yin //
translated: things are not different.

original: sna tshogs pa dang gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other cause for positing a variety or a single entity.

original: gal te mthong ba dang mnyan pa las 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus na rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'god par ni mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba dang mnyan pa las 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus na rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'god par ni mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúAt the time of seeing and hearing, and at the time of passing beyond, and so on, the word is not applied to the particular characteristic,‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe rtogs pa pos rtogs par bya ba la yul nye ba bstan nas de rjod par byed pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa de'i tshe /üîΩ'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo gnyi ga @171a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtogs pa pos rtogs par bya ba la yul nye ba bstan nas de rjod par byed pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa de'i tshe / 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo gnyi ga @171a * //
translated: When the cognizer teaches the object of comprehension by indicating the object and then employs a term to express it,üîΩat that time the object of the consciousness of the explainer and the object of the consciousness of the listener are both

original: yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: the nature of the expressed and the expresser.

original: de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'god pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra 'god pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, the term is posited to its own object.

original: de ni de ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar mig gi don snang ba la yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi don snang ba la yang /
translated: In that case, even though the object of the eye appears,üîΩif the eye and ear sense faculties are engaged in apprehending their own objects, they do not cause the cognition of others.

original: mig dang rna ba'i dbang po dag rang gi yul 'dzin pa la brda byed pa yin na yang gzhan shes par byed pas sgra 'di'i brjod par bya ba 'di yin no zhes brjod pa rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i don gang yin pa'i
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i dbang po dag rang gi yul 'dzin pa la brda byed pa yin na yang gzhan shes par byed pas sgra 'di'i brjod par bya ba 'di yin no zhes brjod pa rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i don gang yin pa'i
translated: The object that appears to the conceptual consciousness that expresses ‚ÄúThis is the object of this term‚Äù

original: don de nyid sgra'i sbyor byed kyi /
analyzed: don de nyid sgra'i sbyor byed kyi /
translated: is the object of the application of the term.

original: ston par byed pa des tha snyad kyi don du yin gyi /
analyzed: ston par byed pa des tha snyad kyi don du yin gyi /
translated: The author of the treatise says that the object of the conventional is not the domain of the senses.

original: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: The object of the conventional is not the domain of the senses.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don to //
translated: The object of the conventional is form, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po bya ba med pa can bstan par bya ba mig 'dzums pa can no //üîΩgzhan ngag tsam gyis rtogs par byed pa po'i tshig tsam gyis snang med phyir /
analyzed: dbang po bya ba med pa can bstan par bya ba mig 'dzums pa can no // gzhan ngag tsam gyis rtogs par byed pa po'i tshig tsam gyis snang med phyir /
translated: The senses are not operative with respect to the object of the conventional, because the senses are closed.üîΩThe object of the conventional is not the domain of the senses, because it does not appear in the cognition that arises from the word, just as it does not appear in the sense consciousness.

original: mthong ba bzhin du sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin du sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the conventional does not appear in the cognition that arises from the word, just as it does not appear in the sense consciousness, because it is not the cause of that appearance.

original: gal te dbang po'i don la sgra sbyor bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i don la sgra sbyor bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the word were applied to the object of the senses,

original: sgra las byung ba la yang mthong ba bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te yang dbang po'i yul la sgras brdar byas pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba la yang mthong ba bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro // gal te yang dbang po'i yul la sgras brdar byas pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: then the object of the conventional would appear in the cognition that arises from the word, just as it does in the sense consciousness.

original: sgra dang 'dres pa de dag dbang po'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtog pa yang legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang 'dres pa de dag dbang po'i shes pas gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtog pa yang legs pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not correct to think that the object of the conventional is grasped by the sense consciousness, because it is mixed with the word, even though the word is not applied to the object of the senses.

original: de ltar na 'brel ba ma byas pa can du yang byas pa min /
analyzed: de ltar na 'brel ba ma byas pa can du yang byas pa min /
translated: Thus, it is not the case that the word is not related to the object.

original: gang la sgras brdar ma byas pa can de ni don de shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang la sgras brdar ma byas pa can de ni don de shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is: ‚ÄúThat which is not related to the object does not cause the object to be known.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'brel ba can du byas pa ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'brel ba can du byas pa ma yin pa de ni /
translated: The application of the reason is as follows: That which is not related to the object

original: don de shes par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don de shes par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: does not cause the object to be known,

original: dper na ba lang gi sgra rta dang lhan cig 'brel ba ma byas pa can yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi sgra rta dang lhan cig 'brel ba ma byas pa can yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù which is not related to a horse.

original: dbang po'i don yang sgra thams cad 'brel ba can du byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i don yang sgra thams cad 'brel ba can du byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nonobservation of a property that pervades the reason is as follows: The object of the sense faculties is not related to all words.

original: ci ste yang brdar ma byas pa can yang shes par byed pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste yang brdar ma byas pa can yang shes par byed pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if that which is not related to the object does cause the object to be known,

original: bdag nyid shes par thal phyir ro//
analyzed: bdag nyid shes par thal phyir ro//
translated: then it follows that the word itself would be known.

original: brda la ltos pa med pas kyang ming gis nye bar gzhag pa'i don 'dzin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: brda la ltos pa med pas kyang ming gis nye bar gzhag pa'i don 'dzin par 'gyur na /
translated: Because it would not depend on a convention, the word would also apprehend the object that is designated by the word.

original: 'dzin pa ma yin pa de'i phyir don brdar ma byas pa sgras shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma yin pa de'i phyir don brdar ma byas pa sgras shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not a grasping, the meaning that is not conventionally agreed upon is not understood from the word.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: dbang po'i sgor rjes su 'brang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang @171b bde brjod pa dang 'dre ba sbrul sbrul zhes sbyor bar byed pa dang / mthong bar byed pa rgyun 'byung bas 'jug pa de rnam par rtog pa yin na yang rtog pa med pa'i shes pa bzhin du mngon sum nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgor rjes su 'brang ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang @171b bde brjod pa dang 'dre ba sbrul sbrul zhes sbyor bar byed pa dang / mthong bar byed pa rgyun 'byung bas 'jug pa de rnam par rtog pa yin na yang rtog pa med pa'i shes pa bzhin du mngon sum nyid du 'dod do //
translated: the mental consciousness that is engaged in the gateway of the sense faculty, which is mixed with speech, which is engaged in the repetition of ‚Äúsnake, snake,‚Äù which is engaged in the arising of the stream of seeing, is conceptual. However, like nonconceptual consciousness, it is accepted as direct perception.

original: de ltar ma yin na mthong ba rnam par chad par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na mthong ba rnam par chad par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rtog pa rnam par chad par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then seeing would be interrupted and conceptualization would be interrupted.

original: rnam par rtog pa yin pas na //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yin pas na //
translated: Because it is conceptual,

original: mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba yin pas rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang de gnyis lhan cig mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba yin pas rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang de gnyis lhan cig mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not seeing, and because it is seeing, it is not conceptual. And the two do not occur simultaneously.

original: mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa 'di la rnam par ma chad pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang rnam par rtog pa 'di la rnam par ma chad pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And in this seeing and conceptualizing, there is no non-division.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba nyid rnam par rtog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba nyid rnam par rtog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, seeing itself is conceptualizing.

original: skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dag cig car 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dag cig car 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, conceptual and non-conceptual consciousnesses occur simultaneously.

original: rtog bcas rtog pa med pa'i yid //
analyzed: rtog bcas rtog pa med pa'i yid //
translated: The mind with conceptualization and without conceptualization

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag ni cig car du ni 'jug phyir ram /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag ni cig car du ni 'jug phyir ram /
translated: These mental consciousnesses occur simultaneously.üîΩOr, because of the cause, the ignorant understand that the different appearances are the different natures of conceptual and non-conceptual consciousnesses.

original: rgyu'i phyir rtogs pa po rmongs pa dag snang ba tha dad pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin tha dad de zin kyang de ma mthong bar de dag la ni gcig tu zhen pa de ni rnam par shes pa cig car 'jug bar khas len pa la brten nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir rtogs pa po rmongs pa dag snang ba tha dad pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin tha dad de zin kyang de ma mthong bar de dag la ni gcig tu zhen pa de ni rnam par shes pa cig car 'jug bar khas len pa la brten nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Even though they do not see that, they are attached to them as one. This is explained based on the assertion that consciousnesses occur simultaneously.

original: 'jug pa myur phyir rnam par rtog pa dang mthong ba dag go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin na yang 'jug ba myur ba'i phyir de dag rnam par chad pa med par 'khrul pas gcig tu zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa myur phyir rnam par rtog pa dang mthong ba dag go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin na yang 'jug ba myur ba'i phyir de dag rnam par chad pa med par 'khrul pas gcig tu zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: Although the mode of occurrence of thought and sight is sequential, because of the rapidity of their occurrence, there is the illusion of their being uninterrupted, and so they are conceived as one.

original: don dam par kho bo cag lan 'di 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par kho bo cag lan 'di 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not accept this reply as an ultimate truth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kho bo 'di la mgu ba mi rten pas phyis rnam par shes pa cig car 'jug pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kho bo 'di la mgu ba mi rten pas phyis rnam par shes pa cig car 'jug pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since we do not rely on this as a satisfying explanation, we will later show that consciousnesses do not occur simultaneously.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is how it is.

original: gal te rnam rtog chod pa yin //
analyzed: gal te rnam rtog chod pa yin //
translated: If thought is interrupted,

original: mthong ba rgyun 'chad 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: mthong ba rgyun 'chad 'gyur zhe na //
translated: then sight will be interrupted.

original: gal te sngar brjod pa dang 'dra ba can ma yin pa'i mthong ba dang / phyis rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa dang yang mthong ba dang / yang rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i go rims yod pa ma yin pa na gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te sngar brjod pa dang 'dra ba can ma yin pa'i mthong ba dang / phyis rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa dang yang mthong ba dang / yang rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i go rims yod pa ma yin pa na gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If, as you say, the seeing that is not like the previous one and the subsequent conceptual consciousness are not in a temporal sequence, and if there is no such order as ‚Äúseeing and then conceptualization,‚Äù then when there is conceptualization,

original: mthong ba ma yin zhing gang gi tshe 'di yin pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa de @172a * //
analyzed: mthong ba ma yin zhing gang gi tshe 'di yin pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa de @172a * //
translated: there is no seeing, and when there is seeing, there is no conceptualization.

original: ltar na / rnam par rtog pas chod pa'i rgyu yis mthong ba rgyun chad pa ste /
analyzed: ltar na / rnam par rtog pas chod pa'i rgyu yis mthong ba rgyun chad pa ste /
translated: In that case, seeing would be interrupted by conceptualization,

original: bar dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bar dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and it would be interrupted,

original: rgyun gyis 'byung ba ma yin na /
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'byung ba ma yin na /
translated: and it would not occur in a continuous series.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa kho na don 'dzin pa'i mngon sum yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa kho na don 'dzin pa'i mngon sum yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore the conceptual consciousness alone is the direct perception that apprehends the object.

original: gal te de ltar na de gzhan gyi ste rnam par rtog pa mngon sum yin par smra ba gzhan gyi yang ba lang la sogs pa thag nye ba'i yul la mngon sum du 'jug pa na /üîΩrigs ni tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon sum du phyogs par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na de gzhan gyi ste rnam par rtog pa mngon sum yin par smra ba gzhan gyi yang ba lang la sogs pa thag nye ba'i yul la mngon sum du 'jug pa na / rigs ni tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa mngon sum du phyogs par 'gyur ba na /
translated: If that is so, then when a consciousness that is a direct perception engages a nearby object, such as a cow, it would be a direct perception that is associated with conceptuality.

original: don 'di brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rnam ba gzhan mngon sum du 'gyur ba yod na /
analyzed: don 'di brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rnam ba gzhan mngon sum du 'gyur ba yod na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be a direct perception that is associated with a form that is not the object of expression.

original: de ltar gyi yul 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa de ji ltar min chod pa ma yin pa'am mchod na yang ji ltar mthong ba rnam par 'chad pa ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gyi yul 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa de ji ltar min chod pa ma yin pa'am mchod na yang ji ltar mthong ba rnam par 'chad pa ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: If you accept that a consciousness that is a direct perception has the mode of apprehending an object that is so, then how could it not be a conceptual consciousness? Even if you do not accept that, how could it not be a consciousness that is associated with conceptuality?

original: gzhan gyis kyang 'di la lan btab par byas pa yin pa ste de ltar na skyon 'di ni ma bkod ba nyid mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang 'di la lan btab par byas pa yin pa ste de ltar na skyon 'di ni ma bkod ba nyid mdzes pa yin no //
translated: The opponent has responded to this objection. Therefore it is better not to raise this objection.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true.

original: gal te mgal me mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: gal te mgal me mthong ba bzhin //
translated: If you assert that the seeing is powerful,

original: dngos phyogs stobs dang ldan 'dod na //
analyzed: dngos phyogs stobs dang ldan 'dod na //
translated: like the appearance of a firebrand

original: gal te yang rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye ba'i dus na mthong ba med pa de lta na yang mthong ba rnam par chad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa nye ba'i dus na mthong ba med pa de lta na yang mthong ba rnam par chad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if the seeing does not exist at the time of the arising of the various thoughts of different types, still the seeing is not interrupted.

original: mthong ba gzhan skye ba shin tu myur bar 'jug pas de stong pa'i dus na yang /
analyzed: mthong ba gzhan skye ba shin tu myur bar 'jug pas de stong pa'i dus na yang /
translated: Because the arising of another seeing occurs very quickly, and even when it is empty of the previous seeing,

original: mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmthong ba nyid stobs dang ldan pa'i bar du zhugs pa de gnyis kyis gnod pa byas pa mthong ba med pa stobs med ba de'i mtshams sbyor ba'i bar chad byed pa'am /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // mthong ba nyid stobs dang ldan pa'i bar du zhugs pa de gnyis kyis gnod pa byas pa mthong ba med pa stobs med ba de'i mtshams sbyor ba'i bar chad byed pa'am /
translated: it is connected to it.

original: mthong ba la gnod pa'i phyir nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba la gnod pa'i phyir nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The two seeings that have entered the powerful stage do not have the power to interrupt the connection of the seeing that is not powerful, because it is not possible for them to obstruct the seeing,

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: because they do not obstruct the seeing, like the appearance of a firebrand.

original: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo'i chas yul snga ma snga ma spang zhing /
analyzed: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo'i chas yul snga ma snga ma spang zhing /
translated: For example, the parts of a firebrand that have already passed over a certain place

original: yul phyi ma phyi mar 'jug ba can gyis 'khor lor snang ba can gyi yul ma lus pa la khyab par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na de nyid la yul rnam par nges par snang ba can nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul phyi ma phyi mar 'jug ba can gyis 'khor lor snang ba can gyi yul ma lus pa la khyab par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na de nyid la yul rnam par nges par snang ba can nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The wheel does not pervade all objects that appear as a wheel, since it is not the case that the wheel is perceived by all those who perceive an object.

original: 'on kyang 'khor lor snang ba'i mthong ba yin no zhes mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir 'khor lo mthong ngo snyam @172b pa'i blo 'byung ba de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor lor snang ba'i mthong ba yin no zhes mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir 'khor lo mthong ngo snyam @172b pa'i blo 'byung ba de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: But the idea ‚ÄúI see the wheel‚Äù arises because of the connection with the perception of the wheel, which is similar to the case of the man with eye disease.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gi tshe ma mthong bas kyang gnod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gi tshe ma mthong bas kyang gnod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because it is contradicted by the fact that sometimes it is not seen.

original: dper na don mthong ba nges par ma byas pa phyis dmigs par gyur pa na kho bos ma mthong ngo zhes zhen par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na don mthong ba nges par ma byas pa phyis dmigs par gyur pa na kho bos ma mthong ngo zhes zhen par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one who has not ascertained that he sees a mirage later observes it, he thinks, ‚ÄúI did not see it.‚Äù

original: de bas na dngos po'i sa phyogs stobs dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po'i sa phyogs stobs dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not certain that the place of an object is powerful.

original: mgal me mthong ba yang skabs su bab pa'i the tshom za ba sel bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin te /üîΩ'di la yang ci dbang po nyams par byas pa las don gyis stong pa rnam par bslad pa 'khor lor snang ba'i mthong ba 'di 'jug par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: mgal me mthong ba yang skabs su bab pa'i the tshom za ba sel bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin te / 'di la yang ci dbang po nyams par byas pa las don gyis stong pa rnam par bslad pa 'khor lor snang ba'i mthong ba 'di 'jug par 'gyur ram /
translated: The perception of a firebrand is not a case of the elimination of doubt, because there is doubt about it.

original: 'on te mthong ba 'jug par 'gyur bar mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir zhes the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang mtshams sbyor ba yang mthong ba las ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba 'jug par 'gyur bar mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir zhes the tshom za ba'i phyir ro // gzhan yang mtshams sbyor ba yang mthong ba las ma yin gyi /
translated: In this case, one wonders whether the perception of a firebrand is due to the impairment of a sense faculty, or whether it is a distorted perception of an empty object.

original: 'on kyang dran pa las ni yin no //üîΩ'di yang yul du byas pa las mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang dran pa las ni yin no // 'di yang yul du byas pa las mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the connection is not due to the perception, but rather to memory.

original: 'di'i yul gang yin pa de gsal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i yul gang yin pa de gsal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: And this connection is due to the object, but the object is not manifest,

original: mthong ba'i yul bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul bzhin no //
translated: like the object of a perception.

original: des na dran pa'i yul dang mthong ba'i yul mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir 'khor lor snang ba yongs su gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te de dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na dran pa'i yul dang mthong ba'i yul mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir 'khor lor snang ba yongs su gsal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te de dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because it connects the object of memory with the object of seeing, the appearance of the wheel is not clearly manifest, because they have different aspects.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo snang ba gsal ba gcig po 'di mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo snang ba gsal ba gcig po 'di mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: But it is seen that the appearance of the wheel of fire is clearly manifest.

original: des na mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it connects them,

original: rgyun mi 'chad par 'dzin pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba yang lan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par 'dzin pa'i rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba yang lan nyid ma yin no //
translated: it is reasonable that it is apprehended without interruption.

original: mthong ba nyid kyang mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid kyang mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case, because seeing does not connect them.

original: de ni 'das pa'i yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'das pa'i yul gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not apprehend the aspect of the past object.

original: de ltar na yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Even so, we must respond to this assertion.

original: de gzhan la yang mtshungs pa yin /
analyzed: de gzhan la yang mtshungs pa yin /
translated: That is the same for others.

original: rigs tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pas chod pa'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang lan gdab pa'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba rnam par chad par thob par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pas chod pa'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang lan gdab pa'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba rnam par chad par thob par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In response to the objection that the reply is made quickly, etc., we reply that, although the reply and the seeing occur in sequence in our system, the reply and the seeing are not interrupted, because we have established that the reply and the seeing are established in a noninterrupted series.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.

original: 'jug pa myur ba la sogs pas lan du brgal ba gang yin pa de dang de ni kho bo'i phyogs la rnam par rtog pa dang / mthong bdag la rim bzhin du 'byung ba yod na yang rnam par chod pa can ma yin pa'i mthong ba dang zhen pa rab tu bsgrub @173a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa myur ba la sogs pas lan du brgal ba gang yin pa de dang de ni kho bo'i phyogs la rnam par rtog pa dang / mthong bdag la rim bzhin du 'byung ba yod na yang rnam par chod pa can ma yin pa'i mthong ba dang zhen pa rab tu bsgrub @173a * //
translated: The objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,

original: pa'i phyir / gzhung btsugs pa nyid yin no //üîΩyi ge cig car thos pa yin //üîΩgal te myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir rnam par chad pa med par mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa la mthong ba la mtshams sbyor ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / gzhung btsugs pa nyid yin no // yi ge cig car thos pa yin // gal te myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir rnam par chad pa med par mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa la mthong ba la mtshams sbyor ba de'i tshe /
translated: is refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,

original: mtsho zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i yi ge dag gi 'jug pa ches shin tu myur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: mtsho zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i yi ge dag gi 'jug pa ches shin tu myur ba de ltar na /
translated: is refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.üîΩThe objection that the reply is made quickly, etc.,üîΩis refuted by the fact that the reply is made quickly, etc.

original: go rims med par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go rims med par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be no order in the apprehension of the letters.

original: de ltar na go rims tha dad ba las mnyan pa tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na go rims tha dad ba las mnyan pa tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the order of the letters is not different from the order of the hearing of the letters.

original: dper na mtsho dang ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mtsho dang ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the word ‚Äúlake‚Äù and the word ‚Äútaste.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du myur du mthong ba 'jug pa dang / chu'i thigs pa 'thig pa la sogs pa'i sngon po dag la yang 'jig pa myur ba'i phyir gcig tu 'dzin pa'i zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du myur du mthong ba 'jug pa dang / chu'i thigs pa 'thig pa la sogs pa'i sngon po dag la yang 'jig pa myur ba'i phyir gcig tu 'dzin pa'i zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, in the case of the rapid perception of blue, etc., there is a single apprehension of the blue, etc., because of the rapid destruction of the blue, etc.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the perception of a firebrand circle.

original: gzhan yang 'dir te rnam par shes pa cig car mi skye ba'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir te rnam par shes pa cig car mi skye ba'i phyogs la'o //
translated: Moreover, in this case, i.e., in the case of the non-simultaneous arising of consciousness,

original: dbang rnams te mig la sogs pa nas yid la thug pa'i drug po rnams so //
analyzed: dbang rnams te mig la sogs pa nas yid la thug pa'i drug po rnams so //
translated: the faculties, i.e., the six faculties from eye to mind,

original: yod na yang ste yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: yod na yang ste yod par gyur na'o //
translated: even if they exist, i.e., even if they exist as real entities,

original: dbang po rnams ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /üîΩdon kun dang ni cig car ni //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ci 'dra ba zhig ce na / don kun dang ni cig car ni //
translated: what kind of faculties?üîΩAll objects, i.e., the objects of the six faculties,

original: 'dus can te cig car spyod yul du gyur pa'i rang gi yul can rnams so //
analyzed: 'dus can te cig car spyod yul du gyur pa'i rang gi yul can rnams so //
translated: simultaneously, i.e., at the same time, are the objects of the six consciousnesses.

original: de yang yid kyi dbang po la brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yid kyi dbang po la brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the mental faculty that is referred to here,

original: de ni da ltar gyi yul can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni da ltar gyi yul can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the subject of the present object.

original: de de ltar na gang gi tshe gling bu la sogs pa sil snyan gyi ngo bo mthong ba na de nyid las sgra thos pa dang / autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i dri bsnams pa na ga bur la sogs pa'i ro myang ba dang / stan la sogs pa la reg na reg bya myong zhing cung zhig sems par byed pa thams cad rnam pa med pa nyid du dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na gang gi tshe gling bu la sogs pa sil snyan gyi ngo bo mthong ba na de nyid las sgra thos pa dang / autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i dri bsnams pa na ga bur la sogs pa'i ro myang ba dang / stan la sogs pa la reg na reg bya myong zhing cung zhig sems par byed pa thams cad rnam pa med pa nyid du dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when one sees the nature of a flute, etc., which is a musical instrument, one hears the sound from it; when one smells the scent of a blue lotus, etc., one tastes the flavor of camphor, etc.; when one touches a seat, etc., one experiences the tactile object and thinks a little. All of these are the apprehension of the formless.

original: de ltar na dbang po bya ba byed pa yod na yang rnam par shes pa lnga po rnams kyis chod na yong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po bya ba byed pa yod na yang rnam par shes pa lnga po rnams kyis chod na yong ngo //
translated: Thus, even when the sense faculty is functioning, the five consciousnesses are present when there is no obstruction.

original: gang gi tshe go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can las rnam par shes pa re re rnam par chad pa med pa bzhin du snang ba de'i tshe rnam par shes pa gzhan 'jug pa med na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can las rnam par shes pa re re rnam par chad pa med pa bzhin du snang ba de'i tshe rnam par shes pa gzhan 'jug pa med na /
translated: When consciousnesses arise in sequence, and when they appear as if they were not interrupted, then, if another consciousness does not enter,

original: ji ltar yi ge dag cig car thos par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yi ge dag cig car thos par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is it that the letters are not heard simultaneously?

original: chod med bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chod med bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven though there is no interruption, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar shes par lnga tha dad pas chod pa yin yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes par lnga tha dad pas chod pa yin yang /
translated: Thus, even though the five consciousnesses are interrupted by being different,

original: chod med bzhin du snang ba'i blo //
analyzed: chod med bzhin du snang ba'i blo //
translated: the mind that appears as if there were no interruption

original: gang de shes pa rigs mi mthun pas chod pa yod na /
analyzed: gang de shes pa rigs mi mthun pas chod pa yod na /
translated: is a consciousness that is interrupted by a different type of consciousness.

original: ro dang mtsho zhes bya ba la @173b sogs pa yi ge ming gi mthar thug pa'i yi ge 'dzin pa de la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa'i skad cig yi ge snga ma rnams shes pa dang lhan cig 'dres phyir yang yi ge 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can
analyzed: ro dang mtsho zhes bya ba la @173b sogs pa yi ge ming gi mthar thug pa'i yi ge 'dzin pa de la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa'i skad cig yi ge snga ma rnams shes pa dang lhan cig 'dres phyir yang yi ge 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can
translated: When there is a different type of consciousness, the consciousness that observes the letters, up to the name ocean, and so on, is a consciousness that apprehends the letters. Because the earlier letters are mixed with the consciousness, the consciousness that apprehends the letters is not mixed into one.

original: gcig tu 'dres par gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu 'dres par gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not mixed into one.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: chod bar snang ba ste /üîΩyi ge re re sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa'i ngo bo can rnam par chod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: chod bar snang ba ste / yi ge re re sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa'i ngo bo can rnam par chod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The letters are interrupted, that is to say, they are perceived as distinct.üîΩBut the moment is not divided, for the moment is not a composite thing.

original: de yang ngo mtshar skad cig ma 'dzin pa la sdod pa yod ba ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de yang ngo mtshar skad cig ma 'dzin pa la sdod pa yod ba ma yin pas na /
translated: The moment is not a thing that endures and that would be divided into parts.

original: mchod pa nyid sgrub bar byed do //
analyzed: mchod pa nyid sgrub bar byed do //
translated: The moment is the unit of time.üîΩIf the moment is not divided, how can the letters be perceived as distinct?

original: des na 'dir yang yi ge'i yan lag gi rnam par gcig tu gyur pa can mthong ba rnam par mchod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: des na 'dir yang yi ge'i yan lag gi rnam par gcig tu gyur pa can mthong ba rnam par mchod par 'gyur na /
translated: The letters are not perceived as distinct.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: The mind is not divided, but it is modified.

original: de phyir blo ni cig car 'gyur //üîΩrkyen ji lta ba bzhin rnam par shes pa cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de phyir blo ni cig car 'gyur // rkyen ji lta ba bzhin rnam par shes pa cig car skye bar 'gyur ro // de ltar skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.

original: rnam par rtog pas mthong ba la chod pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta ma yin na snang ba la yang khyad med na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas mthong ba la chod pa med pa'i phyir ro // de lta ma yin na snang ba la yang khyad med na /
translated: The mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.üîΩThe mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.

original: bar bcas bar med ji ltar rung //
analyzed: bar bcas bar med ji ltar rung //
translated: The mind is not divided, but it is modified in the manner of the object.

original: mthong ba bar dang bcas pa ni go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par shes pa lngas chod pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba bar dang bcas pa ni go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par shes pa lngas chod pa'o //
translated: That which is seen as divided is divided by the five consciousnesses that have the nature of a succession.

original: bar med pa ni rnam par shes pa rigs mi mthun pas mchod pa yin te /
analyzed: bar med pa ni rnam par shes pa rigs mi mthun pas mchod pa yin te /
translated: That which is seen as undivided is divided by a consciousness of a different type.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi nang nas re re yod na rgyun rnam par ma chad pas 'jug par 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi nang nas re re yod na rgyun rnam par ma chad pas 'jug par 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: When one of the six consciousnesses exists, the series is not interrupted and continues.

original: gnas skabs 'dis mthong ba la ji ltar na snang ba tha dad par mi 'gyur te 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dis mthong ba la ji ltar na snang ba tha dad par mi 'gyur te 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, how could the appearance not be different in this state? It is just different.

original: ji ltar skra'i rtse mo la sogs pa bskyod pa la bde ba la sogs pa'i chod pa yod na yang /
analyzed: ji ltar skra'i rtse mo la sogs pa bskyod pa la bde ba la sogs pa'i chod pa yod na yang /
translated: Just as when the tip of a hair and so on is moved, although there is a division of pleasure and so on,

original: sa phyogs rnam par chod pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par mchod pa gang yin pa gnyis po de dag kyang de kho na nyid du tha dad pa nyid du snang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: sa phyogs rnam par chod pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par mchod pa gang yin pa gnyis po de dag kyang de kho na nyid du tha dad pa nyid du snang ba nyid yin no //
translated: both the part of the ground that is divided and the part that is undivided appear as just different in reality.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The same is true of seeing.

original: sbyor ba ni mthong ba gang zhig bar dang bcas pa dang bar med pa gang yin pa de ni tha dad par snang ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni mthong ba gang zhig bar dang bcas pa dang bar med pa gang yin pa de ni tha dad par snang ba yin te /
translated: The argument is as follows: That which is seen with an interval and without an interval is seen separately.

original: dper na mthong ba'i skra'i rtse mo bskyod pas rnam par chod pa dang ma chod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mthong ba'i skra'i rtse mo bskyod pas rnam par chod pa dang ma chod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when the tip of a hair is seen, it is seen with an interval and without an interval, depending on whether it is moved or not.üîΩAnd each consciousness is seen with an interval and without an interval, depending on whether it is obstructed or not obstructed by the five sense consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa re re rna par shes pa lngas chod pa dang ma chod pa la yang bar dang bcas pa dang bar med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa re re rna par shes pa lngas chod pa dang ma chod pa la yang bar dang bcas pa dang bar med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: yid kyi rtog pa 'ga' zhig la'ang /
analyzed: yid kyi rtog pa 'ga' zhig la'ang /
translated: In some mental cognitions,

original: rim du 'dzin par mi 'gyur @174a * //
analyzed: rim du 'dzin par mi 'gyur @174a * //
translated: there is no grasping of sequence.

original: ro // gang gi tshe myur du 'jug pa'i phyir lnga po dag gis chod pa yin na yang /
analyzed: ro // gang gi tshe myur du 'jug pa'i phyir lnga po dag gis chod pa yin na yang /
translated: When the five sense consciousnesses are obstructed, but the seeing is simultaneous,üîΩthen the mental consciousness is obstructed by the five sense consciousnesses,

original: mthong ba cig car mtshams sbyor ba de'i tshe /üîΩdbang po'i shes pa thams cad 'gags pa na /
analyzed: mthong ba cig car mtshams sbyor ba de'i tshe /üîΩdbang po'i shes pa thams cad 'gags pa na /
translated: but the seeing is simultaneous.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes ba 'ba' zhig kyang 'jug pa myur bar 'dra ba yin na yang 'ga' zhig gis kyang chod pa med pa de ltar na ches shin tu rim gyis don 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhing 'dres pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes ba 'ba' zhig kyang 'jug pa myur bar 'dra ba yin na yang 'ga' zhig gis kyang chod pa med pa de ltar na ches shin tu rim gyis don 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhing 'dres pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the mental consciousness alone is similar in its rapid engagement, it is not interrupted by anything, and thus it would not apprehend objects in a very gradual manner, but would apprehend them as mixed.

original: cig car 'dzin bar 'khrul bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig car 'dzin bar 'khrul bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would be mistaken in apprehending them simultaneously.

original: gang gi tshe cig car rnam par shes pa 'jug par khas len pa de'i tshe dbang po'i don thams cad cig car thag nye ba yod na yul gzhan gyis chod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe cig car rnam par shes pa 'jug par khas len pa de'i tshe dbang po'i don thams cad cig car thag nye ba yod na yul gzhan gyis chod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one accepts that consciousnesses engage their objects simultaneously, then all objects of the sense faculties would be apprehended simultaneously, because they are not obstructed by other objects.

original: don dam par nges par 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam par nges par 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not be apprehended in a definite order.üîΩIf one says that consciousnesses do not engage their objects simultaneously, then there is no contradiction in a consciousness that is restricted to a single object arising.

original: gang gi cig car rnam par shes pa mi 'jug pa de'i yul gcig la so sor nges pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba 'gal ba med do zhe na rtog pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi cig car rnam par shes pa mi 'jug pa de'i yul gcig la so sor nges pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba 'gal ba med do zhe na rtog pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That conception is also illogical.

original: 'di ltar yul la lar skyes bu kun tu chags sems can /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul la lar skyes bu kun tu chags sems can /
translated: Thus, in a certain place, a man has a mind of attachment.

original: don nye ba la yang spyod yul du gyur pa 'dzin med gang yul gzhan du 'pho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyur gyur pa'i /
analyzed: don nye ba la yang spyod yul du gyur pa 'dzin med gang yul gzhan du 'pho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyur gyur pa'i /
translated: Also, with regard to an object that is near, it is the cause that is free from apprehending, which has the characteristic of not transferring to another object.

original: chags pas gzhan bskyed nus bral phyir //
analyzed: chags pas gzhan bskyed nus bral phyir //
translated: Because it is free from the ability to generate another through attachment.

original: yul gzhan 'dzin ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i rgyu'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: yul gzhan 'dzin ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i rgyu'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is because it is free from the ability to generate a consciousness that apprehends another object.

original: rnam par shes pa rim bzhin du byung ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rim bzhin du byung ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it has the nature of arising in sequence.

original: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par shes pa cig shos phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yin pa de ltar na yid kyi yul gzhan la rnam par g-yongs  pa na sngar gyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yid la byed
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par shes pa cig shos phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yin pa de ltar na yid kyi yul gzhan la rnam par g-yongs  pa na sngar gyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yid la byed
translated: Thus, conceptualization and consciousness are mutually the entity of cause and effect. In that case, when the mind is distracted to another object, the power of the mental attention that has the characteristic of a previous consciousness is absent.

original: pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir dang yul spyod yul du gyur pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir dang yul spyod yul du gyur pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: And it apprehends an object that is its domain.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rkyen ji lta ba bzhin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rkyen ji lta ba bzhin zhes gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said, ‚Äúin accordance with the conditions.‚Äù

original: yul mngon du phyogs pa tsam ni rkyen ma yin gyi 'on kyang yid la byed pa yang yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: yul mngon du phyogs pa tsam ni rkyen ma yin gyi 'on kyang yid la byed pa yang yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
translated: It is not the case that the mere presence of the object is the condition, but rather the attention is also a condition. Thus there is no contradiction.

original: gnyi ga yi yang de brtsad yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga yi yang de brtsad yin //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs objection applies equally to you.

original: ji ltar kho bo cag la brtsad pa de de ltar rnam par shes pa rim bzhin du 'jug par smras pa la yang ci'i phyir yul spyod yul du gyur pa 'ga' @174b zhig la yang mi 'dzin zhes brtsad pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar kho bo cag la brtsad pa de de ltar rnam par shes pa rim bzhin du 'jug par smras pa la yang ci'i phyir yul spyod yul du gyur pa 'ga' @174b zhig la yang mi 'dzin zhes brtsad pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Just as the opponent objects to us, so too the opponent objects to the one who maintains that consciousness arises in sequence, saying, ‚ÄúWhy does it not apprehend any object that is present?‚Äù

original: de bas na des kyang len snga ma 'di nyid la brten par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na des kyang len snga ma 'di nyid la brten par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the opponent should direct this very same objection to himself.

original: gal te ma yin pa'i de'i yang skyon 'di nyid yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: gal te ma yin pa'i de'i yang skyon 'di nyid yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: If the opponent does not accept this, then the opponent‚Äôs objection is flawed.

original: de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: But in any case, the opponent‚Äôs objection is not appropriate.

original: gzhan yang ma gal me mthong ba rnam par chad pa med par snang ba can gang yin pa de mthong mtshams sbyor bas ma yin /
