analyzed: gzhan yang ma gal me mthong ba rnam par chad pa med par snang ba can gang yin pa de mthong mtshams sbyor bas ma yin /
translated: Moreover, the opponent‚Äôs objection is flawed because the visual consciousness that sees a fire wheel does not see without interruption.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: mig gi dbang po de ni 'khor lo 'khrul byas kyi /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po de ni 'khor lo 'khrul byas kyi /
translated: The eye faculty is a wheel that is constructed by error.

original: 'khrul pa gang gis gcig tu zhen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa gang gis gcig tu zhen par byed pa'o //
translated: By what error is it conceived as one?

original: mig ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: mig ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the eye like?

original: myur 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: myur 'jug phyir ro //
translated: Because it quickly engages.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mgal me la sogs so //
analyzed: mgal me la sogs so //
translated: A firebrand and so on.

original: rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa rjes su zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa rjes su zhugs pa ste /
translated: That which is subsequent is that which follows.

original: yul rung ban gnas pa der 'phen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul rung ban gnas pa der 'phen par byed pa'o //
translated: It is that which impels the eye to a suitable place.

original: de dang der de 'dra ba de la mthong ba 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang der de 'dra ba de la mthong ba 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is like that in that place is called the error of seeing.

original: des na myur du yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can gyi mgal me rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pas gnod pa mig gang la yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: des na myur du yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can gyi mgal me rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pas gnod pa mig gang la yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the eye that has the property of quickly arising in another place is that which has the error of a wheel by virtue of what is subsequent. The words should be connected in this way.

original: de 'dra ba'i mig don gyis stong pa 'khor lor 'khrul pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i mig don gyis stong pa 'khor lor 'khrul pa byas pa yin no //
translated: The eye that is like that is empty of an object and is constructed as a wheel by error.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this digression.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
translated: perception is free from conceptuality.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis grub par 'gyur //
translated: It is established by direct perception itself.

original: zhes bya ba de ni gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the position.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la yang sgra 'god pa med pa'i phyir dang / de dang 'brel pa med pa can gyi don 'dzin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la yang sgra 'god pa med pa'i phyir dang / de dang 'brel pa med pa can gyi don 'dzin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: And because the word is not applied to the particular, and because the object which is not related to the word is apprehended, the cognition is free from conceptual construction.

original: srid pa'i bdag la sogs pa la lar dbang skyes la sogs phyir gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i bdag la sogs pa la lar dbang skyes la sogs phyir gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
translated: And because the word is applied to the universal, and because the reason is present, as in the case of the cognition born of the senses, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni yid las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni yid las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is meant to include the fact that the cognition is not born of the mind and the fact that it operates by the mode of experience.

original: skyes bu brda la byang ba'i dbang po'i shes pa rtog med yin par smra'o //
analyzed: skyes bu brda la byang ba'i dbang po'i shes pa rtog med yin par smra'o //
translated: We maintain that the cognition born of the senses of a person who is skilled in conventional linguistic practice is nonconceptual.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /üîΩbyis pa'i blo bzhin te /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na / byis pa'i blo bzhin te /
translated: What is it like?üîΩLike the cognition of a child.

original: de skyes pa'i byis pa chung ngu'i dbang po'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de skyes pa'i byis pa chung ngu'i dbang po'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the cognition of a small child when he sees something for the first time.

original: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyir byis pa'i rnam rtog ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyir byis pa'i rnam rtog ces bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to prove the example, he says, ‚Äúthe conceptual thought of a child.‚Äù

original: byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa ni rtog pa med ba nyid du rab tu grags pa'i rgyu ni smra ba yin //
analyzed: byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa ni rtog pa med ba nyid du rab tu grags pa'i rgyu ni smra ba yin //
translated: The sense consciousness of a child is well known to be non-conceptual. The reason is stated:

original: gang zhe na brda nyams pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang zhe na brda nyams pa nyid yin te /
translated: ‚Äúbecause of the loss of the sign.‚Äù

original: byis pa rnams la brda 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la brda 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Children do not have the ability to grasp the sign.

original: sbyor ba ni skyes bu gang gis don gang gi 'brel ba gang dang lhan cig mi 'dzin pa de ni de dang lhan cig sbyar nas 'dzin pa de ni ma @175a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni skyes bu gang gis don gang gi 'brel ba gang dang lhan cig mi 'dzin pa de ni de dang lhan cig sbyar nas 'dzin pa de ni ma @175a * //
translated: The syllogism is: ‚ÄúA person who does not grasp the connection of a certain object with a certain sign does not grasp it when it is connected with that sign,

original: yin te / dper na skyes bus nye ba'i ba lang can dang / lhan cig de'i skyes bu'i 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yin te / dper na skyes bus nye ba'i ba lang can dang / lhan cig de'i skyes bu'i 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, a person does not grasp the connection of a cow with the word ‚Äòcow.‚ÄôüîΩA child does not grasp the connection of a word with its object.‚Äù

original: byis pas kyang sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dpe grub pa na rgyu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byis pas kyang sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dpe grub pa na rgyu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: When this example is established, the non-apprehension of a reason is understood.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub pa dang dgag pa la bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / 'gal ba rab tu ma bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid ldog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub pa dang dgag pa la bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / 'gal ba rab tu ma bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid ldog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But when the proof and the refutation are reversed, since a valid cognition that is a counter-percipient is not seen, and since the contradiction is not well-established, the remainder of the inference cannot be reversed.

original: gzhan yang byis pas kyang sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa yang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang byis pas kyang sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa yang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the pervasion of the reason ‚Äúeven the childish do not apprehend the relation between the word and the object‚Äù is not established.

original: de de ltar na rgol ba de dag gi ni /
analyzed: de de ltar na rgol ba de dag gi ni /
translated: Thus, for those disputants,

original: byis pa'i mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa'i mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: it would be the direct perception of the childish,

original: shes pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shes pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: but it would not be knowledge.

original: dpyod par byed pa cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: It would not be the slightest bit analytical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtog med phyir rtog pa med pa nyid kyang brda 'dzin par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog med phyir rtog pa med pa nyid kyang brda 'dzin par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is non-conceptual, and non-conceptual cognition is not able to apprehend a sign.

original: gal te de ltar 'gyur ba la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'gyur ba la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If it were like that, what would be the problem?

original: de de ltar na 'gyur ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar na 'gyur ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If it were like that, it would not be logical.

original: mngon sum mthong ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum mthong ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the direct perception of seeing.

original: de ltar na byis pa zas 'dod pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na byis pa zas 'dod pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the child engages in the desire for food, etc.

original: de dag kyang dran pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa med cing /
analyzed: de dag kyang dran pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa med cing /
translated: And those are not without consciousness that is memory.

original: de yang gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa yin pa de ltar na gang las rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin /
analyzed: de yang gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa yin pa de ltar na gang las rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin /
translated: And that is certainly conceptual. Thus, how can there be non-conceptuality?

original: gzhan yang gal te byis pa de'i shes pa rnam par rtog ba dpyod pa dang bcas pa brda byang ba las sngar med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /üîΩbrda'i rgyur gyur pa rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir brda de ni brda 'dzin pa'i dus phyis kyang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te byis pa de'i shes pa rnam par rtog ba dpyod pa dang bcas pa brda byang ba las sngar med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe / brda'i rgyur gyur pa rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir brda de ni brda 'dzin pa'i dus phyis kyang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the child‚Äôs consciousness were to be without conceptualization and analysis prior to the learning of signs,üîΩthen the sign would not be, because it would be devoid of the conceptual consciousness that is the cause of the sign.

original: rnam par dpyod bar byed pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa med pa'i phyir skyes bu shi ba'i mthar thug par rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang mi ldan pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod bar byed pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa med pa'i phyir skyes bu shi ba'i mthar thug par rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang mi ldan pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the sign would not be, even after the time of the apprehension of the sign, because the cause of the consciousness that analyzes would not exist. Thus, the person would finally die and attain the state of being devoid of conceptual consciousness.

original: ci ste rnam par dpyod pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar de'i tshe 'o na brda rtog pa'i thabs med pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi rgyur mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: ci ste rnam par dpyod pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar de'i tshe 'o na brda rtog pa'i thabs med pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi rgyur mi 'grub bo //
translated: But if analysis itself does not exist, then at that time, the absence of the method of conceptualizing signs is not established as the cause of nonconceptuality.

original: de ltar na byis pa gzhon nu'i rgyud la gnas pa'i dbang po'i shes pa yang rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba'i phyir dper ma grub pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na byis pa gzhon nu'i rgyud la gnas pa'i dbang po'i shes pa yang rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba'i phyir dper ma grub pa yin no /
translated: Thus, because the sense consciousnesses that exist in the mindstreams of young children would also become conceptual, the example is not established.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po nyi shu bdun pa /üîΩgal te brda la ma byang ba'i //
analyzed: bam po nyi shu bdun pa / gal te brda la ma byang ba'i //
translated: Chapter Twenty-SevenüîΩIf the mind of one not trained in signs

original: yid byis pa brda la ma byang du zin kyang /
analyzed: yid byis pa brda la ma byang du zin kyang /
translated: Even though the mind of a child not trained in signs

original: dpyod par byed @175b pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brda'i rgyur gyur pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod /
analyzed: dpyod par byed @175b pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brda'i rgyur gyur pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod /
translated: is an analyzer, it is a mental consciousness that is the cause of signs.

original: rnam par dpyod par byed pa'i yid des ni brda yin par 'dod pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod par byed pa'i yid des ni brda yin par 'dod pa de ltar na /
translated: That mind that analyzes in that way is asserted to be a sign.

original: brda yi rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: brda yi rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause it is devoid of the cause of signs‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: is a reason that is not established.

original: de'i tshe ji ltar de la yid brda la ma byang ba'i rnam par dpyod par byed pa nyid yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar de la yid brda la ma byang ba'i rnam par dpyod par byed pa nyid yin par 'dod na /
translated: At that time, if you maintain that the mental consciousness is the analyzer,

original: de bzhin dbang skyes la yang 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin dbang skyes la yang 'gyur //
translated: then the same would be true of the sense consciousnesses.

original: gal te yang de la sgra dang 'dra ba med pa de ltar na yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par dpyod par byed pa yin pa bzhin du dbang po'i shes pa nges pa'i bdag nyid can brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gal te yang de la sgra dang 'dra ba med pa de ltar na yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par dpyod par byed pa yin pa bzhin du dbang po'i shes pa nges pa'i bdag nyid can brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba 'byung ba la /
translated: Even if there is no sound-like object for the mental consciousness, it is still the analyzer. In the same way, even though the sense consciousnesses do not have a sound-like object, they are still the ascertainer.

original: 'thad pa brjod pa med pa'i phyir bzlog pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'thad pa brjod pa med pa'i phyir bzlog pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since there is no statement of a reason, there is no refutation.

original: de ltar dpe ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dpe ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the example is not established.

original: 'di 'dra 'di yang lhag ldan yin //
analyzed: 'di 'dra 'di yang lhag ldan yin //
translated: This is also a remainder.

original: dbang skyes la sogs phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtags ni bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag la 'brel pa dang 'gal ba ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang skyes la sogs phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtags ni bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag la 'brel pa dang 'gal ba ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause of being sense consciousness, etc.‚Äù is not established because the relation and contradiction between the probandum and the probandum are not established.

original: ci ste yang byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa go bar byed pa'i rtags gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa med par rab tu bsgrubs pa dpe nyid du bstan pa de'i tshe byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa la sgrub byed gang yin nyid /
analyzed: ci ste yang byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa go bar byed pa'i rtags gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa med par rab tu bsgrubs pa dpe nyid du bstan pa de'i tshe byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa la sgrub byed gang yin nyid /
translated: But if you say that the example of the nonconceptual cognition of a child‚Äôs sense consciousness is established without the reason that is understood by the sense consciousness of a child, then at that time, whatever is the proof of the sense consciousness of a child,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar grub par rung zhes brjod pa'i sgrub byed /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar grub par rung zhes brjod pa'i sgrub byed /
translated: that proof is also suitable to be established as free from conceptuality.

original: de nyid 'dir yang skyes bu brda la byang ba'i dbang po shes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du bsgrub pa yang brjod bya ste bstan par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de nyid 'dir yang skyes bu brda la byang ba'i dbang po shes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du bsgrub pa yang brjod bya ste bstan par bya ba yin na /
translated: If that is the case, then the proof that the cognition of a person who is skilled in signs is nonconceptual should also be stated.

original: dbang skyes la sogs phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar 'god pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: dbang skyes la sogs phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar 'god pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of positing the reason ‚Äúbecause of being a sense consciousness‚Äù and so on?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po'i blo dag mtshungs phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo dag mtshungs phyir ro //
translated: Because the sense consciousnesses are the same.

original: skyes bu brda la byang ba dang byis pa'i dbang po shes pa gang yin pa de dag la so so'i khyad par cung zad kyang med na /
analyzed: skyes bu brda la byang ba dang byis pa'i dbang po shes pa gang yin pa de dag la so so'i khyad par cung zad kyang med na /
translated: If there is not the slightest difference between the cognition of a person who is skilled in signs and the cognition of a child‚Äôs sense consciousness,

original: gang gis na byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa bsgrub par bya ba de las gzhan pa'i dpe nyid yin /
analyzed: gang gis na byis pa'i dbang po'i shes pa bsgrub par bya ba de las gzhan pa'i dpe nyid yin /
translated: What is the example that is different from that which establishes the sense consciousness of a fool?

original: 'dis ni myong sogs bshad pa yin //
analyzed: 'dis ni myong sogs bshad pa yin //
translated: This explains ‚Äúexperience‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon gang yin pa de dag thams cad las nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yid las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rigs kyi thal bar 'gyur ba de ltar na de bas na /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon gang yin pa de dag thams cad las nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yid las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rigs kyi thal bar 'gyur ba de ltar na de bas na /
translated: All the faults of the reason ‚Äúbecause it arises from the sense faculties‚Äù and the faults of the reason ‚Äúbecause it engages its object through the aspect of experience‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause it is not mental‚Äù are refuted by this.

original: 'di ji lta bar 'dir gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩzhar la 'ong ba bstan nas da ni rnam par rtog pa med pa @176a * //
analyzed: 'di ji lta bar 'dir gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no // zhar la 'ong ba bstan nas da ni rnam par rtog pa med pa @176a * //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that this is not a reason here.

original: nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the digression, now, in order to prove that it is nonconceptual,

original: slob dpon nyid kyis rig pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis rig pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the master himself teaches another reasoning.

original: khyad par dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To that end, he says ‚Äúdistinctive‚Äù and so on.

original: gang zhig gang gis khyad par can du rtogs pa de'i rtogs pa'i rnam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis khyad par can du rtogs pa de'i rtogs pa'i rnam pa 'di yin te /
translated: The form of the cognition of that which is qualified by that is as follows.

original: 'di ltar shes pas khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi snang ba tha dad pa can dang rang gi ngo bor bzung nas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pas khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi snang ba tha dad pa can dang rang gi ngo bor bzung nas so //
translated: Because of knowing it thus, the appearance of the qualifier and the qualified as different and apprehended as their own entity,

original: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa de dag ni /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa de dag ni /
translated: those which are characterized as different from the qualifier and the qualified,

original: 'brel ba dang 'jig rten gzhung lugs ni /
analyzed: 'brel ba dang 'jig rten gzhung lugs ni /
translated: are related to the worldly scriptural tradition.

original: sgra'i tha snyad kyi rig pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i tha snyad kyi rig pa'o //
translated: That is the science of verbal conventions.

original: phyis des khyad par can 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: phyis des khyad par can 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Later, it apprehends the qualified by that.

original: dper na rang gi ngo bo bzung ba can gyi lha sbyin de las ldog pa'i ngo bo can gyi dbyug pa 'dzin pas khyad par can du gyur pa rtogs pa na /
analyzed: dper na rang gi ngo bo bzung ba can gyi lha sbyin de las ldog pa'i ngo bo can gyi dbyug pa 'dzin pas khyad par can du gyur pa rtogs pa na /
translated: For example, when one apprehends Devadatta, who has the nature of being apprehended, as qualified by a stick, which has the nature of being different from him,

original: dbyug pa can zhes bzung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbyug pa can zhes bzung ba lta bu'o //
translated: it is like apprehending ‚Äúthe one with a stick.‚Äù

original: de de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khyad par la sogs pa bzung nas de dag gcig byas nas /
analyzed: de de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khyad par la sogs pa bzung nas de dag gcig byas nas /
translated: Thus, having apprehended the qualifier and so on of the world, they are made one.

original: khyad par la sogs pa bsres nas khyad par dang ldan pa'i don de ltar rtogs kyi gzhan min te /
analyzed: khyad par la sogs pa bsres nas khyad par dang ldan pa'i don de ltar rtogs kyi gzhan min te /
translated: But when the qualifier is mixed with the qualified, the object is understood as possessing the qualifier, not otherwise.

original: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi dang 'brel pa dang / 'jig rten gyi gzhung lugs rnams rtogs pa med na bsres nas 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi dang 'brel pa dang / 'jig rten gyi gzhung lugs rnams rtogs pa med na bsres nas 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: If the connection between the qualifier and the qualified, and the understanding of the worldly conventions, were not present, the object would not be apprehended as mixed.

original: gang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe dper na dbyug pa can bzhin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe dper na dbyug pa can bzhin /
translated: When that is so, then, just as in the case of the expression ‚Äúholder of the stick,‚Äù

original: lha sbyin dang dbyug pa bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du snang bas de dag gi 'brel pa la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa de'i tshe dbyug pa can zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi bzlog pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin dang dbyug pa bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du snang bas de dag gi 'brel pa la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa de'i tshe dbyug pa can zhes rtogs par 'gyur gyi bzlog pa las ma yin no //
translated: since Devadatta and the stick appear as they are, the connection between them and so on are indicated, and at that time, the expression ‚Äúholder of the stick‚Äù is understood, not otherwise.

original: de ltar na 'di ni rigs yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni rigs yin la /
translated: Thus, this is the correct method.

original: 'di ni rigs dang ldan pa yin no zhes rnam par 'byed pas rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang yon tan dang ldan pa dang / las dang las dang ldan pa dang / rva dang rva dang ldan pa'i ngo bo dbang po'i blo la snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs dang ldan pa yin no zhes rnam par 'byed pas rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang yon tan dang ldan pa dang / las dang las dang ldan pa dang / rva dang rva dang ldan pa'i ngo bo dbang po'i blo la snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the senses does not perceive a thing as having a class or having a quality or having an action or having a universal.üîΩ Because the cognition of the senses does not perceive a thing as having a class, etc., it is not possible to apprehend a thing as having a class, etc., by superimposing the appearance of a class, etc., on the thing, as is done in the case of the cognition of a stick-holder.

original: gang gi phyir snang ba nye bar mtshon pa'i ngo bor bsres nas dbyug pa can bzhin du de dang ldan pa de 'dzin par 'gyur pa de'i phyir snang ba tha dad pa med na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba nye bar mtshon pa'i ngo bor bsres nas dbyug pa can bzhin du de dang ldan pa de 'dzin par 'gyur pa de'i phyir snang ba tha dad pa med na /
translated: Therefore, if the appearance is not different,

original: rigs sogs kyis bye brag dpyod pa med phyir /
analyzed: rigs sogs kyis bye brag dpyod pa med phyir /
translated: the class, etc., cannot be distinguished.

original: ji ltar dbyig pa 'dzin par 'gyur /üîΩde bas na snang ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i rigs la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dbyig pa 'dzin par 'gyur / de bas na snang ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i rigs la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: How can one apprehend a stick-holder?üîΩTherefore, the class, etc., are not accepted as appearances.

original: rigs la sogs pa de ltar na rigs la sogs dang ldan pa sbyor dag med pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa de ltar na rigs la sogs dang ldan pa sbyor dag med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cognition of the senses does not apprehend a thing as having a class, etc.

original: de ltar na gang zhig gang las tha dad par blo la snang ba de ni 'ga' zhig gi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang zhig gang las tha dad par blo la snang ba de ni 'ga' zhig gi khyad par yin no //
translated: Thus, that which appears to the mind as different from something else is a particular of something.

original: 'brel ba can tha dad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med @176b pas na 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba can tha dad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med @176b pas na 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cognition of a related object that is different, there is no cognition of it. Therefore, the relation is not established.

original: bsre ba med pa de'i phyir 'di la rigs dang ldan pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsre ba med pa de'i phyir 'di la rigs dang ldan pa la sogs pa la /
translated: Because there is no mixing, there is no cognition of a universal in something that possesses a universal, etc.

original: rtogs pa'ang med /
analyzed: rtogs pa'ang med /
translated: There is no cognition.

original: sgra'i rtog pa 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur ba de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i rtog pa 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur ba de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Only the conception of a word remains. But that also does not exist, as has been explained by the arguments.

original: byed pa 'di tsam gyis kyang dbang po'i shes pa byed par nus pa ma yin pa de ltar na de brjod pa dang 'dres pa'i don 'dzin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gang las yin /
analyzed: byed pa 'di tsam gyis kyang dbang po'i shes pa byed par nus pa ma yin pa de ltar na de brjod pa dang 'dres pa'i don 'dzin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gang las yin /
translated: This much activity is not capable of producing a sense perception. Thus, how can it be the nature of a sense perception to apprehend an object that is mixed with an expression?

original: de ltar na rtogs pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rtogs pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no cognition of a universal.

original: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi spyi med na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi spyi med na /
translated: If there is no universal that is related to the particulars,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa can gyi ba lang la sogs pa'i gsal ba la shes pa 'di rjes su 'gro ba can der mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa can gyi ba lang la sogs pa'i gsal ba la shes pa 'di rjes su 'gro ba can der mi 'gyur na /
translated: If this consciousness were not to follow the particular cow, etc.,

original: de yang yod pa de'i phyir spyi yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang yod pa de'i phyir spyi yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then since it does exist, the universal exists.

original: rjes 'gro can gyi rnam shes gang //
analyzed: rjes 'gro can gyi rnam shes gang //
translated: What consciousness follows

original: spyi rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa'o //
analyzed: spyi rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa'o //
translated: is stated in order to establish the universal.

original: de yang sgra dang gsal bar snang //
analyzed: de yang sgra dang gsal bar snang //
translated: It appears as sound and as the particular.

original: sems de la ba lang gi kha dog dang dbyibs dang ming 'ga' zhig snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sems de la ba lang gi kha dog dang dbyibs dang ming 'ga' zhig snang ba yin gyi /
translated: In that consciousness, the color, shape, and name of the cow appear,

original: rang gi bdag nyid la yang spyi'i ngo bo kha dog dang dbyibs dang ming gi rnam pa tha dad par gzung ba nyid du snang ba ma yin na /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la yang spyi'i ngo bo kha dog dang dbyibs dang ming gi rnam pa tha dad par gzung ba nyid du snang ba ma yin na /
translated: but the universal does not appear to be apprehended as having a different aspect of color, shape, and name from itself.

original: gang las rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pa 'di las phyi rol tu grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang las rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pa 'di las phyi rol tu grub pa yin te /
translated: From what is this consciousness that follows it established as external?

original: spyi ni kha dog la sogs pa snang ba ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar / kha dog dbyibs yig rnam pa yis //
analyzed: spyi ni kha dog la sogs pa snang ba ma yin no // 'di ltar / kha dog dbyibs yig rnam pa yis //
translated: The universal does not appear as color, etc.üîΩThus:

original: stong pa ba lang nyid du brjod //
analyzed: stong pa ba lang nyid du brjod //
translated: The universal of cow is said to be empty of the aspects of color, shape, and letters.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang ming gi rnam pa dang bral ba'i spyi brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang ming gi rnam pa dang bral ba'i spyi brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is a universal that is devoid of the aspects of color and shape, such as blue, and of the aspects of names.

original: de yang ji ltar snang ba bzhin gyi kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa gsum las tha dad pa'i spyi'i rnam pa nye bar mtshon pa med cing /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar snang ba bzhin gyi kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa gsum las tha dad pa'i spyi'i rnam pa nye bar mtshon pa med cing /
translated: Moreover, it is not a universal that is characterized by a mode that is different from the three modes of color, etc., as they appear.

original: nye bar ma mtshon pa yang yod pa nyid du khas len pas /
analyzed: nye bar ma mtshon pa yang yod pa nyid du khas len pas /
translated: And since it is accepted as existing,

original: ji ltar na bdag dang gzhan slu bar byed /üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag dang gzhan slu bar byed / de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: how can it deceive others and oneself?

original: de nyid mtshungs pa nyid yang /
analyzed: de nyid mtshungs pa nyid yang /
translated: This is so, but it is the same for you.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang sgrar snang ba gang yin pa de nyid spyi nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang sgrar snang ba gang yin pa de nyid spyi nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The appearance of color, shape, and sound is a universal.

original: gal te yang rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa de ltar na yang kha dog la sogs par snang ba'i spyir 'dod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gal te yang rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa de ltar na yang kha dog la sogs par snang ba'i spyir 'dod pa 'di ni /
translated: If it is not to be analyzed, then this universal that is accepted as the appearance of color, etc.,

original: mig gi spyod yul la mthong med //
analyzed: mig gi spyod yul la mthong med //
translated: is not seen in the domain of the eye.

original: dbang po'i yul gyi don la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i kha dog la sogs pa'i snang ba mi gsal ba 'di snang ba gsal ba can gyi dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba yod pa ma yin nam gang gis naüîΩmtshungs pa nyid du snang bar brtags pa des dbang po'i rnam par shes pas don khyad par can @177a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul gyi don la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i kha dog la sogs pa'i snang ba mi gsal ba 'di snang ba gsal ba can gyi dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba yod pa ma yin nam gang gis na mtshungs pa nyid du snang bar brtags pa des dbang po'i rnam par shes pas don khyad par can @177a * //
translated: Don‚Äôt the appearances of color, etc., that appear to the conceptual consciousnesses that are the objects of the sense faculties exist in the appearances of the sense consciousnesses that have clear appearances?

original: rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you imagine that they appear in the same way, then the sense consciousnesses would understand the special object.

original: gang gis mngon sum rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe conceptual sense consciousness‚Äù is that.

original: sbyor ba yang gang gis gang las tha dad par rtogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang gis gang las tha dad par rtogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The application is this: that which does not understand the difference between the two

original: des khyad par can du byas pa'i don de 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des khyad par can du byas pa'i don de 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: does not apprehend the object that is qualified by that.

original: dper na chu nyung zad dang 'dres pa can gyi 'o ma de dag gi tha dad pa mthong ba'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu nyung zad dang 'dres pa can gyi 'o ma de dag gi tha dad pa mthong ba'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the milk that is mixed with a little water, which does not have the nature of seeing the difference between them.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig gi yul gsal ba'i ngo bo las tha dad par kha dog dang dbyibs dang / yi ge'i rnam pa'i ngo bo can gyi rigs rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig gi yul gsal ba'i ngo bo las tha dad par kha dog dang dbyibs dang / yi ge'i rnam pa'i ngo bo can gyi rigs rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness does not cognize a type that has the nature of color and shape and the aspect of letters, separate from the nature of the object of the eye that is the clear appearance. This is the non-observation of a cause.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: 'di ltar dbang po'i blo la kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ngo bo gsal ba gcig nyid snang gis /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po'i blo la kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ngo bo gsal ba gcig nyid snang gis /
translated: Thus, in the cognition of the sense faculty, only the nature of the clear appearance of color and shape appears.

original: gzhan snang ba mi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan snang ba mi gsal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The other, the unclear appearance, does not.

original: snang ba gnyis ni med phyir yang //
analyzed: snang ba gnyis ni med phyir yang //
translated: Because there are not two appearances,

original: blo yi tha dad rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: blo yi tha dad rnyed par dka' //
translated: it is difficult to find a difference in cognition.

original: kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa de las tha dad pa gsal ba'i ngo bo dag gis sna tshogs par snang ba dbang po'i shes pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa de las tha dad pa gsal ba'i ngo bo dag gis sna tshogs par snang ba dbang po'i shes pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the variety that appears as different from the aspect of color and so on, with a clear nature, does not exist in the sense consciousness.

original: gzhan yang / dbang pos 'phrod 'du 'dzin med phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dbang pos 'phrod 'du 'dzin med phyir //
translated: Moreover: Because there is no apprehension of the meeting of the sense faculty,

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pas na rigs dang de dag ldan pa dag gi 'phrod pa 'du ba 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pas na rigs dang de dag ldan pa dag gi 'phrod pa 'du ba 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the contact of the sense faculty and object is beyond the scope of the sense faculty, the contact of the sense faculty and object of those who possess the sense faculty is not apprehended.

original: 'brel pa mthong ba med par gnas //
analyzed: 'brel pa mthong ba med par gnas //
translated: Therefore, the connection is not seen.

original: grub pa yin pa de ltar na rigs kyis khyad par du byas pa'i don rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grub pa yin pa de ltar na rigs kyis khyad par du byas pa'i don rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the object qualified by the sense faculty is not cognized.

original: sbyor bas ni gang gis gang dag gi 'brel pa rtogs pa ma yin pa des ni des khyad par can du byas pa'i don de 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor bas ni gang gis gang dag gi 'brel pa rtogs pa ma yin pa des ni des khyad par can du byas pa'i don de 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: By the application, it is shown that one does not apprehend the object qualified by that sense faculty by means of which one does not cognize the connection of that sense faculty and object.

original: dper na skyes bus lha sbyin dang dbyug pa'i 'brel pa ma mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bus lha sbyin dang dbyug pa'i 'brel pa ma mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a person does not see the connection of Devadatta and the stick.

original: dbang po'i shes pas kyang rigs kyi 'brel pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas kyang rigs kyi 'brel pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The sense faculty consciousness also does not cognize the connection of the sense faculty and object. This is the non-apprehension of the cause.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true.

original: gal te 'phrod pa 'du ba yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'phrod pa 'du ba yod pa yin na /
translated: But if the contact of the sense faculty and object exists,üîΩthen the object qualified by the sense faculty would be cognized.

original: ji ltar na snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could the idea ‚ÄúThis is cloth‚Äù arise in regard to threads?

original: de ltar na gang dang gang blo yin pa de dang de ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na gang dang gang blo yin pa de dang de ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, whatever is an idea is accompanied by a reason,

original: dper na mig la sogs pa'i blo lta bu'o //üîΩde bas na 'dis rgyu mtshan dang bcas par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o 'di'i blo'i rgyu mtshan ni snal ma'am snam bu 'ba' zhig gam /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa'i blo lta bu'o // de bas na 'dis rgyu mtshan dang bcas par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o 'di'i blo'i rgyu mtshan ni snal ma'am snam bu 'ba' zhig gam /
translated: like the idea of eye, etc.

original: gnyi ga yang ma yin @177b pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ma yin @177b pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this idea is accompanied by a reason. Is the reason for this idea only the threads or the cloth or neither?

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan gang yin pa ni 'phrod pa 'du ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan gang yin pa ni 'phrod pa 'du ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the reason is the collection of threads.

original: de ni 'dir /üîΩsnal ma 'di la snam bu sogs //
analyzed: de ni 'dir / snal ma 'di la snam bu sogs //
translated: But here,üîΩThe words ‚Äúthis cloth,‚Äù etc.,

original: sgra 'di rnams kyang rang gis byas //
analyzed: sgra 'di rnams kyang rang gis byas //
translated: are applied to the threads by convention.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis 'os pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis 'os pa ma yin zhing //
translated: They are not appropriate by the power of entities,

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: nor are they worldly conventions.

original: dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa can gyi sgra rang gis sbyar ba rnams ni don 'chad pa la gzhan brgal cing brtag pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa can gyi sgra rang gis sbyar ba rnams ni don 'chad pa la gzhan brgal cing brtag pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not proper to challenge and examine another person in order to explain the meaning of words that he himself has employed and that are related to non-entities.

original: ji skad du bstan pa 'dis ni 'di las blo de 'dra ba nyid ni dngos po las ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa 'dis ni 'di las blo de 'dra ba nyid ni dngos po las ma yin zhing /
translated: By this teaching, it is shown that the cognition is not like that in regard to entities,

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pas yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pas yin pa de ltar na /
translated: but is so in regard to what is renowned in the world.

original: chos can ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos can ma grub pa'i skyon bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the fault of the unestablished subject is shown.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos can ma grub pa de nyid la 'jug par byed do //üîΩba lang la rva zhes 'jig rten /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos can ma grub pa de nyid la 'jug par byed do // ba lang la rva zhes 'jig rten /
translated: In order to introduce the unestablished subject itself, he says, ‚ÄúThe world, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe world does not say, ‚ÄúThe horn of the cow.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten na ba lang la rva zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tha snyad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ba lang la rva zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tha snyad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The world does not make the convention, ‚ÄúThe horn of the cow.‚Äù

original: gang yang khyed cag gis rva la ba lang zhes brjod pa de ni 'jig rten min /
analyzed: gang yang khyed cag gis rva la ba lang zhes brjod pa de ni 'jig rten min /
translated: And what you say, ‚ÄúThe cow is the horn,‚Äù is not the world.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so.

original: rva la ba lang ngam ba lang la rva zhes 'gyur ba ni bla ste /
analyzed: rva la ba lang ngam ba lang la rva zhes 'gyur ba ni bla ste /
translated: But it is better to say, ‚ÄúThe cow is the horn‚Äù or ‚ÄúThe horn is the cow.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang 'di la zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i 'brel pa ni ma bzlog pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di la zhes bya ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i 'brel pa ni ma bzlog pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But the relation that is the reason for the expression ‚Äúthis‚Äù is not refuted.

original: 'dir de ltar brtags pa de yang yid la re ba tsam nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir de ltar brtags pa de yang yid la re ba tsam nyid yin no //
translated: But this investigation is merely wishful thinking.

original: de ltar 'phrod pa 'du ba las 'jig rten 'di la ba lang zhes bya ba'i tha snyad byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'phrod pa 'du ba las 'jig rten 'di la ba lang zhes bya ba'i tha snyad byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The expression ‚Äúthis world‚Äù is not made by the contact of the elements.

original: de ni dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is beyond the senses.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: ba lang zhes lhag yan lag rnams //
analyzed: ba lang zhes lhag yan lag rnams //
translated: The name ‚Äúcow‚Äù is applied to the remaining parts

original: rnam chad dmigs su med phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam chad dmigs su med phyir ro //
translated: Because the horn is not perceived when it is removed.

original: rva rnam par dor nas ba lang gi ming can nog dang ldog shal dang mjug ma dang rmig pa ste yan lag lhag ma gang yin pa 'og nas gnas pa de dag dang 'brel ba'i steng gi rva zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rva rnam par dor nas ba lang gi ming can nog dang ldog shal dang mjug ma dang rmig pa ste yan lag lhag ma gang yin pa 'og nas gnas pa de dag dang 'brel ba'i steng gi rva zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The name ‚Äúcow‚Äù is applied to the remaining parts‚Äîthe hump, dewlap, tail, and hooves‚Äîwhich are connected to the parts below, when the horn is removed.

original: 'phrod pa 'du bas byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du bas byas pa ma yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthis world‚Äù is not made by the contact of the elements.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i yan lag lhag ma rnams dang / 'bras bu rva ni rang gi rgyud dang yul rnam par ma chad par skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i yan lag lhag ma rnams dang / 'bras bu rva ni rang gi rgyud dang yul rnam par ma chad par skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the remaining limbs of seeing are the result of the eye, because they are born from the eye, which is their cause.üîΩThe horn is the result of the horn‚Äôs own continuum and object, because it is born from the horn‚Äôs own continuum and object, which are not cut off.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi rva chags pa gsal ba gzhan gyi rva'i gnas dang 'brel pa la rnam par chad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'di la blo 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi rva chags pa gsal ba gzhan gyi rva'i gnas dang 'brel pa la rnam par chad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'di la blo 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: In this way, the horn of one manifestation that is connected to another manifestation is not observed to be cut off from the place of the horn of another manifestation, and therefore the mind changes.

original: de dag ni 'phrod pa 'du ba las ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'phrod pa 'du ba las ma yin no //
translated: But it is not from the connection of the two.

original: de la yan lag can des brtsams pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yan lag can des brtsams pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the whole is begun by the parts,

original: rdzas gzhan gyi yan lag dag gis rdzas gzhan rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan gyi yan lag dag gis rdzas gzhan rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a whole substance is not begun by other substances that are its parts.

original: de 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: That is a mistake.

original: brdzun yin te /üîΩgzhan la yang @178a * //
analyzed: brdzun yin te / gzhan la yang @178a * //
translated: It is false,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in the other.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten na snal ma la snam bu zhes grags pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten na snal ma la snam bu zhes grags pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, in the world, cloth is not known as the warp.

original: 'on kyang snal ma de rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa brjod pa'o smras so //
analyzed: 'on kyang snal ma de rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa brjod pa'o smras so //
translated: But the expression ‚Äúfrom these threads‚Äù refers to the past.

original: snam bu 'di zhes da ltar gyi dus brjod pas 'jag rten na phyis 'byung 'bras bu brjod yin gyi /
analyzed: snam bu 'di zhes da ltar gyi dus brjod pas 'jag rten na phyis 'byung 'bras bu brjod yin gyi /
translated: The expression ‚Äúthis cloth‚Äù refers to the present.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the cloth like?

original: snal ma 'dus byas las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: snal ma 'dus byas las 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is the effect of the assemblage of threads.

original: dang por snal ma rang gi dang gis 'gag pa na /
analyzed: dang por snal ma rang gi dang gis 'gag pa na /
translated: When the threads cease,

original: 'di'i nye bar len pa can gyi snam bu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i nye bar len pa can gyi snam bu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the effect, the cloth, arises.

original: don de nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mdor bsdus byas pa smos pa mdzad do //
analyzed: don de nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mdor bsdus byas pa smos pa mdzad do //
translated: In order to make this meaning clear, the author of the commentary uses the expression ‚Äúin brief.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang dus gcig min /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang dus gcig min /
translated: Sometimes, the cloth is not simultaneous with the threads.üîΩThe cloth, which is the effect, is not the threads, which are the cause.üîΩThe cloth is not in the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the assemblage of the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the collection of the threads.

original: snal ma zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang der 'du ba dang ldan pa snam bu zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i rdzas ni snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snal ma zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang der 'du ba dang ldan pa snam bu zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i rdzas ni snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The cloth is not the shape of the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the transformation of the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads.

original: rgyu dag la ni sgro 'dogs pa //
analyzed: rgyu dag la ni sgro 'dogs pa //
translated: The cloth is not other than the threads.üîΩThe cloth is not the threads

original: snal ma zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i chos sgro btags pa'i phyir skyes bu 'ga' zhig skabs 'ga' zhig tu snam bu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu snal ma zhes 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: snal ma zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i chos sgro btags pa'i phyir skyes bu 'ga' zhig skabs 'ga' zhig tu snam bu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu snal ma zhes 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Because the word ‚Äúyarn‚Äù is a designation of the cause, the word ‚Äúyarn‚Äù is applied to the effect, cloth, in some instances, for some people.

original: dper na snal ma de dag gang la zhes dris pa na /
analyzed: dper na snal ma de dag gang la zhes dris pa na /
translated: For example, when asked, ‚ÄúWhere are those yarns?‚Äù

original: lan du da ltar gyi snam bu bstan nas /
analyzed: lan du da ltar gyi snam bu bstan nas /
translated: the answer is given, ‚ÄúIn this cloth.‚ÄùüîΩAnd when asked, ‚ÄúWhat is this cloth?‚Äù

original: snam bu gang yin pa 'di dang 'di yin no zhes smra ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: snam bu gang yin pa 'di dang 'di yin no zhes smra ba lta bu'o //
translated: the answer is given, ‚ÄúIt is this cloth.‚Äù

original: snal ma gcig ni byung nas kyang //
analyzed: snal ma gcig ni byung nas kyang //
translated: When one yarn is removed,üîΩin the same way, when asked, ‚ÄúWhere is the yarn?‚Äù

original: de bzhin du dris par gyur pa na des snam bu las snal ma gcig phyung nas snal ma 'di yin no zhes snam bu'i sgra rten te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dris par gyur pa na des snam bu las snal ma gcig phyung nas snal ma 'di yin no zhes snam bu'i sgra rten te /
translated: the answer is given, ‚ÄúIn this cloth.‚Äù

original: rgyu ston pa na snal ma zhes bya ba de la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu ston pa na snal ma zhes bya ba de la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: When the cause is indicated, the word ‚Äúyarn‚Äù is applied to it.

original: snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes de skad du ni ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snal ma 'di la snam bu zhes de skad du ni ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not said, ‚ÄúThis cloth is in this yarn.‚Äù

original: de lta bur gyur pa de'i rnam pa yongs su gyur pa dag la snam bu zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de'i rnam pa yongs su gyur pa dag la snam bu zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: The transformation of those [threads] is called a cloth.

original: 'bras bu snal ma zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu snal ma zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The effect is called a thread.

original: dus gcig la yang snal ma zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu snam bu la khar gzhong dang rgya shug gi 'bras bu bzhin du rnam par phye nas ston pa na /
analyzed: dus gcig la yang snal ma zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu snam bu la khar gzhong dang rgya shug gi 'bras bu bzhin du rnam par phye nas ston pa na /
translated: But when the cause and effect called thread are shown to be separate, like a bowl and jujube fruit,

original: snal ma de dag la gzhan snam bu 'di zhes 'ga' zhig kyang tha snyad 'dogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: snal ma de dag la gzhan snam bu 'di zhes 'ga' zhig kyang tha snyad 'dogs par mi byed do //
translated: no one will apply the convention ‚Äúthis cloth‚Äù to those threads.

original: 'dir ba lang rva zhes bya ba 'di'i blo gang yin pa de la yang rva las tha dad pa'i yan lag rnams dang / rva phan tshun 'brel pa las yul ma chad pa nyid la rva zhes bya ba dang / de dag skyed par byed pas gang dag phan tshun phan gdags phan 'dogs byed nyid dam /
analyzed: 'dir ba lang rva zhes bya ba 'di'i blo gang yin pa de la yang rva las tha dad pa'i yan lag rnams dang / rva phan tshun 'brel pa las yul ma chad pa nyid la rva zhes bya ba dang / de dag skyed par byed pas gang dag phan tshun phan gdags phan 'dogs byed nyid dam /
translated: Here, in the cognition of ‚Äúcow‚Äôs horn,‚Äù the parts that are different from the horn, and the horn itself, which is the uninterrupted object due to the mutual connection of the parts, are called ‚Äúhorn.‚Äù And those that mutually assist each other in producing that [horn] are called ‚Äúparts of the horn.‚Äù

original: gcig la gcig phan @178b gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa de nyid 'di'i blo'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi /
analyzed: gcig la gcig phan @178b gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa de nyid 'di'i blo'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi /
translated: The reason for the cognition of the cow is the mutual relationship of the parts of the cow, which are beneficial to each other, and not the contact of the parts.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba yang ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the cow is not due to the contact of the parts.

original: rnam par chad pa mthong med nyid //
analyzed: rnam par chad pa mthong med nyid //
translated: The cognition of the cow is not due to the perception of the parts as disconnected.

original: nog dang / lkog shal la sogs pa 'og na gnas pa dang / 'brel pa steng gi rva rnam par chad pa mthong ba med pa nyid yin te gang ma chad pa nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nog dang / lkog shal la sogs pa 'og na gnas pa dang / 'brel pa steng gi rva rnam par chad pa mthong ba med pa nyid yin te gang ma chad pa nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cognition of the cow is not due to the perception of the parts as disconnected, because the parts of the cow, such as the dewlap, etc., which are located below, are connected to the parts located above, such as the horns, etc.

original: rnam par chad pa mthong ba de ni 'di'i blo rten yin gyi 'phrod pa 'du ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par chad pa mthong ba de ni 'di'i blo rten yin gyi 'phrod pa 'du ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The reason for the cognition of the cow is the mutual relationship of the parts of the cow, which are beneficial to each other, and not the contact of the parts.

original: de ni dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhes mang du bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained many times, because it is accepted that the parts of the cow are beyond the senses.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gang te 'di la zhes bya ba'i tha snyad don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan nyid yin pas na la lar dngos ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang te 'di la zhes bya ba'i tha snyad don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan nyid yin pas na la lar dngos ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: if the expression ‚Äúcow‚Äù is the reason for another object, then sometimes it is not the real object.

original: nye bar btags pa yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is it a mere designation,

original: nye bar btags pa ni dngos kyi rten nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa ni dngos kyi rten nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because a mere designation is the basis of the actual thing.

original: don gzhan gyi rten can gyi tha snyad kyi spyod yul gyi dngos po ni dngos po ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don gzhan gyi rten can gyi tha snyad kyi spyod yul gyi dngos po ni dngos po ma yin gyi /
translated: The object that is the basis of a different meaning is not an actual thing,

original: 'on kyang dngos po de /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po de /
translated: but rather that thing

original: 'khrul med shes can dngos po yi //
analyzed: 'khrul med shes can dngos po yi //
translated: is the actual object of the cognition that engages without error.

original: brda yi spyod yul gang yin dngos //
analyzed: brda yi spyod yul gang yin dngos //
translated: That which is the domain of conventional usage is the actual thing.

original: 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa'i shes pa'i yul sngon gyi brda'i yul gang yin pa de ni dngos yin la gzhan ni phal pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa'i shes pa'i yul sngon gyi brda'i yul gang yin pa de ni dngos yin la gzhan ni phal pa yin te /
translated: That which is the object of a cognition that engages without error and is the domain of a prior convention is the actual thing, while the other is a mere semblance.

original: dper na ba lang gi shes pa 'khrul pa med pa 'jug pa'i yul nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i gong bu 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa dngos yin zhing /
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi shes pa 'khrul pa med pa 'jug pa'i yul nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i gong bu 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa dngos yin zhing /
translated: For example, the object of a nonerroneous cognition of a cow is the body that possesses a hump, dewlap, and so on, which is renowned in the world, and is the actual thing.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa 'jug pa'i yul cung zad khur bu ba la nye bar btags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa 'jug pa'i yul cung zad khur bu ba la nye bar btags pa lta bu'o //
translated: The object of a mistaken cognition is a mere semblance, like the designation of a small load on a donkey.

original: de de ltar na rigs la sogs pa dang de dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: de de ltar na rigs la sogs pa dang de dang ldan pa la /
translated: Thus, in regard to a class and so on and that which possesses it,

original: rnam par phye nas mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa med pa de ltar na med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par phye nas mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa med pa de ltar na med pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is not apprehended by direct perception after being distinguished, then it does not exist.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi shes pa gang dang gang khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba can de dang de ni khyad par las tha dad pa'i don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gyis 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi shes pa gang dang gang khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba can de dang de ni khyad par las tha dad pa'i don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gyis 'jug pa yin te /
translated: But this is so: whatever cognition is concomitant with a distinction, that is engaged by the sign of a different object that is distinct from the distinction.

original: dper na lha spyin la dbyug pa can gyi shes pa tha dad pa'i dbyug pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan gyis 'jug pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha spyin la dbyug pa can gyi shes pa tha dad pa'i dbyug pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu mtshan gyis 'jug pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the cognition of Devadatta with a stick is engaged by the sign of the distinction of the stick that is different from Devadatta.

original: de ltar na spyi la sogs pa tha dad pa'i khyad par grub par 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: de ltar na spyi la sogs pa tha dad pa'i khyad par grub par 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: Thus, a universal and so on would be established as a different distinction.

original: de la 'dir /üîΩdngos po las ni tha dad can //
analyzed: de la 'dir / dngos po las ni tha dad can //
translated: In response to that, here:üîΩA universal and so on is not a different object from a thing.

original: rigs sogs la ni dngos po las tha dad pa'i spyi la sogs pa yul du gyur pa la /
analyzed: rigs sogs la ni dngos po las tha dad pa'i spyi la sogs pa yul du gyur pa la /
translated: A universal and so on that is a different object from a thing is not a proven object.

original: de yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i rjes dpag med /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i rjes dpag med /
translated: There is no inference that proves its existence.

original: 'di ltar / dbyug pa la sogs pa thams cad la'ang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dbyug pa la sogs pa thams cad la'ang //
translated: For example, all things such as a stick

original: khyad par la sogs pa nyid du 'dod pa lha sbyin la sogs pa la dbyug pa can du @179a * //üîΩtha snyad 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni don gzhan gyur pa'i dbyug pa yan gar ba las ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par la sogs pa nyid du 'dod pa lha sbyin la sogs pa la dbyug pa can du @179a * // tha snyad 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni don gzhan gyur pa'i dbyug pa yan gar ba las ma yin te /
translated: The convention ‚ÄúDevadatta is a club-bearer‚Äù is not made in regard to Devadatta, etc.,

original: de'i bdag po med par yang der tha snyad 'dogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag po med par yang der tha snyad 'dogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: as a separate entity, a club by itself, because it would follow, absurdly, that the convention would be made in regard to that which is without an owner.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: kun rdzob pa las dbyug pa can dag phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos po nye bar btags pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par don gzhan du gyur ba ma yin pa las te /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa las dbyug pa can dag phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos po nye bar btags pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par don gzhan du gyur ba ma yin pa las te /
translated: It is in regard to the mere relative, the club-bearer, in the situation where the mutual designation of the club-bearer and the club is made, in regard to a particular that is not a separate entity.

original: de'i rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a designation made by the conceptual mind.

original: des ni dpe ma grub pas rjes su dpag pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dpe ma grub pas rjes su dpag pa med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the example is not established, and hence that there is no inference.

original: dngos po khang bzangs phreng la sogs //
analyzed: dngos po khang bzangs phreng la sogs //
translated: Things such as a row of houses,

original: sgra rnams kyang gzhan la ltos min //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyang gzhan la ltos min //
translated: and also sounds, are not dependent on another.

original: dngos po dngos gzhi zhes rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sgra'am shes pa ni tshig gi don thams cad brjod pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dngos gzhi zhes rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sgra'am shes pa ni tshig gi don thams cad brjod pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: The word or cognition that is associated with the word ‚Äúentity‚Äù or ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù is in the habit of expressing all the meanings of words.

original: khang bzangs kyi phreng zhes bya ba ni khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: khang bzangs kyi phreng zhes bya ba ni khyad par can yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúrow‚Äù is a particular.

original: khyad par gyi shes pa dang rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sgra gang yin pa 'di dang sogs pa smos pa ni grong khyer zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad sngar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: khyad par gyi shes pa dang rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sgra gang yin pa 'di dang sogs pa smos pa ni grong khyer zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad sngar dpyad zin to //
translated: The word that is associated with the cognition of a particular and the word ‚Äúcity,‚Äù etc., that are mentioned in the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù are conventions that have already been examined.

original: de la sgra 'di thams cad gzhan la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba 'dis ma nges pa ston par byed do //üîΩde ltar na dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i tha snyad dam /
analyzed: de la sgra 'di thams cad gzhan la ltos pa med par zhes bya ba 'dis ma nges pa ston par byed do // de ltar na dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i tha snyad dam /
translated: In this regard, the phrase ‚Äúall these words without depending on another‚Äù shows that this is indeterminate.

original: khang bzangs kyi phreng ba'i sgra 'jug pa la dngos po thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ngang tshul can gyi tha dad pa'i khyad par gyi rten yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khang bzangs kyi phreng ba'i sgra 'jug pa la dngos po thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ngang tshul can gyi tha dad pa'i khyad par gyi rten yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the convention that is associated with the word ‚Äúentity‚Äù or ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù or the application of the word ‚Äúrow‚Äù does not have an existent basis that is a separate particular that is in the habit of being associated with all entities.

original: 'dir re zhig khang bzangs nyid ni rdzas ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir re zhig khang bzangs nyid ni rdzas ma yin te /
translated: Here, a mansion is not a substance.

original: shing la sogs pa'i rigs mi mthun pa ni rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i rigs mi mthun pa ni rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For a substance is not constructed from heterogeneous things such as wood, etc.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba don gzhan du gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: And there is not even the slightest thing called ‚Äúpossession‚Äù that is a separate object.

original: 'on kyang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: But, accepting that, we say:

original: gal te khang pa'ang ldan yin na //
analyzed: gal te khang pa'ang ldan yin na //
translated: If a mansion is a possession,

original: 'gyur ba de ltar na yang /
analyzed: 'gyur ba de ltar na yang /
translated: then even so,

original: de phreng ste ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi khang bzangs kyi phreng ba tshig gi don gyi rnam pa de ni gang gir 'gyur /
analyzed: de phreng ste ldan pa'i rang bzhin gyi khang bzangs kyi phreng ba tshig gi don gyi rnam pa de ni gang gir 'gyur /
translated: what is the form of the object of the word ‚Äúmansion‚Äù that is a possession, a series of mansions?

original: tshig gi don 'ga' zhig gi nang du yang 'du bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar na phreng ba zhes bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don 'ga' zhig gi nang du yang 'du bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar na phreng ba zhes bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And if it is not included in any of the objects of words, then a series does not exist in the slightest way.

original: de ltar na rigs de ni rdzas ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rigs de ni rdzas ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that class is not a substance.

original: khang bzangs ni rdzas nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khang bzangs ni rdzas nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a mansion is not a substance.

original: yon tan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not a quality.

original: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the qualities are not qualities.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /üîΩgal te rigs yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi / gal te rigs yin te /
translated: This is true, but

original: khang bzangs zhes bya ba'i ldan pa'i rigs phreng ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khang bzangs zhes bya ba'i ldan pa'i rigs phreng ba yin no zhe na /
translated: if the word family is a word for a collection,

original: de'i tshe khang gcig kyang ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe khang gcig kyang ste /
translated: then a single house is a collection.

original: khang bzangs la phreng zhes brjod phreng ba'i sgra ni rigs kyi rgyu @179b mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khang bzangs la phreng zhes brjod phreng ba'i sgra ni rigs kyi rgyu @179b mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A single house is called a collection of houses, because the word collection has the meaning of family.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is the example?

original: shing bzhin du /
analyzed: shing bzhin du /
translated: Like a tree.

original: dper na shing gi sgra rigs brjod pa'i ngang tshul can gyi pa la sha la sogs pa mang po brjod cing gcig kyang brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing gi sgra rigs brjod pa'i ngang tshul can gyi pa la sha la sogs pa mang po brjod cing gcig kyang brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the word tree, which has the meaning of family, refers to many things, such as palƒÅ≈õa, and it also refers to a single thing.

original: de bzhin du khang bzangs gcig la yang khang bzangs kyi phreng ba'i sgras brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du khang bzangs gcig la yang khang bzangs kyi phreng ba'i sgras brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, a single house is referred to by the word collection of houses.

original: brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na phreng ba'i sgra ni rigs kyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phreng ba'i sgra ni rigs kyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the word collection does not have the meaning of family.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'gyur ba de ni de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'gyur ba de ni de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: that which does not change when something exists is not a reason for that alone.

original: dper na ngang pa la sogs pa la rta yod du zin kyang ba lang gi sgra med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ngang pa la sogs pa la rta yod du zin kyang ba lang gi sgra med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, even if geese, etc. exist, the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù does not exist.

original: khang bzangs gcig la yang ldan pa'i rigs yod na yang phreng ba'i sgrar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khang bzangs gcig la yang ldan pa'i rigs yod na yang phreng ba'i sgrar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Even if the type of possession exists in a single mansion, the word ‚Äúgarland‚Äù does not occur. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: phreng mang po nyid de sgra ni //
analyzed: phreng mang po nyid de sgra ni //
translated: The word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is a garland.

original: ji ltar gang gi tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar gang gi tshe /
translated: How is it that

original: rigs nyid phreng ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe khang bzangs kyi phreng ba mang po dag la khang bzangs kyi phreng ba mangs po dag la khang bzangs kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs nyid phreng ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe khang bzangs kyi phreng ba mang po dag la khang bzangs kyi phreng ba mangs po dag la khang bzangs kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: when the type itself is a garland, then in many garlands of mansions, the cognition of the suffix ‚Äú-s‚Äù does not occur?

original: rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi phreng ba dag la spyi gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi phreng ba dag la spyi gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In garlands of the nature of the type, there is no other universal.

original: rigs ni rigs min phyir spyi la yang spyi nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs ni rigs min phyir spyi la yang spyi nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a universal does not exist in a particular, and because a universal does not exist in a universal.

original: gzhan yang khang bzangs kyi phreng ba chen po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gang yin pa de dag gang gang gis byas tshad ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khang bzangs kyi phreng ba chen po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gang yin pa de dag gang gang gis byas tshad ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the convention ‚Äúgreat garland of palaces‚Äù is not established by any measure.

original: phreng sogs ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khang bzangs sam /
analyzed: phreng sogs ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi khang bzangs sam /
translated: A palace has the characteristic of being a garland, etc.

original: rigs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi phreng ba la chen po nyid sogs yon tan gyi tshad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi phreng ba la chen po nyid sogs yon tan gyi tshad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The measure of the quality of greatness, etc., does not exist in a palace that has the characteristic of being a garland.

original: gang nye bar btags las khang bzangs kyi phreng ba la sogs pa la chen po nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dod na yang tha dad pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang nye bar btags las khang bzangs kyi phreng ba la sogs pa la chen po nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dod na yang tha dad pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you assert that the convention ‚Äúgreatness,‚Äù etc., is due to the mere designation of a palace, etc., as a garland, etc., then greatness, etc., do not exist because there is no difference.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: 'di ltar dper na me tog rgyas pa can gyi nags zhes bya ba 'di la grangs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi nags la me tog med pa'i phyir de dag ni rdzas la yod pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na me tog rgyas pa can gyi nags zhes bya ba 'di la grangs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi nags la me tog med pa'i phyir de dag ni rdzas la yod pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the case of the forest called ‚ÄúFlowering Forest,‚Äù since the forest that has the characteristic of number does not have flowers, they exist in substances.

original: de ltar na yang rdzas gcig la grangs dang me tog gi 'phrod pa 'du ba yod pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang rdzas gcig la grangs dang me tog gi 'phrod pa 'du ba yod pa de ltar na /
translated: In that case, just as the conjunction of number and flower exists in one substance,
