original: dbang po'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs par 'byung pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis gzugs kyi blo nyams su myong ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa dang dus mtshungs par 'byung pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis gzugs kyi blo nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: The other consciousnesses that are of the same nature as the sense consciousnesses experience the form.

original: 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: That is the apprehension.

original: cig car rnam par rtog pa gnyis ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car rnam par rtog pa gnyis ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because two simultaneous conceptual consciousnesses are not seen.

original: dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yang ngas gzugs mthong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur te /üîΩde'i tshe yang mthong ba de 'gag pa yin te mthong ba de 'das pa la rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de dran pa de yang sngar gzung ba med cing /
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yang ngas gzugs mthong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur te / de'i tshe yang mthong ba de 'gag pa yin te mthong ba de 'das pa la rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de dran pa de yang sngar gzung ba med cing /
translated: The conceptual consciousness that arises later is also called ‚ÄúI see form.‚Äù

original: nyams myong med par ji ltar 'gyur te ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nyams myong med par ji ltar 'gyur te ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: At that time, the seeing has ceased. The conceptual consciousness that engages the past seeing is memory. How could that memory exist without a prior apprehension and experience? It could not!

original: gal te mthong ba 'das pa la yang rnam par rtog pa phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yongs su gcod par byed par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba 'das pa la yang rnam par rtog pa phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yongs su gcod par byed par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you assert that the conceptual consciousness that arises later determines the past seeing,

original: ji ltar rgyud gzhan dang 'brel ba can gyi rnam par shes pa lkog tu gyur ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyud gzhan dang 'brel ba can gyi rnam par shes pa lkog tu gyur ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Just as consciousness related to other continua is hidden,

original: bdag nyid la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i mthong ba 'gag pa na yang /üîΩgzhan blo yongs gcod tha dad med //
analyzed: bdag nyid la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i mthong ba 'gag pa na yang / gzhan blo yongs gcod tha dad med //
translated: so too, when the seeing of form and so on ceases in one‚Äôs own continuum,üîΩthe mind is not different from the ascertainment of others.

original: ngo bo can gyi yongs su gcod pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: ngo bo can gyi yongs su gcod pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: The mind is not different from the ascertainment that has the nature of the exclusion of other.

original: rang blo'i blor 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang blo'i blor 'gyur te /
translated: The mind is the mind of one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: lkog tu gyur ba nyid dang / 'das pa med pa nyid du rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i blo nyams su myong ba med pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur ba nyid dang / 'das pa med pa nyid du rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i blo nyams su myong ba med pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the hiddenness and the nonexistence of the past in the experience of the mind that abides in one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continua.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i mthong ba la blo yin pa de ltar rang gi rgyud ka gnas pa la yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i mthong ba la blo yin pa de ltar rang gi rgyud ka gnas pa la yang 'gyur na /
translated: Just as seeing that abides in others‚Äô continua is the mind, so too it would be in one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: 'di ltar nga'i gzugs mthong ba ni 'di yin no zhes rnam pa gzhan du bdag nyid so so rang gis rig pas nyams su myong ba can gyi blo 'jug par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'di ltar nga'i gzugs mthong ba ni 'di yin no zhes rnam pa gzhan du bdag nyid so so rang gis rig pas nyams su myong ba can gyi blo 'jug par 'gyur ro /
translated: Thus, the thought ‚ÄúI see this form‚Äù occurs, and it is experienced by the self-awareness that is a different aspect from the form.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /üîΩbam bo nyi shu brgyad pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa / bam bo nyi shu brgyad pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: gzhan yang mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa yin par smras pa gang yin pa dang / mngon sum rtog pa med pa yang rang rig pa ma yin par smra ba gang yin pa'i rgol ba gnyis po dag gi yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa yin par smras pa gang yin pa dang / mngon sum rtog pa med pa yang rang rig pa ma yin par smra ba gang yin pa'i rgol ba gnyis po dag gi yang /
translated: Also, the two opponents who say that perception has conceptualization and who say that perception that is without conceptualization is not reflexive awareness

original: 'das pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin no //
translated: have not established by perception the seeing of past form and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmngon sum de ni da ltar gyi @186a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / mngon sum de ni da ltar gyi @186a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that perception is the subject of the present object.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not established by inference because

original: 'di ltar / mthong ba 'das pa dang ni dpe med dang / dpe dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar / mthong ba 'das pa dang ni dpe med dang / dpe dang bral ba ste /
translated: the past is not seen, it is without example, and it is free from example.

original: mngon sum gyi rnam par shes pa cung zad kyang grub pa med na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rnam par shes pa cung zad kyang grub pa med na /
translated: If there is not even the slightest bit of direct perception that is established,

original: gang dpe nyid du rjod par byed /
analyzed: gang dpe nyid du rjod par byed /
translated: then what is it that you are using as an example?

original: rtags thams cad kyi rten yang ma grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtags thams cad kyi rten yang ma grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The basis of all reasons would also be unestablished,

original: chos can nyid ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can nyid ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the subject itself would be unestablished.

original: rtags med pa ni 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang chos can dang 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags med pa ni 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang chos can dang 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the reason is not established in terms of the presence of the property of the position, the counterposition, and the relationship between the subject and the reason, it is not an inference.

original: 'dis kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag ba dag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag ba dag med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since this also shows that direct perception and inference do not exist,

original: don rig pa don mthong ba de tshad ma gang gis grub /
analyzed: don rig pa don mthong ba de tshad ma gang gis grub /
translated: by what valid cognition is the awareness of an object and the seeing of an object established?

original: rnam pa gang gis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not established by any aspect.

original: de bas na shes pa de la ni //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa de la ni //
translated: Therefore, with respect to that consciousness,

original: mngon sum ma yin rtags can min /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin rtags can min /
translated: it is not direct perception and it is not inference.

original: de ltar na mthong ba rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na mthong ba rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since seeing is nonconceptual,

original: 'gro ba long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba long ba dang lkugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: beings would be blind and mute.

original: gal te de yi rang ngo bo //
analyzed: gal te de yi rang ngo bo //
translated: If it is the intrinsic nature of that,

original: snang ba can blo de ma thag / gzugs sogs bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur na //
analyzed: snang ba can blo de ma thag / gzugs sogs bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur na //
translated: just as it does form and so on,

original: gal te ji ltar mdo sde pa dag dbang po dang don dag sngar 'byung ba dag gis shes pa skyed par 'gyur zhing gzugs la sogs pa thag nye ba'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can de las skyes pa'i shes pa des kyang de 'dzin par 'gyur ba
analyzed: gal te ji ltar mdo sde pa dag dbang po dang don dag sngar 'byung ba dag gis shes pa skyed par 'gyur zhing gzugs la sogs pa thag nye ba'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can de las skyes pa'i shes pa des kyang de 'dzin par 'gyur ba
translated: then, just as the SautrƒÅntikas say that the sense faculty and object that existed previously give rise to consciousness, and the consciousness that arises from that apprehends form and so on that is in a state of proximity,

original: de ltar / 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo sngar skyes pas kyang rang gi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo phyi ma gzhan skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar / 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo sngar skyes pas kyang rang gi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo phyi ma gzhan skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, here too, the cognition of form and so on that arose previously would give rise to a later conceptual cognition that has a state of being that is in conformity with its aspect.

original: de'i ngo bor snang ba can te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor snang ba can te /
translated: It would have an appearance that is of the nature of that.

original: blo snga ma'i ngo bo rjes su 'brang ba can de'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can de ma thag pa'i stobs kyis skyed pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo gzhan des kyang blo snga ma de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo yin no zhes de ltar 'dzin
analyzed: blo snga ma'i ngo bo rjes su 'brang ba can de'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can de ma thag pa'i stobs kyis skyed pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo gzhan des kyang blo snga ma de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo yin no zhes de ltar 'dzin
translated: The later conceptual cognition that arises by the power of the immediately preceding condition of the prior cognition that is the same nature as the prior cognition also apprehends the prior cognition as a cognition of form and so on.

original: pa de'i tshe skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: pa de'i tshe skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the error if that is the case?

original: sngar blo de ni 'dzin mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang gi tshe don mngon sum du gyur pa na myur du mthong ba mang po 'gags par gyur pa de'i tshe mthong ba tha ma nyid la /
analyzed: sngar blo de ni 'dzin mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te / gang gi tshe don mngon sum du gyur pa na myur du mthong ba mang po 'gags par gyur pa de'i tshe mthong ba tha ma nyid la /
translated: The prior cognition would not apprehend it.üîΩWhen the object is directly perceived, many instances of seeing quickly cease. At that time, the final instance of seeing would apprehend the form, thinking, ‚ÄúI see this form.‚Äù

original: ngas gzugs 'di mthong ngo zhes 'dzin pa ni rim gyis mthong ba snga ma de dag kyang 'di ltar yun ring por mthong ngo zhes de ltar 'gyur bas mthong ba chod pa de dag ni blo de dag gis 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag gi nyams
analyzed: ngas gzugs 'di mthong ngo zhes 'dzin pa ni rim gyis mthong ba snga ma de dag kyang 'di ltar yun ring por mthong ngo zhes de ltar 'gyur bas mthong ba chod pa de dag ni blo de dag gis 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dag gi nyams
translated: Since it would be like that, the prior instances of seeing would also be seen for a long time. Therefore, since those interrupted instances of seeing are not apprehended by those cognitions, they would not be remembered by the later cognition.

original: su myong ba der @186b mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: su myong ba der @186b mi 'gyur na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: nyams su myong ba yang yod pa de bas na de nyams su myong ba de ni rtog pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yang yod pa de bas na de nyams su myong ba de ni rtog pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: then there would be no experience. Therefore, that experience is non-conceptual.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar /
translated: When it is like this,

original: ji ltar rang yul can rnams shes //
analyzed: ji ltar rang yul can rnams shes //
translated: How is it that the consciousnesses that have their own objects

original: nyams myong de ni rtog med yin //
analyzed: nyams myong de ni rtog med yin //
translated: Are experienced without conceptualization?

original: de'i tshe de ltar yul 'dzin pa yin na yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe de ltar yul 'dzin pa yin na yang /
translated: At that time, although the object is apprehended in that way,

original: shes pa rtog pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa rtog pa med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is established that consciousness is non-conceptual.

original: ji ltar da ltar shes pa gcig rtog pa med par grub pa de ltar mngon sum gzhan thams cad kyang rtog pa med pa nyid yin par grub pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar shes pa gcig rtog pa med par grub pa de ltar mngon sum gzhan thams cad kyang rtog pa med pa nyid yin par grub pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is established that one consciousness is non-conceptual in the present, in the same way, it should be seen that all other direct perceptions are also established as non-conceptual.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brda nus med pa nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: brda nus med pa nyid phyir ro //
translated: Because the capacity for symbols is absent.

original: rnam par shes pa de'i rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba brdas byas pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'i rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba brdas byas pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Because the experience of the intrinsic reality of that consciousness is not made by a conventional symbol, it is not an object of conceptual consciousness.

original: de bzhin du dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, the intrinsic reality of other things is also like that.

original: brda byed pa'i nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir gdon mi za bar de'i yul can gyi nyams su myong ba'i rtog pa med pas kyang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: brda byed pa'i nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir gdon mi za bar de'i yul can gyi nyams su myong ba'i rtog pa med pas kyang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because the capacity to make a conventional symbol does not exist, there is no doubt that there is no experience of it, and no conceptual consciousness that has it as an object.

original: ji ltar de de ltar yin pa de ltar phyis 'chad par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar de de ltar yin pa de ltar phyis 'chad par 'gyur zhing /
translated: How that is so will be explained later,

original: sngar yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: sngar yang bstan zin to //
translated: and it has already been explained above.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / spyi brjod ngang tshul can sgra dang // khyad par brjod pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / spyi brjod ngang tshul can sgra dang // khyad par brjod pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin te /
translated: A word that has the mode of expressing a universal does not have the mode of expressing a particular.

original: khyad par ni tha snyad kyi dus na nye ba nyid ma yin pas tha snyad du byar mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / sgra 'god pa yang tha snyad kyi don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni tha snyad kyi dus na nye ba nyid ma yin pas tha snyad du byar mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / sgra 'god pa yang tha snyad kyi don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the utterance of the word is also the conventional object.

original: de dang don cig car rtogs na /üîΩsgra gcig gi yul can rtog pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de dang don cig car rtogs na / sgra gcig gi yul can rtog pa yin na'o //
translated: If one understands the object and the word simultaneously,üîΩthen the conceptual cognition has the word as its object.

original: sgra'i yul gang yin pa de rtog pa'i yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i yul gang yin pa de rtog pa'i yin te /
translated: That which is the object of the word is the object of the conceptual cognition.

original: spyi'i yul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it has a universal as its object.

original: gang gi tshe mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa de'i tshe /
translated: When perception is conceptual, then

original: rnam par shes pa nyid rtog pa med pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na rtog pa med pa med ni khyad par ji ltar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid rtog pa med pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na rtog pa med pa med ni khyad par ji ltar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: consciousness itself is not non-conceptual. In that case, if there is no non-conceptual cognition, how is the difference understood?

original: mi 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is not.

original: thams cad du spyi yan gar ba rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thams cad du spyi yan gar ba rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In all cases, only the universal is understood,

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang khyad par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and at no time is the particular understood. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so,üîΩbut it is not so in the case of the word.

original: gal te rtog med 'ga' zhig kyang //
analyzed: gal te rtog med 'ga' zhig kyang //
translated: If there were any non-conceptual cognition,

original: yod na mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: yod na mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: then direct perception would not be conceptual.

original: gang gis na rtog pa med pa'i phyir khyad par mi rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na rtog pa med pa'i phyir khyad par mi rtog par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that it does not conceive a specific object because it is non-conceptual?

original: 'on kyang mngon sum rtog pa med pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod @187a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum rtog pa med pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod @187a * //
translated: But there is no non-conceptual direct perception at all.

original: pa ma yin pa de bas na khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: pa ma yin pa de bas na khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that a specific object is cognized.üîΩIf that is so, then how is it that a single non-conceptual cognition arises from its own cause, which is determined to be capable of producing it, and is similar to the cause, such as the eye, etc.?

original: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar shes pa rtog pa med pa gcig po rang gi rgyu las nus pa nges pa can mig la sogs pa'i rgyu ci 'dra ba las skye ba de 'dod pa de dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar shes pa rtog pa med pa gcig po rang gi rgyu las nus pa nges pa can mig la sogs pa'i rgyu ci 'dra ba las skye ba de 'dod pa de dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since it is like that,

original: gzhan thams cad kyang skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan thams cad kyang skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: all other things would also arise.

original: de dang mtshungs rgyu can thams cad de bzhin rtog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs rgyu can thams cad de bzhin rtog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, all things that have similar causes would be non-conceptual in the same way.

original: 'ga' zhig rtog pa med pa dang / 'ga' zhig rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rtog pa med pa dang / 'ga' zhig rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that some are without thought and some are with thought.

original: 'bras bdag nyid /
analyzed: 'bras bdag nyid /
translated: The result is the same as the cause.

original: tha dad rgyu tha dad phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad rgyu tha dad phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause is different, the result is different.

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin nges pa las 'bras bu nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin nges pa las 'bras bu nges pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the result is determined from the cause's determined nature.

original: ci 'dra ba las skye ba /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba las skye ba /
translated: What is produced from what?

original: ci 'dra cig mthong ba de 'dra ba las skye ba gzhan yang de 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci 'dra cig mthong ba de 'dra ba las skye ba gzhan yang de 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: What is seen is produced from what is seen. Another is produced from another.

original: mi 'dra ba las 'byung ba mi 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba las 'byung ba mi 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: What is produced from what that is not similar is not similar.

original: de 'dra ba dang de 'dra ba ma yin pa nyid la rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba dang de 'dra ba ma yin pa nyid la rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the logic of what is similar and what is not similar.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: rgyu med pa can nyid yin na yul la sogs pa'i nges par mi rung ngo zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid yin na yul la sogs pa'i nges par mi rung ngo zhes mang du bshad zin to //
translated: if it were causeless, the determination of place and so on would not be possible. This has been explained many times.

original: 'di'i phyir yang mngon sum rtog pa med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang mngon sum rtog pa med pa nyid yin te /
translated: For this reason, direct perception is also without thought.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / brda dran phyir na sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / brda dran phyir na sbyor ba ni //
translated: because of the memory of the sign, the application

original: phyi rol don la ltos med can //
analyzed: phyi rol don la ltos med can //
translated: is without regard for external objects.

original: don 'di'i sgra rjod par byed pa yin no zhes 'dir sgra dang don sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi don nye ba nyid la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don 'di'i sgra rjod par byed pa yin no zhes 'dir sgra dang don sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi don nye ba nyid la ltos pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The connection between the word and the object is made here, without any regard for the presence of the external object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: brda dran phyir te /
analyzed: brda dran phyir te /
translated: Because of the memory of the convention.

original: dran pa yang don nye ba la ltos pa ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang gang kho na sgra brdar byas pa de kho na la de dran par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: dran pa yang don nye ba la ltos pa ma yin gyi / 'on kyang gang kho na sgra brdar byas pa de kho na la de dran par byed pa yin la /
translated: Memory does not depend on the presence of the object.üîΩRather, it is that which causes one to remember just what the word was that was used in the convention.

original: ji ltar brdar byas pa'i sgra de dang de nyid sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar brdar byas pa'i sgra de dang de nyid sbyor bar byed do //
translated: One connects just that word with that very object, in accordance with the convention.

original: dngos po la yang brda byed pa ma yin pa de ltar /
analyzed: dngos po la yang brda byed pa ma yin pa de ltar /
translated: And just as one does not make a convention about an object,

original: de la brda dbang po'i shes pas dran pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de la brda dbang po'i shes pas dran pa ma yin zhing /
translated: so too, one does not remember the word by means of a sense-perception of the object.

original: bdag nyid spyod par byed pa ma yin pa dang / dran pa ma yin par 'gyur ba yul du ma byas pa'i sgra dang don sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid spyod par byed pa ma yin pa dang / dran pa ma yin par 'gyur ba yul du ma byas pa'i sgra dang don sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: One does not remember the word by means of the memory itself, nor does one connect the word and the object without having had an experience of the word.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la brda dran pa med pa de ni de dang don de sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la brda dran pa med pa de ni de dang don de sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: if one does not remember the convention, then one does not apply it to the object.

original: dper na nye ba'i ba lang dang bu'i 'brel ba mi dran pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nye ba'i ba lang dang bu'i 'brel ba mi dran pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one does not remember the connection between a cow and a gavaya.

original: dbang po'i shes pas kyang sgra dang don dag gis brda dran pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas kyang sgra dang don dag gis brda dran pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of a cause is this: the sensory consciousness does not remember the convention of the word and the object.

original: de bas na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas phyi rol gyi don nye ba la ltos pa med par sbyor @187b bar byed pa /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas phyi rol gyi don nye ba la ltos pa med par sbyor @187b bar byed pa /
translated: Therefore, just as the conceptual consciousness applies to the external object without regard to its presence,

original: de bzhin brda la ltos med par /
analyzed: de bzhin brda la ltos med par /
translated: in the same way, without regard to the convention,

original: dngos nus nyid las don gyi nus pa nyid las mig blo yin /
analyzed: dngos nus nyid las don gyi nus pa nyid las mig blo yin /
translated: the eye consciousness arises from the potentiality of the object alone.

original: skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalone‚Äù is a remainder from the verse.

original: de ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: That is so, but

original: brda dang de dran pa la ltos pa med par dbang po'i shes pa gzugs 'dzin par byed par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brda dang de dran pa la ltos pa med par dbang po'i shes pa gzugs 'dzin par byed par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: without regard to the convention and the memory of it, the sensory consciousness that apprehends form does not arise.

original: de lta yin na ni /üîΩgal te ji ltar dbang blo yi //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni /üîΩgal te ji ltar dbang blo yi //
translated: If that were so,üîΩthen the sensory consciousness

original: gzugs brda dran la ltos can yin //
analyzed: gzugs brda dran la ltos can yin //
translated: It is dependent on the sign and memory.

original: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is the activity of visual consciousness,

original: gzugs brda dang dran pa la ltos pa nyid yin te /üîΩltos med nus pa ma yin na brda dang dran pa la ltos pa dbang po'i shes pa skyed pa la /
analyzed: gzugs brda dang dran pa la ltos pa nyid yin te / ltos med nus pa ma yin na brda dang dran pa la ltos pa dbang po'i shes pa skyed pa la /
translated: it is dependent on the sign and memory.

original: gzugs nus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs nus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is not independent, the potency of form is for the production of sense consciousness that is dependent on the sign and memory.üîΩThis is the meaning of the statement.

original: de'i tshe nus par 'gyur gzugs 'di'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe nus par 'gyur gzugs 'di'o //
translated: At that time, the potency is for this form.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: With respect to what?

original: dran pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyid la'o //
translated: With respect to memory.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rtags bzhin du dper na rma bya'i sgrol sogs pa'i rtags 'brel ba dran pa la nye bar sbyor ba can yin gyi /
analyzed: rtags bzhin du dper na rma bya'i sgrol sogs pa'i rtags 'brel ba dran pa la nye bar sbyor ba can yin gyi /
translated: It is like a sign, for example, like the sign of a peacock‚Äôs tail feather that is applied to memory.

original: la la'i tshe dngos su rtags kyis shes pa skyed pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: la la'i tshe dngos su rtags kyis shes pa skyed pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra bar ro //
translated: Sometimes the sign does not directly produce knowledge. It is like that.

original: de ni de mngon phyogs skye phyir //
analyzed: de ni de mngon phyogs skye phyir //
translated: Because it arises in relation to that.

original: dran pa ni don la mngon du phyogs pa las skyes pa'i phyi rol las dran pa de nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dran pa ni don la mngon du phyogs pa las skyes pa'i phyi rol las dran pa de nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Memory arises in relation to the object. Memory is external. It is just that.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang dbang po'i blo'i yul 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //üîΩdran las dbang blo 'gyur ra'am //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang dbang po'i blo'i yul 'gyur ba yang ma yin no // dran las dbang blo 'gyur ra'am //
translated: And sometimes, the sense consciousness does not change.üîΩSometimes, the sense consciousness does not change from memory.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang min te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang min te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes, the sense consciousness does not change from memory.

original: dran pa las dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur bas gdon mi za bar bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: dran pa las dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur bas gdon mi za bar bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: The sense consciousness does not necessarily arise from memory.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes, it arises.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe don las dngos su dbang po'i blo mi skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe don las dngos su dbang po'i blo mi skye ba de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when the sense consciousness does not arise directly from the object,

original: dran pa de las dus gzhan la dbang po'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa de las dus gzhan la dbang po'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: then at another time, the sense consciousness arises from memory.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: la lar rnam g-yeng srid phyir ro //
analyzed: la lar rnam g-yeng srid phyir ro //
translated: Because distraction is possible.

original: don las dran pa skyed pa na //
analyzed: don las dran pa skyed pa na //
translated: When memory arises from the object,

original: de ma thag pa'i yul gzhan la rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pas chod pa srid pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gi tshe skye bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i yul gzhan la rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pas chod pa srid pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gi tshe skye bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: because it is possible that the object is interrupted by distraction to another object immediately after, the sense consciousness does not arise sometimes.

original: don mthong ba dran pas mtshams sbyor bas phyis kyang 'gyur te //
analyzed: don mthong ba dran pas mtshams sbyor bas phyis kyang 'gyur te //
translated: Or, because the seeing of the object is connected by memory, it arises later.

original: dran pa las phyis kyang dbang po'i shes pa'i skyed par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa las phyis kyang dbang po'i shes pa'i skyed par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the prior and subsequent moments of sense consciousness in terms of the cause that generates them.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te rim gyis gnyis rgyu yin //
analyzed: gal te rim gyis gnyis rgyu yin //
translated: if the two are causes in sequence,

original: sngar gzugs kyi dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i dran pa bsgrubs nas phyis dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa @188a * //üîΩyin no zhe na /
analyzed: sngar gzugs kyi dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i dran pa bsgrubs nas phyis dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa @188a * // yin no zhe na /
translated: then the memory that previously was the cause of the sense consciousness of form later becomes the cause of the sense consciousness itself.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not the case.

original: de ltar na gal te dran pa nye bar sbyor bas phyis gzugs la sogs pa don dbang po'i blo'i rgyur 'gyur ba de'i tshe sngar nyid mngon du gyur pa nyid dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'am phyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gal te dran pa nye bar sbyor bas phyis gzugs la sogs pa don dbang po'i blo'i rgyur 'gyur ba de'i tshe sngar nyid mngon du gyur pa nyid dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'am phyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if the object, such as form, later becomes the cause of the sense consciousness of form through the application of memory, then it would have been the cause of the sense consciousness previously, or it would not be the cause later.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tha dad med phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: de skad du don de ni sngar yang phyis bzhin du ltos pa med par dbang po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'am /
analyzed: de skad du don de ni sngar yang phyis bzhin du ltos pa med par dbang po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'am /
translated: In that case, the object would be the cause of the sense consciousness previously, just as it is later, without depending on the application of memory.üîΩOr, if the object is not the cause of the sense consciousness previously, it will not be the cause later either.

original: ma yin grang na /
analyzed: ma yin grang na /
translated: If not,

original: gal te sngar yang de de'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa de'i tshe phyis bzhin sngar yang skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sngar yang de de'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa de'i tshe phyis bzhin sngar yang skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then if it previously possessed that nature, it would generate it as it does later.

original: ci ste de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ltar na ni sngar yang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa phyis kyang khyad par med pa'i phyir de 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang bskyed par mi 'gyur zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de ltar na ni sngar yang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa phyis kyang khyad par med pa'i phyir de 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang bskyed par mi 'gyur zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does not possess that nature, then it would not generate it previously, just as it does not later, because there is no difference.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te skad cig gzhan blo rgyu skad cig ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig gzhan blo rgyu skad cig ma yin na /
translated: if the mind of another moment is the cause of the moment of consciousness,

original: skyon 'dir 'gyur na /
analyzed: skyon 'dir 'gyur na /
translated: then this error would ensue.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po skad cig ma re rer gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po skad cig ma re rer gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When a thing becomes different at each moment,

original: skad cig ma dang po dran pa skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po dran pa skyed par byed cing /
translated: then the first moment generates memory,

original: phyi ma'i dbang po'i shes pa skyed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi ma'i dbang po'i shes pa skyed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and the later moment generates the sense consciousness.

original: phyogs de la'ang don de dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin na don de la'ang dran pa don med can /
analyzed: phyogs de la'ang don de dbang po'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin na don de la'ang dran pa don med can /
translated: In that case, if the object is the cause of the sense consciousness, then memory of the object would be pointless.

original: dgos pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is purposeless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar brda dran ji ltar brdar btags pa grub pa'i don du 'dod pa dang don gang la yang sgra brdar brtags pa gang de la sgra de sbyor ba'i don yin par 'dogs pa yin no zhes brda dran pa de'i don can du 'dod na 'di ltar dran
analyzed: 'di ltar brda dran ji ltar brdar btags pa grub pa'i don du 'dod pa dang don gang la yang sgra brdar brtags pa gang de la sgra de sbyor ba'i don yin par 'dogs pa yin no zhes brda dran pa de'i don can du 'dod na 'di ltar dran
translated: If you assert that the object of remembering a convention is the object that is established in accordance with the convention, and you assert that the object to which a word is conventionally assigned is the object to which that word is applied, then the object of remembering a convention

original: pa'i yul gyi don dbang po'i shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i yul gyi don dbang po'i shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: is not an object apprehended by a sense consciousness.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: de las dus gzhan du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gzhan dran pas yul du byas pa de bas 'dir dran pa don med pa can du 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan yang / khyad par brdar btags med 'dzin na //
analyzed: de las dus gzhan du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gzhan dran pas yul du byas pa de bas 'dir dran pa don med pa can du 'gyur ro // gzhan yang / khyad par brdar btags med 'dzin na //
translated: It is an object that is made into an object by memory that arises at another time. Therefore remembering a convention is purposeless.üîΩMoreover, if you assert that the object of remembering a convention is an object that is apprehended by a sense consciousness, then the object of remembering a convention would not be an object that is apprehended by memory.

original: rtag pa'i phyogs la yang gang kho na la brdar btags pa de nyid sgra dang bcas pa'i gzung bar bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyogs la yang gang kho na la brdar btags pa de nyid sgra dang bcas pa'i gzung bar bya ba yin zhing /
translated: If you assert that the object of remembering a convention is an object that is apprehended by memory, then the object of remembering a convention would not be an object that is apprehended by a sense consciousness.

original: khyad par la brda med pa'i phyir de brdar btags pa med pas khyad par de tha dad par gzung bar bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par la brda med pa'i phyir de brdar btags pa med pas khyad par de tha dad par gzung bar bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because there is no convention in regard to the difference, that difference would be apprehended as distinct, since it is not designated by convention.

original: brdar ma btags pa dbang po'i shes pa rtog pa med pas 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdar ma btags pa dbang po'i shes pa rtog pa med pas 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is not designated by convention would be apprehended by nonconceptual sense consciousness.

original: yang na / khyad par brdar btags med 'dzin na //
analyzed: yang na / khyad par brdar btags med 'dzin na //
translated: Or, if you maintain that the difference is apprehended without being designated by convention,

original: zhes bya ba'i don ni skad cig ma'i phyogs la skad cig ma dang po gang @188b yin pa de dran pa skyed par byed par 'dod pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don ni skad cig ma'i phyogs la skad cig ma dang po gang @188b yin pa de dran pa skyed par byed par 'dod pa de la /
translated: the meaning of that statement is this: In the context of the theory of momentariness, you assert that the first moment generates memory.

original: khyad par gyi ngo bo ma bzung ba la brda yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi ngo bo ma bzung ba la brda yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if the nature of the difference is not apprehended, there is no convention.

original: brdar btags pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brdar btags pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no designation by convention,üîΩmemory would apprehend that which is not designated by convention.

original: dran pas brdar ma btags pa nyid du gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dod par 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pas brdar ma btags pa nyid du gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dod par 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: yang na phyis 'byung ba'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de dbang po'i shes pa skyed par 'dod na /
analyzed: yang na phyis 'byung ba'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de dbang po'i shes pa skyed par 'dod na /
translated: Or, if you maintain that the later moment that arises generates sense consciousness,

original: de la khyad par la sgra brda byas pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de la khyad par la sgra brda byas pa ma yin zhing /
translated: then a word would not be designated as a convention in regard to the difference.

original: brdar ma byas pa'i phyir yang brdar ma btags pa'i don de 'dzin pa de ltar na /üîΩkhyad par brdar btags med 'dzin na //
analyzed: brdar ma byas pa'i phyir yang brdar ma btags pa'i don de 'dzin pa de ltar na / khyad par brdar btags med 'dzin na //
translated: Because it is not a convention, it is not a convention that apprehends the object that is not a convention.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: In this way, the statement, ‚ÄúIt is not the apprehension of a distinguished object that is a convention,‚ÄùüîΩis correct.

original: de la dran pa 'dod gang can //
analyzed: de la dran pa 'dod gang can //
translated: In this regard, what is the desire of memory?

original: phyogs gnyis pa la gang gi yul can yin /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la gang gi yul can yin /
translated: In the second case, what is the object of the subject?

original: gsum pa la gang gi dgos pa can yin /
analyzed: gsum pa la gang gi dgos pa can yin /
translated: In the third case, what is the purpose of the subject?

original: gnyi ga yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is neither of the two.

original: khyad par la sgra 'god pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par la sgra 'god pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The word is not applied to the distinguished object,

original: 'on kyang spyi la yin pa nges na /
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi la yin pa nges na /
translated: but if it is ascertained that it is the universal,

original: spyi tsam rtogs pa yin gyi khyad par ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa yang legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi tsam rtogs pa yin gyi khyad par ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa yang legs pa ma yin no //
translated: then the idea that ‚Äúit is the apprehension of the universal alone, not the distinguished object‚Äù is not correct.

original: de ltar na spyi yan gar ba 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na spyi yan gar ba 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, it is not the apprehension of the bare universal.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: khyad par yang 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par yang 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is the apprehension of the distinguished object.

original: de ltar ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: spyi tsam 'dzin pa yin na ni //
analyzed: spyi tsam 'dzin pa yin na ni //
translated: if it were the apprehension of the universal alone,

original: rnam par shes pa khyad par la ltos mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa khyad par la ltos mi rung ngo //
translated: then consciousness would not be suitable to rely on the distinguished object.

original: de ltar na khyad par dang 'dres pa'i spyi 'dzin par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na khyad par dang 'dres pa'i spyi 'dzin par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be admitted that the universal is apprehended as distinct and as mixed.

original: de ltar na sgra'i yul ma yin pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sgra'i yul ma yin pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni brjod pa dang 'dres pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, that which apprehends the particular, which is not the object of a word, is not mixed with verbalization.

original: de phyir ming dang gzugs dag la /
analyzed: de phyir ming dang gzugs dag la /
translated: Therefore, with regard to name and form,

original: mig kho na dang gzugs kho na la brten nas brda dran pa la ltos pa med par mig blo skyed par 'gyur zhes bya bar ni mjug bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mig kho na dang gzugs kho na la brten nas brda dran pa la ltos pa med par mig blo skyed par 'gyur zhes bya bar ni mjug bsdus pa'o //
translated: the conclusion is that the visual consciousness arises in dependence only on the eye and form, without regard to the memory of the sign.

original: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog dang bral ba can //
translated: The direct perception is free from conceptual thought.

original: zhes bya ba skabs su byas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba skabs su byas nas /
translated: Having made this statement,üîΩhe explains the meaning up to the point where it says,

original: gang la rtog pa de dag med //üîΩces bya ba'i par don gyis bshad pa yin no //üîΩ'on te ci'i phyir gnyi ga la rag las pas skye ba la mngon sum zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: gang la rtog pa de dag med // ces bya ba'i par don gyis bshad pa yin no // 'on te ci'i phyir gnyi ga la rag las pas skye ba la mngon sum zhes brjod kyi /
translated: where there is no conceptual thought.üîΩOr, why is it that, since it arises in dependence on both, it is called direct perception, and not that it is based on the object?

original: yul la brten pa zhes ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: yul la brten pa zhes ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: He explains just that with, If it is said, etc.

original: gal te dngos su shes skyed la //
analyzed: gal te dngos su shes skyed la //
translated: If it is said that it generates cognition directly,

original: dbang po bzhin du yul nus pa yin //
analyzed: dbang po bzhin du yul nus pa yin //
translated: The object is capable of producing the consciousness, like the sense faculty.

original: ji ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de ltar gzugs kyang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de ltar gzugs kyang yin no //
translated: Just as the sense faculty is the causal condition of the arising of the consciousness, so too is the object.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir gnyis rag las //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir gnyis rag las //
translated: If that is so, why is it said that consciousness arises in dependence on both?

original: skye ba mig dang gzugs dag la rag pas nas @189a * //
analyzed: skye ba mig dang gzugs dag la rag pas nas @189a * //
translated: Consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and visible form.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni gzugs des mi brjod /üîΩci tha snyad mi gdags zhes bya ba ni brgal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni gzugs des mi brjod / ci tha snyad mi gdags zhes bya ba ni brgal ba'o //
translated: But that consciousness is not called visible form.üîΩThe question is asked: ‚ÄúWhy is it not designated?‚Äù

original: go bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: go bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The answer is given: ‚ÄúBecause it is not a means of communication.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pa dgos pa med par don la tha snyad sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dgos pa med par don la tha snyad sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: People do not employ conventions for the sake of an object.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why is it said that consciousness arises in dependence on both?üîΩThis sound does not have the capacity to communicate the object that is the present topic of discussion.

original: sgra 'di ni brjod par bya ba'i skabs su bab pa 'di la go bar byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: sgra 'di ni brjod par bya ba'i skabs su bab pa 'di la go bar byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore,

original: go bar byed pa nyid mthong nas /
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid mthong nas /
translated: having seen that it is a means of communication,

original: tha snyad nges par sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: tha snyad nges par sbyor bar byed /
translated: one employs the convention.

original: go bar byed pa de la dbang po'i shes pa ston par byed pa'i skabs su bab pa dbang po'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: go bar byed pa de la dbang po'i shes pa ston par byed pa'i skabs su bab pa dbang po'i tha snyad do //
translated: The means of understanding is the sense perception. The occasion of the sense perception is the occasion of the sense perception convention.

original: de yi chos kyang des sbyor byed //
analyzed: de yi chos kyang des sbyor byed //
translated: Its property is also connected with it.

original: go bar byed pa khyab par byed pas sgra nges par sbyor ba 'os pa la khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: go bar byed pa khyab par byed pas sgra nges par sbyor ba 'os pa la khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The means of understanding is the pervader. The sound is connected with the proper object of the connection. The pervader is the meaning of the pervader.

original: 'dis ni sbyor ba'i don 'thad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyor ba'i don 'thad par byed pa yin no //
translated: This makes the meaning of the connection tenable.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar /
translated: Because it is like this:

original: de yi chos kyang nges sbyor byed //
analyzed: de yi chos kyang nges sbyor byed //
translated: Its property is also connected with it.

original: go bar byed pas khyab pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: go bar byed pas khyab pa'i rgyu //
translated: The means of understanding is the cause of the pervasion.

original: de bas tha snyad 'di la ni //üîΩgo bar byed pa'i rang bzhin rtags ni nges par sbyar /
analyzed: de bas tha snyad 'di la ni // go bar byed pa'i rang bzhin rtags ni nges par sbyar /
translated: Therefore, in this convention,

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i rtags nges par sbyar ba de ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i rtags nges par sbyar ba de ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: the means of understanding is the nature of the reason. The nature is connected with the definite connection. The nature is the reason. The definite connection is connected with it. The reversal occurs.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: go bar byed pa khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go bar byed pa khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the means of understanding, the pervader, the nature, is reversed.

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni sbyor ba'i khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo bstan to //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni sbyor ba'i khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo bstan to //
translated: All of this explains the pervasion of the subject and the pervader in the syllogism.

original: de de ltar na go bar byed pa'i tha snyad kyi bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de de ltar na go bar byed pa'i tha snyad kyi bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: This is an explanation of the convention of the proof statement,

original: skabs su bab pa'i don rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ji ltar rnam par shes pa lnga'i dmigs pa bsags pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i don rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no // 'o na ji ltar rnam par shes pa lnga'i dmigs pa bsags pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: but not of the meaning of the passage at hand.üîΩIf the five consciousnesses are accumulations, then how can it be established thatüîΩ‚ÄúThe five collections of consciousnesses have as their objects accumulations‚Äù?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni bsags pa la dmigs pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de gal te de gcig tu rnam par rtog pa bshad pa yin na de ji ltar rung /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni bsags pa la dmigs pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' gang yin pa de gal te de gcig tu rnam par rtog pa bshad pa yin na de ji ltar rung /
translated: If this is an explanation of the theory that the five consciousnesses are single conceptual consciousnesses, then how can it be correct?

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid la sogs pas skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yul can de dag rnam par shes pa tshogs lngar 'dod kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag ji ltarüîΩrang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid la sogs pas skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yul can de dag rnam par shes pa tshogs lngar 'dod kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin /
translated: Master Vasubandhu also explains:

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can kho na yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //üîΩphyogs snga ma 'di gnyis kyi lan bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can kho na yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro // phyogs snga ma 'di gnyis kyi lan bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: The five collections of consciousness are asserted to be the subjects that possess the objects‚Äô characteristics of the sense bases, such as the eye‚Äôs object of form. They are not the subjects that possess the characteristics of substance.

original: bsags pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩbsags pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di la bsags pa'i sgra ni tshogs pa brjod do //
analyzed: bsags pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / bsags pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di la bsags pa'i sgra ni tshogs pa brjod do //
translated: How is it that they are the subjects that possess the objects‚Äô characteristics?

original: tshogs pa de spyi la gal te spyi la dbang po'i blo 'jug par 'gyur pa de'i tshe rnam @189b par rtog par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar na /üîΩspyi blo gdon mi za bar yang //
analyzed: tshogs pa de spyi la gal te spyi la dbang po'i blo 'jug par 'gyur pa de'i tshe rnam @189b par rtog par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar na /üîΩspyi blo gdon mi za bar yang //
translated: They are only the subjects that possess the objects‚Äô general characteristics.

original: rnam par rtog dang 'bras bu 'brel //
analyzed: rnam par rtog dang 'bras bu 'brel //
translated: and the result is related to the discrimination.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the discrimination is engaged.

original: 'di la skyon yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la skyon yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: 'di ltar / don gzhan dang ni mngon 'brel phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar / don gzhan dang ni mngon 'brel phyir /
translated: Because it is related to another object,

original: rnam par shes par skyed par byed pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin skyed pa'i rkyen nye ba'i phyir /üîΩrdul phrar ba nye bar len pa'i rgyu sngar nus pa med pa dag las rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes par skyed par byed pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin skyed pa'i rkyen nye ba'i phyir / rdul phrar ba nye bar len pa'i rgyu sngar nus pa med pa dag las rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa /
translated: the cause of the arising of consciousness is the proximate condition of the nature of the capacity.üîΩFrom the atoms that previously had no capacity, the capacity to produce consciousness arises.

original: rdul phran gzhan gang skye 'gyur ba /
analyzed: rdul phran gzhan gang skye 'gyur ba /
translated: The atoms that arise are the cause of the apprehension of the object.

original: de dag gzhan dang gzhan thag nye ba'i gnas skabs thob par gyur pa'i so sor nus pa rnams bsags pa'i sgras bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gzhan dang gzhan thag nye ba'i gnas skabs thob par gyur pa'i so sor nus pa rnams bsags pa'i sgras bshad do //
translated: The collection of the individual capacities that obtain the state of proximity to the other atoms is explained by the word ‚Äúaggregate.‚Äù

original: de bas na bsags pa dmigs pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na bsags pa dmigs pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the aggregate is said to be the object.

original: de dag las rdul phran gyi nus pa skyes par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: de dag las rdul phran gyi nus pa skyes par 'gyur ba na /
translated: When the capacity of the atoms arises from that,

original: de dag ni dbang po'i shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po'i shes pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: they are the reason for the arising of the sense consciousness.

original: rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yin no //
translated: They are the cause.

original: bsags pa zhes bya ba spyir gyur pa tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: bsags pa zhes bya ba spyir gyur pa tha dad pa'am /
translated: In general, that which is called an accumulation is either different or not different from the general class.

original: tha dad pa med pa cung zad yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa cung zad yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But since it does not exist in the least,

original: gang gis na bsags pa dmigs pa zhes bshad pa la phyogs snga ma'i skabs yod par 'gyur gang brjod pa /üîΩskye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la yang rdul phran rnams kyi gang don gzhan dang 'brel pa las rnam par shes pa
analyzed: gang gis na bsags pa dmigs pa zhes bshad pa la phyogs snga ma'i skabs yod par 'gyur gang brjod pa / skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la yang rdul phran rnams kyi gang don gzhan dang 'brel pa las rnam par shes pa
translated: how could the context of the opponent‚Äôs position exist in the explanation that the object of accumulation is observed?üîΩThe opponent says, ‚ÄúThe objects of the sense faculties are the specific characteristics of the sense bases, not the specific characteristics of substance.üîΩThe specific characteristics of atoms that produce consciousness when they are related to other objects are not the specific characteristics of substance.üîΩIf the specific characteristics of atoms are not the specific characteristics of substance, then the specific characteristics of the sense faculties are also not the specific characteristics of substance.üîΩIf the specific characteristics of the sense faculties are not the specific characteristics of substance, then the specific characteristics of the sense bases are also not the specific characteristics of substance.

original: skye par byed pa'i khyad par skye bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par de yang gal te yang de dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa la rten pa can bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rgyud snga ma yongs su gyur pa las skye bar 'gyur baüîΩde na yang /üîΩde yul chod pa med pa la sogs pa la gnas na /
analyzed: skye par byed pa'i khyad par skye bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par de yang gal te yang de dag phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa la rten pa can bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rgyud snga ma yongs su gyur pa las skye bar 'gyur baüîΩde na yang /üîΩde yul chod pa med pa la sogs pa la gnas na /
translated: If the specific characteristics of the sense bases are not the specific characteristics of substance, then the specific characteristics of the aggregates are also not the specific characteristics of substance.

original: rdul phran gzhan dag med par ni /
analyzed: rdul phran gzhan dag med par ni /
translated: But if there are no other atoms,

original: med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med par 'gyur te /
translated: it would not be a cognition of many.

original: de 'dra ba ni skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the nature of that cognition to produce such a cognition of many.

original: de bas na de gcig nges med phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de gcig nges med phyir /
translated: Therefore, because that cognition is not definitely one,

original: shes pa de ni rdul phran gyi rdzas kyi rnam par 'jog par nges pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de dag gi lhan cig pa'i nus pa rnams ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa gcig skyed par byed pa'i phyir shes pa mtshungs pa'i spyod yul can du bshad /
analyzed: shes pa de ni rdul phran gyi rdzas kyi rnam par 'jog par nges pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de dag gi lhan cig pa'i nus pa rnams ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa gcig skyed par byed pa'i phyir shes pa mtshungs pa'i spyod yul can du bshad /
translated: it is not the nature of that cognition to be determined as the form of the substance of an atom, and because the potencies of those atoms together produce a single effect, consciousness, it is explained as having a similar object.

original: spyir de dag thams cad ni de'i spyod yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: spyir de dag thams cad ni de'i spyod yul can yin gyi /
translated: In general, all of them are its objects,

original: shes pa de re re la so sor nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de re re la so sor nges pa ma yin te /
translated: but it is not determined for each individual cognition.

original: de dag thams cad kyi de ni thun mong gi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩskye mched kyi spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang @190a * //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi de ni thun mong gi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // skye mched kyi spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang @190a * //
translated: The meaning is that all of them are its common effect.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: It is also not the case that it is a cognition of a universal of the sense bases.

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis kyang rdul phra rab kyi rdzas gcig gi nges pa bsal bar lta ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis kyang rdul phra rab kyi rdzas gcig gi nges pa bsal bar lta ba'i phyir /
translated: This also eliminates the assertion that the substance of a single subtle particle is ascertained.

original: nus pas 'phags pa'i spyi'i yul can nyid ma yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: nus pas 'phags pa'i spyi'i yul can nyid ma yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do // de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the fact that the sense consciousnesses are not the apprehenders of universals because they are not the apprehenders of substances.

original: ci ste skye mched gcig nyid la yang cig car du mar mi snang na /
analyzed: ci ste skye mched gcig nyid la yang cig car du mar mi snang na /
translated: This is true, but if many things do not appear simultaneously to a single sense faculty,

original: 'bras bu dbang po'i rnam par shes pa gcig byed pas skye mched kyi ngo bo gcig bzung du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'bras bu dbang po'i rnam par shes pa gcig byed pas skye mched kyi ngo bo gcig bzung du zin kyang /
translated: then even though a single object field is apprehended because a single sense consciousness arises,

original: rdzas du ma cig car mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: rdzas du ma cig car mi 'dzin la /
translated: many substances are not simultaneously apprehended.

original: 'on kyang rigs bzhin du yin pa de ltar na /üîΩmang po rnams kyi 'bras bu thun mong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir spyi'i yul can nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs bzhin du yin pa de ltar na / mang po rnams kyi 'bras bu thun mong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir spyi'i yul can nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no zhes /
translated: However, if many things do appear simultaneously to a single sense faculty,üîΩthen many substances are simultaneously apprehended.üîΩIf many things do not appear simultaneously to a single sense faculty,

original: gal te cig car rdzas mang po 'dzin pa med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te cig car rdzas mang po 'dzin pa med pa de'i tshe /
translated: then many things are not simultaneously apprehended.

original: til la sogs pa tha dad pa la ci'i phyir cig car 'dzin par snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: til la sogs pa tha dad pa la ci'i phyir cig car 'dzin par snang bar 'gyur /
translated: Why do sesame seeds and so on appear to be apprehended simultaneously?

original: til dang yungs kar dang ma sha ka la sogs pa yul rnam par chad pa na gnas pa rnams rdzas gzhan rtsom pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: til dang yungs kar dang ma sha ka la sogs pa yul rnam par chad pa na gnas pa rnams rdzas gzhan rtsom pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because sesame seeds, mustard seeds, and mƒÅ·π£a beans and so on that are located in different places do not create different substances.

original: mang po de dag la yang ci'i phyir cig car 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: mang po de dag la yang ci'i phyir cig car 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: Why do many of them appear to be apprehended simultaneously?

original: gal te rim bzhin du rdzas re re 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rim bzhin du rdzas re re 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: If they are apprehended one by one in sequence,

original: til dang yungs kar la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rigs mi mthun pa dag kyang rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: til dang yungs kar la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rigs mi mthun pa dag kyang rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir /
translated: then sesame seeds, mustard seeds, and so on that are of different types do not create different substances.

original: tha dad par snang ba'i ngang tshul can de dag la ji ltar cig car 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba'i ngang tshul can de dag la ji ltar cig car 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: How could they appear to be apprehended simultaneously?

original: de bas na gang zhig ji srid spyod yul du gyur pa de dag thams cad cig car bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: de bas na gang zhig ji srid spyod yul du gyur pa de dag thams cad cig car bar gyur pa na /
translated: Therefore, if all those that become objects of the mind simultaneously,

original: mngon sum nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: they are direct perception. In that case,

original: 'di la rigs pa ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa ci zhig bya /
translated: what reasoning is there to apply to this?

original: mthong ba go rims dang ldan pa yin na yang mthong ba myur zhing myur bar 'jug pa la /
analyzed: mthong ba go rims dang ldan pa yin na yang mthong ba myur zhing myur bar 'jug pa la /
translated: But if the seeing is not in order, then it is not quick, and it does not engage quickly.

original: 'khrul pas go rims med par zhen pa phyin ci log gi yin no zhes bya ba rtog pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pas go rims med par zhen pa phyin ci log gi yin no zhes bya ba rtog pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: So the error of the nonexistence of the order of the sequence of the letters is not tenable.

original: de ltar na go rims bzhin du zhen pa'i phyin ci log 'di la yang mgyogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar na go rims bzhin du zhen pa'i phyin ci log 'di la yang mgyogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, the error of the nonexistence of the order of the sequence of the letters is also explained as quick.

original: sngar bsal zin to //
analyzed: sngar bsal zin to //
translated: It has already been refuted earlier.

original: gzhan yang til la sogs pa rim bzhin 'byung can de dag la /
analyzed: gzhan yang til la sogs pa rim bzhin 'byung can de dag la /
translated: Moreover, in the case of sesame seeds, etc.,

original: myur ba mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: myur ba mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir //
translated: because of the sameness of quickness,

original: rim bzhin 'dzin pa cis ma yin //
analyzed: rim bzhin 'dzin pa cis ma yin //
translated: why is there no apprehension of the order of sequence?

original: gcig ces bya ba nyid 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba nyid 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: There is apprehension of the sameness called ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: cig car gzung ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur na yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car gzung ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur na yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said that it is apprehended all at once, that is not so.

original: de'i phyir 'dir cig car rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir cig car rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the cause of the all-at-onceness of the apprehension.

original: dus mtshungs can bla thams cad kyi //
analyzed: dus mtshungs can bla thams cad kyi //
translated: All the cognitions that have the same time

original: blo 'ga' zhig kyang dus yun ring du gnas pa med cing gzhan myur du 'jug pa can yin no //
analyzed: blo 'ga' zhig kyang dus yun ring du gnas pa med cing gzhan myur du 'jug pa can yin no //
translated: Some cognitions do not last long, while others are very quick.

original: des na dus mtshungs pa can gyi myur du 'jug pa'i blo thams @190b cad de las 'ga' zhig blo ni yul gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir rim min snang ba dang yul la'ang /
analyzed: des na dus mtshungs pa can gyi myur du 'jug pa'i blo thams @190b cad de las 'ga' zhig blo ni yul gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir rim min snang ba dang yul la'ang /
translated: Thus, all cognitions that are simultaneous with the object are quick, and there is no order in their appearance because they obtain the object‚Äôs features.

original: gzhan yang rim pa ldan pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang rim pa ldan pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could there be an order in the object?

original: gang gi tshe myur ba cig car snang ba'i rgyu yin pa de'i tshe myur ba de blo thams cad la khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe myur ba cig car snang ba'i rgyu yin pa de'i tshe myur ba de blo thams cad la khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: When the cause of the appearance of quickness is simultaneous, then the quickness is not different in all cognitions.

original: de phyir don kun 'dzin pa la //
analyzed: de phyir don kun 'dzin pa la //
translated: Therefore, in apprehending all objects,

original: myur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: myur ba'i phyir /
translated: it is quick.

original: 'di ni rim min thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ni rim min thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: This is the consequence of disorder.

original: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la lar cig car mthong ba zhen pa gang yin pa de dang mgyogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la lar cig car mthong ba zhen pa gang yin pa de dang mgyogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, when one sees simultaneously in a certain desired object, there is no difference in the quickness of the attachment to each object.

original: gal te rdzas du ma cig car mi 'dzin pa de'i ni /
analyzed: gal te rdzas du ma cig car mi 'dzin pa de'i ni /
translated: If one does not apprehend many substances simultaneously,üîΩthen the cognition of a multicolored object would not be simultaneous.

original: phye ma leb khra la sogs gzugs //
analyzed: phye ma leb khra la sogs gzugs //
translated: The variegated color of a butterfly,

original: rma bya dang stan khra bo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rma bya dang stan khra bo la sogs pa'o //
translated: a variegated cloth, etc.

original: gcig ma yin pa ni sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: gcig ma yin pa ni sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: If it is not one, it is many.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo dag cig car ji ltar snang bar 'gyur te snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo dag cig car ji ltar snang bar 'gyur te snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How can the nature of blue, etc. appear simultaneously? It cannot appear.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te sna tshogs de gcig na /
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs de gcig na /
translated: if the variegated is one,

original: de la rma bya'i mdongs la sogs pa la sngon po la sogs pa du ma cig car mi 'dzin no ;
analyzed: de la rma bya'i mdongs la sogs pa la sngon po la sogs pa du ma cig car mi 'dzin no ;
translated: the eye of a peacock‚Äôs tail, etc. does not simultaneously grasp the many, blue, etc.

original: /'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then does it grasp?

original: yan lag gi ngo bo sna tshogs pa gcig yin te de mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gi ngo bo sna tshogs pa gcig yin te de mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: It grasps the one, the variegated, which is the nature of the parts.

original: de las 'di ches ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: de las 'di ches ngo mtshar che //
translated: This is even more amazing!

original: sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo sna tshogs pa la brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo sna tshogs pa la brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is not ‚Äúvariegated‚Äù said to be of various natures?

original: gang yang khyod sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba gcig yin no zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: gang yang khyod sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba gcig yin no zhes brjod pa /
translated: But you say that the one, the variegated, is the many, blue, etc.

original: rma bya'i mdongs kyi ngo bo de las kyang 'di ches ngo mtshar che'o zhes dpyas pa yin no //
analyzed: rma bya'i mdongs kyi ngo bo de las kyang 'di ches ngo mtshar che'o zhes dpyas pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the peacock‚Äôs eye is even more amazing than that.üîΩThus:

original: di ltar / sna tshogs de gcig rang bzhin min //
analyzed: di ltar / sna tshogs de gcig rang bzhin min //
translated: That variety is not of the nature of one.

original: dper na nor bu'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nor bu'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: It is like the form of a jewel.

original: ji ltar na nor bu'i rigs tha dad pa rnams gcig tu spungs pa dag ni gzugs sna tshogs pa blo sna tshogs par snang bas gzung bar bya ba gcig ma ma yin pa de ltar rma bya la gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs
analyzed: ji ltar na nor bu'i rigs tha dad pa rnams gcig tu spungs pa dag ni gzugs sna tshogs pa blo sna tshogs par snang bas gzung bar bya ba gcig ma ma yin pa de ltar rma bya la gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs
translated: Just as the different types of jewels, when heaped together, appear as a variety of forms and a variety of cognitions, and are not apprehended as one, in just the same way, the variety of natures such as blue that exist in the peacock‚Äôs tail

original: pa de gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: pa de gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: are not of the nature of one.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig sna tshogs pa yin pa de ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig sna tshogs pa yin pa de ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is a variety is not of the nature of one,

original: dper na rigs tha dad pa'i nor bu'i gzugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rigs tha dad pa'i nor bu'i gzugs lta bu'o //
translated: like the form of a jewel of a different type.

original: rma bya'i mdongs kyi ngo bo yang sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rma bya'i mdongs kyi ngo bo yang sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the peacock‚Äôs eye is a variety of natures. This is a finding of a contradictory pervasion.

original: ras khra la sogs pa sngo sogs //
analyzed: ras khra la sogs pa sngo sogs //
translated: The variegated cloth and so on

original: rnam pa tha dad mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad mtshungs pa yin //
translated: are of the same kind as the blue and so on.

original: tshon sna tshogs kyis bsgyur ba'i snal ma rigs sna tshogs pa las bsgrubs pa'i ras dang stan la sogs pa la ji ltar na sngon po la @191a * //üîΩsogs pa'i kha dog rnam par phye nas /
analyzed: tshon sna tshogs kyis bsgyur ba'i snal ma rigs sna tshogs pa las bsgrubs pa'i ras dang stan la sogs pa la ji ltar na sngon po la @191a * // sogs pa'i kha dog rnam par phye nas /
translated: In a cloth or a mat that is made of threads of various colors, the colors blue and so on are distinguished,üîΩand one apprehends them with a mind that does not observe other forms.

original: 'di ni sngon po yin la 'di ni ser po yin no zhes gzugs gzhan la mi dmigs pa'i blos 'dzin cing rnam pa tha dad par 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po yin la 'di ni ser po yin no zhes gzugs gzhan la mi dmigs pa'i blos 'dzin cing rnam pa tha dad par 'dzin gyi /
