translated: One apprehends them as different aspects.üîΩIt is not reasonable to apprehend them as one.

original: de dag la gcig nyid du 'dzin pa de rigs pa ma yin pa de ltar rma bya'i mdongs la yang yin pas na rma bya'i mdongs la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la gcig nyid du 'dzin pa de rigs pa ma yin pa de ltar rma bya'i mdongs la yang yin pas na rma bya'i mdongs la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: The same is true of the eye of a peacock feather. Therefore the eye of a peacock feather and so on are not of the nature of a single entity.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas blos so sor rnam par phye nas gzung ba sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo de ni gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas blos so sor rnam par phye nas gzung ba sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo de ni gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is apprehended by a mind that distinguishes it by means of different aspects such as blue is not a single entity,üîΩlike a cloth.

original: dper na tshon rigs mi mthun pas nye bar bsgyur ba'i snal ma las bsgrub pa'i ras khra bo'i ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tshon rigs mi mthun pas nye bar bsgyur ba'i snal ma las bsgrub pa'i ras khra bo'i ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the nature of a multicolored cloth that is produced from threads that are modified by different colors.

original: rma bya la sogs pa'i gzugs kyang sngon po tha dad pa'i sgo nas blos rnam par phye nas bzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rma bya la sogs pa'i gzugs kyang sngon po tha dad pa'i sgo nas blos rnam par phye nas bzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the form of a peacock‚Äôs tail-feathers should be apprehended by the mind after distinguishing it by way of the different blues. This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: de la gal te yan lag gzugs //
analyzed: de la gal te yan lag gzugs //
translated: In that regard, if the parts are the form,

original: de ltar 'ba' zhig snang 'gyur na //
analyzed: de ltar 'ba' zhig snang 'gyur na //
translated: then it would appear in that way alone.üîΩThis is blue.

original: 'di ni sngon po'o //üîΩ'di ni ser po zhes bya ba la sogs rab tu rnam par phye na /üîΩrma bya'i mdongs 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yan lag gi ngo bo ni yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po'o // 'di ni ser po zhes bya ba la sogs rab tu rnam par phye na / rma bya'i mdongs 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yan lag gi ngo bo ni yin gyi /
translated: This is yellow.

original: yan lag can gyi ngo bo ni ma yin pa de ltar na gzhan 'dis gtan tshigs ma grub par smra'o //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi ngo bo ni ma yin pa de ltar na gzhan 'dis gtan tshigs ma grub par smra'o //
translated: After distinguishing it in that way, the one who apprehends the peacock‚Äôs tail-feathers apprehends the nature of the parts, but not the nature of the whole. In that case, this other one says that the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar sngo sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngo sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: In this way, he replies with ‚Äúthe blue, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar yongs su mthong gyur pa'i//
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mthong gyur pa'i//
translated: Just as it is seen,

original: sngo sogs bsal nas ni /
analyzed: sngo sogs bsal nas ni /
translated: after removing the blue, etc.,

original: bor nas yan lag can gyi ngo bo gzhan //
analyzed: bor nas yan lag can gyi ngo bo gzhan //
translated: Having discarded that, the nature of the whole is different.

original: rma bya mthong ngo ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: rma bya mthong ngo ngo mtshar che //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving seen the peacock, how wondrous!‚Äù

original: sna tshogs pa ngo mtshar du 'gyur ba de mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ngo mtshar du 'gyur ba de mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that having seen the variety, it is wondrous.

original: 'dis ni yan lag can gyi ngo bo med pa la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yan lag can gyi ngo bo med pa la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the non-observation of nature is in the absence of the nature of the whole.

original: bcos ma dang bcos ma ma yin pa'i phye ma leb kyi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul gyi blo skye ba gang yin pa de dag ni don gyi rnam pa dang / dus mtshungs pa can nyid du nye bar mtshon cing des pa dag las bcos ma ma yin pa'i phye ma le ba ci 'dra ba'i blo rnam par phye nas sngon po'i rnam pa can dang /
analyzed: bcos ma dang bcos ma ma yin pa'i phye ma leb kyi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul gyi blo skye ba gang yin pa de dag ni don gyi rnam pa dang / dus mtshungs pa can nyid du nye bar mtshon cing des pa dag las bcos ma ma yin pa'i phye ma le ba ci 'dra ba'i blo rnam par phye nas sngon po'i rnam pa can dang /
translated: The cognitions that apprehend the nature of the artificial and non-artificial butterfly are simultaneous with the aspect of the object. They are indicated as being simultaneous with the object. From among those, the cognition of the non-artificial butterfly is distinguished. The cognition of the blue aspect is distinguished.

original: rim ma yin pa dang ldan pa mtshon par byed pa de 'dra ba tshon rams la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pas byas pa bcos ma'i phye ma leb kyi ngo bo sna tshogs pa can nyid du mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: rim ma yin pa dang ldan pa mtshon par byed pa de 'dra ba tshon rams la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pas byas pa bcos ma'i phye ma leb kyi ngo bo sna tshogs pa can nyid du mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The variegated nature of the artificial butterfly is indicated by the various colors of the different substances, such as the dyes, that are used to make it.

original: de de ltar na /üîΩdon rnams dus mtshungs can nyid du //
analyzed: de de ltar na / don rnams dus mtshungs can nyid du //
translated: In this way,üîΩthe cognition that perceives

original: mtshon pa byed pa'i blo dag gis //
analyzed: mtshon pa byed pa'i blo dag gis //
translated: the simultaneous object

original: bcos pa'i phye ma leb la blos //
analyzed: bcos pa'i phye ma leb la blos //
translated: is like the cognition of the artificial butterfly.

original: gcig ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rdzas rtsom pa med @191b pas yan lag can med pa nyid kyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rim ldan don sna tshogs /
analyzed: gcig ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rdzas rtsom pa med @191b pas yan lag can med pa nyid kyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rim ldan don sna tshogs /
translated: Since the single, non-artificial butterfly is not composed of substances of different types, it is not apprehended as having parts. Therefore, it is not variegated.

original: yul sna tshogs pa can yin no //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs pa can yin no //
translated: It is a single object with a variegated appearance.

original: de 'dra ba nyid du gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba nyid du gyur pa yin na /
translated: If it were like the artificial butterfly,

original: bcos ma ma yin pa'i phye ma leb la /üîΩgzhan ni rim min don gcig ci'i phyir 'dod /
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa'i phye ma leb la / gzhan ni rim min don gcig ci'i phyir 'dod /
translated: the cognition of the non-artificial butterflyüîΩwould not be like the cognition of the artificial butterfly.

original: gnyig la yang blo ni rim bzhin ma yin pa dang ldan pa dang / don sna tshogs pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyig la yang blo ni rim bzhin ma yin pa dang ldan pa dang / don sna tshogs pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In both cases, the cognition would be non-sequential and would have a variegated object.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la blo'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa can yin pa de ni sna tshogs pa yin te dper na bcos ma'i phye ma leb lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la blo'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa can yin pa de ni sna tshogs pa yin te dper na bcos ma'i phye ma leb lta bu'o //
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whatever has a variegated nature in terms of cognition is variegated, like a variegated artificial butterfly.

original: bcos ma ma yin pa'i phye ma leb las kyang blo'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa'i phye ma leb las kyang blo'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And a natural inference is that a non-artificial butterfly has a variegated nature in terms of cognition.

original: gzhan yang / blo rnams sna tshogs ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo rnams sna tshogs ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, because cognitions have a variegated nature,

original: blo'i snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir /üîΩdngos rnams sna tshogs ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir / dngos rnams sna tshogs ngo bo nyid /
translated: because the appearances of cognitions are variegated,

original: sna tshogs pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: things are established as having a variegated nature.

original: blo'i snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid de yang /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid de yang /
translated: And the variegation of the appearances of cognitions

original: phye ma leb khra bo la yod pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: phye ma leb khra bo la yod pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: exists in a multicolored butterfly.

original: ci'i phyir 'di la sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di la sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa ma yin /
translated: So why is it not variegated, such as blue?

original: ci de yan lag min /
analyzed: ci de yan lag min /
translated: Is it not a part of it?

original: blo'i snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rgyun yin pa de'i tshe tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rgyun yin pa de'i tshe tha dad pa'i rgyu gzhan /
translated: If it is the cause of the variegation of the appearances of cognitions, then another cause of the variegation of the appearances of cognitions is not necessary.

original: gang gis dngos po rnams kyi tha dad rnam par bzhag 'di grub /
analyzed: gang gis dngos po rnams kyi tha dad rnam par bzhag 'di grub /
translated: This establishes the presentation of the difference of things.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rgyu ci yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rgyu ci yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no cause at all for diversity.

original: gal te sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig cig phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa la sna tshogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi /üîΩsngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa can ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig cig phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa la sna tshogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi / sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa can ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the nature of the whole, called ‚Äúdiversity,‚Äù is the cause of the cognition that has the mode of apprehending the variegated, such as a multicolored butterfly, as diverse,üîΩthen it is not the cause of the cognition that apprehends blue, etc.

original: ri mo sogs blo sna tshogs min /
analyzed: ri mo sogs blo sna tshogs min /
translated: The cognition of a multicolored object is not diverse.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni stan khra bo la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni stan khra bo la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes a multicolored blanket, etc.

original: blo sna tshogs pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo sna tshogs pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition is not diverse.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rigs mi mthun rnams rtsom med phyir //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun rnams rtsom med phyir //
translated: Because there is no composition of heterogeneous entities.

original: sngon po la sogs pa gang la rigs mi mthun pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa yod pa de ni rigs mi mthun pa can no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa gang la rigs mi mthun pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa yod pa de ni rigs mi mthun pa can no //
translated: That which has a variety of heterogeneous aspects, such as blue, has heterogeneous entities.

original: rigs mi mthun pa can de dag ni 'bras bu'i rdzas rtsom pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa can de dag ni 'bras bu'i rdzas rtsom pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because those of dissimilar type do not compose the substance of the effect,

original: yan lag can yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag can yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the possessor of parts does not exist.

original: de med pa'i phyir de la yan lag gi yon tan rnams kyang sna tshogs pa'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig mi rtsom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de la yan lag gi yon tan rnams kyang sna tshogs pa'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig mi rtsom pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that does not exist, the qualities of the parts also do not compose the single nature of the possessor of the various parts.

original: sna tshogs pa yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the single nature of the possessor of the various parts does not exist,

original: gang gis na blo sna tshogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na blo sna tshogs par 'gyur /
translated: by what would the mind become various?

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don yod pa gang yin pa de dag kyang so so re re sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /üîΩri mo @192a * //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don yod pa gang yin pa de dag kyang so so re re sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na / ri mo @192a * //
translated: Those that are the existent objects such as blue, etc., also do not exist as the various natures of each individual one.üîΩIn that case,

original: la sogs pa la sna tshogs pa'i blo med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa la sna tshogs pa'i blo med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the mind would not be various with regard to the picture, etc.

original: ri mo la sogs pa la yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa la yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The single nature of the possessor of parts does not exist in the picture, etc.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i ldan pa sna tshogs pa yod pa yin zhing /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ldan pa sna tshogs pa yod pa yin zhing /
translated: The various combinations of blue, etc., exist.

original: des byas pa ni de'i blo yin no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des byas pa ni de'i blo yin no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that arises from that is the cognition of that.

original: 'di ltar ldan pa sna tshogs min no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ldan pa sna tshogs min no //
translated: Thus there is no diversity of inherence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzugs med phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no form.

original: ldan pa yon tan gyi bdag nyid la gzugs zhes bya ba'i yon tan gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa yon tan gyi bdag nyid la gzugs zhes bya ba'i yon tan gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In inherence, which is the nature of a quality, there is no other quality called form,

original: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la yon tan med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because qualities do not have other qualities.

original: gal te ji ltar yang sgra'i yul ldan pa sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar yang sgra'i yul ldan pa sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though the object of sound is not diverse in nature,

original: phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa la yod pa'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo sna tshogs pa dang chos mthun pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs pa nye bar btags nas bshad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa la yod pa'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo sna tshogs pa dang chos mthun pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs pa nye bar btags nas bshad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: it is like a variegated object, such as a butterfly, which has a diverse nature in its parts.

original: btags tsam rten ma yin /
analyzed: btags tsam rten ma yin /
translated: Inherence is not the basis of mere designation.

original: ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúinherence‚Äù is supplied.

original: ldan pa nye bar btags pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa nye bar btags pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Inherence is not the object of mere designation.

original: de ltar de sna tshogs pa dang 'dra bas sna tshogs pa zhes brjod na /
analyzed: de ltar de sna tshogs pa dang 'dra bas sna tshogs pa zhes brjod na /
translated: Thus, if it is said that it is variegated because it is like a variegated thing,

original: 'di ltar phye ma leb la yan lag can gyi ngo bo khra bo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phye ma leb la yan lag can gyi ngo bo khra bo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then a butterfly does not have a variegated nature that is a whole.

original: yan lag so so re re la yang sna tshogs pa nyid nye bar btags pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag so so re re la yang sna tshogs pa nyid nye bar btags pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does each individual part have a variegated nature that is a designation.

original: gal te gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid tha dad pa nye bar btags pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid tha dad pa nye bar btags pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that both are the cause of the designation of a variegated nature that is different in essence,

original: ma yin te phye ma leb khra bo'i gzugs la sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir dang / ri mo la sogs pa la yang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang ri mo la sogs pa la ldan don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin te phye ma leb khra bo'i gzugs la sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir dang / ri mo la sogs pa la yang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang ri mo la sogs pa la ldan don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir /
translated: that is not so, because a variegated form of a butterfly does not exist, and because a variegated nature does not exist in a painting and so on.

original: nye bar brtags pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if a designation is made because of the aggregation of the meeting of the parts, such as a painting,

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: then that is not tenable.

original: de ltar na gang la sngon po la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la /
analyzed: de ltar na gang la sngon po la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams la /
translated: Thus, in regard to a blue part and so on,

original: 'du ba dang ldan pa yin na yan lag de rnams so so la ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i ldan pa yod pa ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ste de rnams yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du ba dang ldan pa yin na yan lag de rnams so so la ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i ldan pa yod pa ma yin gyi / 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo ste de rnams yod pa yin te /
translated: If it is associated with a collection, it is not that the various natures of those parts are associated with each part.

original: re re sna tshogs yin phyir ro ;
analyzed: re re sna tshogs yin phyir ro ;
translated: However, the nature of blue, etc., exists, because each is various.

original: / don gcig la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir yang btags pa tsam gyi don rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / don gcig la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir yang btags pa tsam gyi don rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the object is not related to a single meaning, it is not reasonable that the object is mere imputation.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi ri mo la sogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i yan lag rim bzhin du mthong ba skye zhing de ni sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo gcig yin no zhes bsre bar byed pa'i blo sna tshogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi ri mo la sogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i yan lag rim bzhin du mthong ba skye zhing de ni sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo gcig yin no zhes bsre bar byed pa'i blo sna tshogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: This is so, but the arising of the seeing of the parts of blue, etc., of a painting, etc., is various, and the mind that mixes them arises as a single various nature.

original: @192b ri mo'i sngon po la sogs pa rim bzhin du ni bzung ba la'am /üîΩsna tshogs blo yis bsre min zhing //
analyzed: @192b ri mo'i sngon po la sogs pa rim bzhin du ni bzung ba la'am / sna tshogs blo yis bsre min zhing //
translated: The parts of blue, etc., of a painting are apprehended in sequence,üîΩand the mind does not mix them as various.

original: blo sna tshogs pas bsre bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo sna tshogs pas bsre bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind does not mix them as various.

original: de ltar na de gsal bar snang ba nyid kyi phyir dbang po'i blo 'dod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de gsal bar snang ba nyid kyi phyir dbang po'i blo 'dod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, because it appears as clear, it is the object of the sense consciousness.

original: dbang po'i blo de skye ba ma yin pa de ltar na yang gang gis don du ma 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can sre bar byed pa skye ba yin no zhes 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo de skye ba ma yin pa de ltar na yang gang gis don du ma 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can sre bar byed pa skye ba yin no zhes 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: Even though the sense consciousness does not arise in that way, you assert that the consciousness that apprehends many objects arises.

original: don du ma blo gcig gis 'dzin pa thob ste /
analyzed: don du ma blo gcig gis 'dzin pa thob ste /
translated: At that time, the consciousness that apprehends many objects is obtained.

original: du ma blo gcig gis 'dzin phyir ro //üîΩrgyu'i phyir ci ste skye mched gcig nyid la yang /
analyzed: du ma blo gcig gis 'dzin phyir ro // rgyu'i phyir ci ste skye mched gcig nyid la yang /
translated: Because one consciousness apprehends many objects.üîΩIf you say that is not so, then the reason that you stated earlier, ‚ÄúBecause it is a cause,‚Äù is undermined.

original: cig car du ma mi snang na //
analyzed: cig car du ma mi snang na //
translated: If it is a cause, then why do many objects not appear simultaneously in one sense base?

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni nyams par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar na ji ltar yid kyi blo don du ma 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can 'dzin pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni nyams par 'gyur ro // de ltar na ji ltar yid kyi blo don du ma 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can 'dzin pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: That is what you said, but now it is undermined.

original: dbang po'i blo yang rang gi yul du ma 'dzin pa la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo yang rang gi yul du ma 'dzin pa la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: Thus, just as the mental consciousness apprehends many objects, why is it contradictory for the sense consciousness to apprehend many objects?

original: de ltar na gang de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na gang de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: In that case, it is not suitable for you to say anything.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar ri mo la sogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa la ngo bo sna tshogs pa can gcig med par yang sna tshogs par snang ba can gyi blo gcig tu 'gyur ba de'i phyir don du ma can gcig yul du ma can gyi blo
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar ri mo la sogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa la ngo bo sna tshogs pa can gcig med par yang sna tshogs par snang ba can gyi blo gcig tu 'gyur ba de'i phyir don du ma can gcig yul du ma can gyi blo
translated: Because in this way, even though there is no single entity with a variety of aspects, such as blue, etc., in a painting, etc., a single cognition that has a variety of aspects arises. Therefore, a single cognition that has many objects, that has many aspects, is not contradictory.

original: gcig 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar 'grub 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar 'grub 'gyur ro //
translated: Because in this way, even without a single entity with a variegated nature in the blue, etc., of a painting, there is a single cognition that has a variegated appearance. Therefore, a single cognition that has many objects, that has many objects, is established.

original: de bas na don du mas bskyed par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na don du mas bskyed par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is produced by many objects,

original: spyi'i spyod yul can gyi rnam par shes pa shes pa zhes bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: spyi'i spyod yul can gyi rnam par shes pa shes pa zhes bya ba yang ngo //
translated: the cognition that has a universal as its object is also called cognition.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When that is so,

original: de phyir yang don sna tshogs pa cig car 'dzin pa'i phyir yang blo rtog pa med pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: de phyir yang don sna tshogs pa cig car 'dzin pa'i phyir yang blo rtog pa med pa 'grub bo //
translated: then, because it grasps many different objects simultaneously, non-conceptual cognition is also established.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is that done?

original: re zhig 'dri rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gsal bar snang ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: re zhig 'dri rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gsal bar snang ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: First, it is explained that the clear appearance does not exist in the conceptual cognition.

original: de la gus pa med pas yang brjod par bya ste 'di ltar yang /
analyzed: de la gus pa med pas yang brjod par bya ste 'di ltar yang /
translated: Out of disrespect for that, it will be said again:

original: don gcig la ni rtogs pa na //
analyzed: don gcig la ni rtogs pa na //
translated: When one cognizes one thing,

original: de las gzhan pa'ang mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: one sees the other.

original: gang gi tshe sngon po la sogs pa'i don cig car mthong bar 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon po la sogs pa'i don cig car mthong bar 'gyur ba la /
translated: When one sees a thing such as blue all at once,

original: sngon po sngon po zhes rang gi ming dang 'brel ba'i sngon po gcig kho na 'dzin par byed pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: sngon po sngon po zhes rang gi ming dang 'brel ba'i sngon po gcig kho na 'dzin par byed pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: one apprehends only the blue that is related to its name, saying ‚ÄúThis is blue.‚Äù

original: de'i logs na gnas pa'i don snang ba kho na de dus der rang gi ming dang sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i logs na gnas pa'i don snang ba kho na de dus der rang gi ming dang sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: At that time, the thing that appears in the other part of the field of vision is not related to its name,

original: cig car ming dang rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car ming dang rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the name and the conception do not arise simultaneously.

original: de ltar de dag la sgra dang / ma 'dres pa nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar de dag la sgra dang / ma 'dres pa nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, because they apprehend the sound and the object separately,

original: mngon sum rtog pa med pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa med pa grub pa yin no //
translated: perception is established as being nonconceptual.

original: sna tshogs snang can zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zhig sna tshogs pa de ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba @193a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang can zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zhig sna tshogs pa de ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba @193a * //
translated: The argument ‚ÄúThat which appears as various things is not of the nature of one‚Äù is stated in the line ‚ÄúBecause it appears as various things.‚Äù

original: lam nges par smra'o //
analyzed: lam nges par smra'o //
translated: This is the path of reasoning.

original: sna tshogs snang can don rnams la //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang can don rnams la //
translated: The entities of the various appearances

original: rnam pa tha dad cing sna tshogs pa'i snang ba phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa la 'byung ba can gyi yan lag gi ngo bo gang yin pa de rnams ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir gal te gcig nyid mi rigs na de'i tshe
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad cing sna tshogs pa'i snang ba phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa la 'byung ba can gyi yan lag gi ngo bo gang yin pa de rnams ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir gal te gcig nyid mi rigs na de'i tshe
translated: The entities of the various parts that occur in the various and manifold appearances of variegated butterflies and so on are manifold. If it is illogical that they are one,

original: / re zhig blo de gcig nyid la //üîΩji ltar du ma snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: / re zhig blo de gcig nyid la // ji ltar du ma snang bar 'gyur //
translated: then how could that cognition be one?

original: sna tshogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi blo yang sna tshogs par snang ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi blo yang sna tshogs par snang ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: How could it be that a cognition that has the mode of apprehending manifold objects appears as manifold?

original: gcig nyid du mi 'gyur na 'dod pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig nyid du mi 'gyur na 'dod pa de'i phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is not one because it is a cognition that apprehends manifold objects and appears as manifold, then that is not established for you.

original: rnam pa de don dam par 'dod pa gang yin pa de la skyon 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa de don dam par 'dod pa gang yin pa de la skyon 'di yin gyi /
translated: This fault is for those who assert that those aspects are ultimate,

original: nga la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nga la ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not for me.üîΩBecause I do not assert that.

original: de ltar mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that, it is said:

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang gsungs pa //
translated: The learned ones have said

original: de ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin //
analyzed: de ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin //
translated: that this is the power of things.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, has said this.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What has he said?

original: gang de dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang de dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever comes from the power of things.‚Äù

original: de gang zhen /
analyzed: de gang zhen /
translated: What is that?

original: ji lta ji ltar don bsams pa //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar don bsams pa //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is thought about in terms of meaning,

original: gcig dang du ma'i rnam pa gang dag gis rigs pas dpyad pa na /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rnam pa gang dag gis rigs pas dpyad pa na /
translated: whether it is one or many, when it is analyzed by reasoning,

original: de ni de ltar rnam pa de dang / rnam par bral zhing stong par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar rnam pa de dang / rnam par bral zhing stong par 'gyur te /
translated: it is devoid of that aspect and becomes empty.

original: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig la yang rnam par mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig la yang rnam par mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not abide in any nature at all.‚Äù

original: chos rnams bdag med par bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: chos rnams bdag med par bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to teach that phenomena are selfless,

original: gzhan gyi sgo nas gcig la sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'god par mdzad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgo nas gcig la sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'god par mdzad do //
translated: he posits the argument ‚ÄúThe various in one‚Äù and so on from the perspective of others.

original: gal te blo gcig la sna tshogs de don dam par cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te blo gcig la sna tshogs de don dam par cir 'gyur /
translated: If the various in one mind were ultimate, what would happen?

original: don dam par blo sna tshogs pa des dngos po yang sna tshogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par blo sna tshogs pa des dngos po yang sna tshogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Ultimate variousness would establish things as various.

original: de bzhin du bden par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba po'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bden par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba po'i bsam pa'o //
translated: It would be true in that way. This is the thought of the questioner.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: The treatise states:

original: de yi blo yang mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yi blo yang mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: His mind would not change.

original: gcig dang sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba de ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig dang sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba de ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone and various‚Äù is contradictory.

original: gcig nyid yin na don dam par ngo bo sna tshogs pa ma yin pa yang rnam pa sna tshogs par snang ba don dam par de'i rnam pa de dag kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes nan gyis 'dod par bya ste gcig pa nyid nyams par thal ba'i
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na don dam par ngo bo sna tshogs pa ma yin pa yang rnam pa sna tshogs par snang ba don dam par de'i rnam pa de dag kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes nan gyis 'dod par bya ste gcig pa nyid nyams par thal ba'i
translated: If it were one, then ultimately it would not be various natures, and yet it would appear as various aspects. Ultimately, those aspects would not exist, because it is insisted that the fault of the loss of oneness would ensue.

original: phyir ro // gcig dang du ma nyid dag gi gnas pa'i rten don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa ma gtogs par 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir ro // gcig dang du ma nyid dag gi gnas pa'i rten don dam par rnam pa tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa ma gtogs par 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from being either ultimately different or non-different, there is no other basis for oneness and otherness.

original: de la gal te don dam par blo sna tshogs pa dang gcig yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la gal te don dam par blo sna tshogs pa dang gcig yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: In that regard, if one asserts that ultimately the mind is both various and one,

original: sna tshogs pa ma lus pa yang rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ma lus pa yang rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: then all that is various would become a single substance.

original: de ltar na cig car skye ba @193b la sogs pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: de ltar na cig car skye ba @193b la sogs pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: In that case, the faults of arising simultaneously and so on would ensue.

original: de'i phyir gcig yin na yang rnam pa du ma can ma yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig yin na yang rnam pa du ma can ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, even if it is one, it is not endowed with many aspects.

original: 'on kyang gal te 'di bdag don 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te 'di bdag don 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that the self is the object,

original: de'i ngo bo can ma yin par 'gyur ba dag kyang /üîΩde'i ngo bo'i sgo nas gsal ba gang yin pa de dang don dam par gnas pa de kho na nyid yin na de la bdag gi 'gog par byed pas /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo can ma yin par 'gyur ba dag kyang / de'i ngo bo'i sgo nas gsal ba gang yin pa de dang don dam par gnas pa de kho na nyid yin na de la bdag gi 'gog par byed pas /
translated: then those that are not of its natureüîΩare not the self, because they are not the self.üîΩWhat is the use of refuting them?

original: ci zhig bya ste de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ci zhig bya ste de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that it would be like that.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar don gyi rnam pa so sor snang ba de kho na nyid ma yin pa de phyir don dang ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar don gyi rnam pa so sor snang ba de kho na nyid ma yin pa de phyir don dang ste /
translated: Since the appearance of the aspect of the object is not reality, therefore the object

original: gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'dod pa dag dang / shes pa la 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod pa yang /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'dod pa dag dang / shes pa la 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod pa yang /
translated: that is asserted to be the object of apprehension and consciousness that is asserted to be the apprehender

original: rags snang ma yin /
analyzed: rags snang ma yin /
translated: do not appear as coarse.

original: gang 'dir rags pa'i rnam par snang ba de phyi'am nang na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang 'dir rags pa'i rnam par snang ba de phyi'am nang na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which appears here in a coarse aspect does not exist externally or internally.

original: de ltar na rags par snang ba de gcig gam du mar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de ltar na rags par snang ba de gcig gam du mar 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, does that appearance as coarse appear as one or many?

original: re zhig gcig la rags par snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gcig la rags par snang ba ma yin te /
translated: First, the gross does not appear in one.

original: rags pa gcig nyid ni bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa gcig nyid ni bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the gross itself has been refuted.

original: gang la yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang la yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were to exist,üîΩit would be the nature of a whole, but that does not exist.

original: yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig po 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes sngar bsal zin to //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig po 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes sngar bsal zin to //
translated: That has already been refuted earlier.

original: de dag nyid rags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i mang po la yang /
analyzed: de dag nyid rags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i mang po la yang /
translated: Also, in the many that are of that gross aspect,

original: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs rnams la yod pa ma yin rdul phrag ba re re la gang shes pa rags par snang ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs rnams la yod pa ma yin rdul phrag ba re re la gang shes pa rags par snang ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the form of subtle atoms does not exist. In each subtle atom, the aspect of the cognition that appears as gross does not exist.

original: tshogs pa la yang de'i ngog cig yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: tshogs pa la yang de'i ngog cig yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Also, in the collection, that nature does not exist.

original: gang gis na rnam par shes pa 'dra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na rnam par shes pa 'dra bar 'gyur /
translated: By what would the consciousness be similar?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: That is so, but

original: phyi rol gyi don ni med mod kyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni med mod kyi /
translated: external objects do not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang ba can don dam par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid gnyis su snang ba can don dam par yod do zhe na /
translated: Consciousness itself, which appears as dual, exists ultimately.

original: de dang de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is also illogical.

original: 'di ltar nang gi yongs gcod nang gi bdag nyid gcig tu yongs su gcod pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nang gi yongs gcod nang gi bdag nyid gcig tu yongs su gcod pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the ascertainment of the internal as the internal is the experience of the aspect of apprehension, which is the ascertainment of the internal as the internal.

original: cha 'di gang las gzhan /
analyzed: cha 'di gang las gzhan /
translated: From what part is it different?

original: phyi rol bzhin du gnas pa yin /
analyzed: phyi rol bzhin du gnas pa yin /
translated: It is like the external.

original: byis pa rnams kyis dpyad na'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis dpyad na'o //
translated: If the fools analyze,

original: phyi rol gyi don yod pa dang med kyang rung /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod pa dang med kyang rung /
translated: whether external objects exist or not,

original: blo ngo bo gnyis pa can nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: blo ngo bo gnyis pa can nyid yin gyi /
translated: the mind has a double nature.

original: blo gcig la don dam par rnam pa de gnyig rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo gcig la don dam par rnam pa de gnyig rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But in one mind, these two aspects are not really possible,

original: gcig nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the loss of oneness.

original: ci ste yang de gzung ba'i rnam par snang bar gyur pa /
analyzed: ci ste yang de gzung ba'i rnam par snang bar gyur pa /
translated: But if it appears as the aspect of the object,

original: blo'i snang ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: it is not the appearance of the mind.

original: blo'i yul gyi rnam pa ma yin pa de ltar na nyams su myong ba yod pa tsam las 'di'i shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: blo'i yul gyi rnam pa ma yin pa de ltar na nyams su myong ba yod pa tsam las 'di'i shes pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: Then, it is not the aspect of the object of the mind. In that case, it would not be possible to say that this is the cognition of this, from the mere experience of the object.

original: blo'i don dang 'dra ba 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: blo'i don dang 'dra ba 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted that the object is like the appearance of the mind.

original: de yang nang du @194a * //
analyzed: de yang nang du @194a * //
translated: And that is internal.

original: 'dus pa nas gzhan 'dra ba gcig yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'dus pa nas gzhan 'dra ba gcig yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: There is no other similarity with the other collections.

original: blo nyid blor snang ba can yin no //
analyzed: blo nyid blor snang ba can yin no //
translated: Thus, the cognition itself is the appearance of cognition.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig gi chas gnas pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig gi chas gnas pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Since it does not abide in part as a single cognition,

original: don dam par de tha dad ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par de tha dad ma yin no //
translated: ultimately it is not different.üîΩAnd that is also said:

original: de yang / tha dad med can shes pa yi //
analyzed: de yang / tha dad med can shes pa yi //
translated: The cognition that is not different

original: de'i yang gang 'di tha dad snang ba de bslad pa yin /
analyzed: de'i yang gang 'di tha dad snang ba de bslad pa yin /
translated: The appearance of difference in that is erroneous,

original: rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of one with eye disease and so on.

original: shes pa bdag nyid gcig pa de la gcig kyang 'dzin pa'am gzung ba'i rnam pa med pa na nan gyis khas len par byed na /
analyzed: shes pa bdag nyid gcig pa de la gcig kyang 'dzin pa'am gzung ba'i rnam pa med pa na nan gyis khas len par byed na /
translated: If one were to insist that in that single cognition there is no appearance of a single object or aspect of an apprehender,

original: gnyi ga dag kyang nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyi ga dag kyang nyams par 'gyur /
translated: then both would be undermined.

original: gzung ba nyid dang 'dzin pa nyid phan tshun ltos nas de dag rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid dang 'dzin pa nyid phan tshun ltos nas de dag rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the status of object and subject is posited in mutual dependence.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar shes pa la gnyi ga mi 'thad pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar shes pa la gnyi ga mi 'thad pa /
translated: Since in this way both are untenable in cognition,

original: de phyir gnyi gas stong pa nyid /
analyzed: de phyir gnyi gas stong pa nyid /
translated: therefore it is emptiness of duality.

original: shes pa / de yis de nyid de nyid yin //
analyzed: shes pa / de yis de nyid de nyid yin //
translated: That cognition is suchness itself.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de ni bslad pa nyid yin na'ang /
analyzed: de ni bslad pa nyid yin na'ang /
translated: Even though it is itself erroneous,

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa med pa de'i tshe /üîΩde dag ste gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa yul dang yul can gyi rnam pa'i rten gyi sgo nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa med pa de'i tshe / de dag ste gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa yul dang yul can gyi rnam pa'i rten gyi sgo nas /
translated: when consciousness is devoid of the aspect of the apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams /
translated: then those, i.e., form, feeling, etc., which are characterized by being established in the aspect of object and subject,üîΩeven though they are different and various,

original: tha dad kyang sna tshogs pa nyid yin na yang bslad pa ste 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad kyang sna tshogs pa nyid yin na yang bslad pa ste 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: are erroneous, i.e., mistaken.üîΩWhy is it so?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because:

original: 'di ltar / dngos rnams tha dad gnas pa 'di //üîΩde tha dang rten dang tshul can //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos rnams tha dad gnas pa 'di // de tha dang rten dang tshul can //
translated: This difference in thingsüîΩis due to their difference in cause, mode and basis.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: It is due to the difference in the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: blo'i snang ba tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa ni /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa ni /
translated: The difference and non-difference of the appearance of cognition

original: dngos po rnams tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par rnams par gnas pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par rnams par gnas pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: is due to the difference and non-difference in the establishment of things.

original: gal te de ci yang ma yin pa de'i tshe dngos po rnams tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med pa gang las yin /
analyzed: gal te de ci yang ma yin pa de'i tshe dngos po rnams tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med pa gang las yin /
translated: If it is nothing at all, then how could things be different or not different?

original: de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, arising and so on are also like that.

original: de ltar na sngar dmigs par ma gyur pa phyis don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi dmigs pa skyes pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na sngar dmigs par ma gyur pa phyis don gyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyi dmigs pa skyes pa na /
translated: Thus, when the object that did not exist previously arises, having the nature of holding the aspect of the object,

original: de'i yul can gyi rtogs pa skye ba ni /
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi rtogs pa skye ba ni /
translated: then the cognition that has it as its object arises.

original: yang de lta bu'i rnam pa dmigs pa'i snang ba dang bral ba na /
analyzed: yang de lta bu'i rnam pa dmigs pa'i snang ba dang bral ba na /
translated: When it is free from the appearance of the aspect of the object,üîΩthen the convention ‚Äúit ceases‚Äù is used.

original: 'gag pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad byed par 'gyur ro gang gi tshe gang gis dmigs pa dang gang dmigs pa de gnyi ga med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gag pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad byed par 'gyur ro gang gi tshe gang gis dmigs pa dang gang dmigs pa de gnyi ga med pa'i phyir /
translated: When neither the object nor the cognition that has it as its object exists,

original: 'ba' zhig kyang dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig kyang dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then the mere object is not apprehended either,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of the aspect of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de'i tshe skye ba la dmigs pa'i rten can ma yin pa de ltar na nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba la dmigs pa'i rten can ma yin pa de ltar na nges pa yin no //
translated: At that time, it is not the basis of the cognition of arising. Thus, it is ascertained.

original: dngos po'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa 'ba' zhig @194b bslad pa yin par ma zad kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa 'ba' zhig @194b bslad pa yin par ma zad kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Not only is the difference and nondifference of things a mistake, but alsoüîΩtheir identity is a mistake, because their characteristics are empty.

original: rang bzhin med pa yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las //
translated: Not only is the difference and non-difference of things a mistake, but also they are essenceless because their characteristics are empty.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:üîΩThe characteristics of the apprehended and the apprehenderüîΩare not at all the way they appear.

original: cung zad yul can nyid du bstan pa ni mtshan nyid yin te /üîΩdper na rnam par shes par byed pas na /
analyzed: cung zad yul can nyid du bstan pa ni mtshan nyid yin te / dper na rnam par shes par byed pas na /
translated: The characteristics of the mind are taught to be the slightest bit of subjectivity.üîΩFor example, consciousness is so called because it is that which makes known,

original: rnam par shes pa dang mtshan mang 'dzin pas na 'du shes dang nyams su myong bar byed pas na tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang mtshan mang 'dzin pas na 'du shes dang nyams su myong bar byed pas na tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: and feeling is so called because it is that which experiences.

original: gzugs la sogs pa cung zad yul du 'gyur ba bdag nyid ji lta bzhin du mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa cung zad yul du 'gyur ba bdag nyid ji lta bzhin du mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir /
translated: The characteristics of form and so on are posited as the slightest bit of objectivity, just as they are.

original: yul dang yul can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rjes su 'brel pa'i ngang tshul can du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yul dang yul can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rjes su 'brel pa'i ngang tshul can du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It arises in the mode of being connected with the subject and object, the apprehended and apprehender.üîΩ

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las //
translated: They occur in the mode of being connected with the aspects of object and subject, of object apprehended and subject apprehender.

original: dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid gzhan //üîΩnyid du gzhan ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid gzhan // nyid du gzhan ni yod ma yin //
translated: The defining characteristics of thingsüîΩare not different from the aspects of object and subject.

original: gzung pa dang 'dzi pa'i rnam pa'i 'brel pa ma gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung pa dang 'dzi pa'i rnam pa'i 'brel pa ma gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other defining characteristic apart from the connection with the aspects of object and subject.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de dag de kho na nyid ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa de dag de kho na nyid ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The aspects of object and subject are not reality.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is not the slightest ultimate defining characteristic.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid de rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid de rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because that defining characteristic is empty of essence,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin zhing /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin zhing /
translated: it is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a defining characteristic,

original: rang bzhin med par rab tu bshad //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par rab tu bshad //
translated: it is explained as essenceless.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The defining characteristic of things

original: rang bzhin med par rab tu bshad //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par rab tu bshad //
translated: is explained as essencelessüîΩby the transcendent buddhas.

original: mtshan nyid de lta bu'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de lta bu'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the reality that has that characteristic.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi don khas len na yang chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa can te 'di ltar /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol gyi don khas len na yang chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa can te 'di ltar /
translated: Moreover, even if one accepts external objects, all phenomena are without characteristics, because

original: phung po la sogs bye brag gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni dper na /
analyzed: phung po la sogs bye brag gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni dper na /
translated: the particular characteristics of the aggregates and so on are likeüîΩthe meaning of ‚Äúaggregate,‚Äù for example, is ‚Äúthat which has become a heap.‚Äù

original: spungs par gyur pa de ltar na spungs pa'i don ni phung po dang / mched par byed pas na mched pa'i don te skye mched kyi don dang / skyed par byed pa nyid kyi 'byung khungs kyi don ni khams kyi don lta bu'o //
analyzed: spungs par gyur pa de ltar na spungs pa'i don ni phung po dang / mched par byed pas na mched pa'i don te skye mched kyi don dang / skyed par byed pa nyid kyi 'byung khungs kyi don ni khams kyi don lta bu'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúsense base‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which causes expansion,‚Äù and the meaning of ‚Äúconstituent‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which is the source of generation.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid de thams cad byed pa'i khyad par can te byed pa'i bye brag can no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de thams cad byed pa'i khyad par can te byed pa'i bye brag can no //
translated: All those characteristics are particularized by activity, that is, they are particularized by the distinction of activity.

original: byed pa de yang sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: byed pa de yang sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: And that activity is a superimposition,

original: chos thams cad byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because all phenomena are without activity.

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist ultimately.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: byed pa de yang de nyid min //
analyzed: byed pa de yang de nyid min //
translated: that activity is not reality.

original: rang bzhin med pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa yin no //
translated: It is without intrinsic nature.

original: rgyu des kyang dngos po de dag mtshan nyid bral mtshan nyid med pa can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des kyang dngos po de dag mtshan nyid bral mtshan nyid med pa can yin no //
translated: And by that cause, those things are devoid of characteristics and are not characterized.

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa yin na yang /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa yin na yang /
translated: Even though things are without intrinsic nature,üîΩthe Blessed OneüîΩhas established the individual, separate characteristics of form and so on.üîΩIn order to show that there is no contradiction in that,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIn dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,

original: bcom @195a * //
analyzed: bcom @195a * //
translated: the Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.üîΩIn dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,

original: ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis /
translated: the Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.üîΩIn dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,üîΩthe Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid so so tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid so so tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa mdzad pa /
translated: In dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,üîΩthe Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.üîΩIn dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,üîΩthe Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.

original: de ji ltar mthong ba nyid la brten nas mdzad pa de ltar na 'gal ba med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ji ltar mthong ba nyid la brten nas mdzad pa de ltar na 'gal ba med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,üîΩthe Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.

original: ji lta'i rang rkyen la ltos nas //
analyzed: ji lta'i rang rkyen la ltos nas //
translated: In dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,üîΩthe Blessed One has taught

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the characteristics of form and so on.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba so sor nges pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba so sor nges pa'i sgo nas /
translated: In dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,üîΩthe Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.üîΩIn dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,üîΩthe Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la don dam pa bzhin du mthong bar byed pa'i /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la don dam pa bzhin du mthong bar byed pa'i /
translated: In dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,üîΩthe Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.

original: rnam rig de bzhin min rnam par //
analyzed: rnam rig de bzhin min rnam par //
translated: In dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,

original: skye 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye 'gyur ro //
translated: the Blessed One has taught

original: gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gang dag ce na /
translated: the characteristics of form and so on.üîΩIn dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,

original: ma rigs pas bcom bdag nyid can /üîΩso so'i skye bo nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ma spangs pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: ma rigs pas bcom bdag nyid can /üîΩso so'i skye bo nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ma spangs pa can gyi'o //
translated: the Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.üîΩIn dependence on the world‚Äôs perspective,üîΩthe Blessed One has taughtüîΩthe characteristics of form and so on.

original: 'dis ni phyin ci log tu snang ba'i rgyu la stan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyin ci log tu snang ba'i rgyu la stan to //
translated: This indicates the cause of the appearance of the erroneous.

original: phyin ci log pa'i rnam pa yang ci dang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /üîΩrab rib can sogs bzhin /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i rnam pa yang ci dang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na / rab rib can sogs bzhin /
translated: What is the form of the erroneous?üîΩLike the form of those with eye disease, etc.

original: rab rib can la sogs pa bzhin du phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa skye'o //
analyzed: rab rib can la sogs pa bzhin du phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa skye'o //
translated: The form of the erroneous is like the form of those with eye disease, etc.

original: gal te rnam par rig pa phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa yin na /
translated: If the representations do not depend on external objects,

original: ci'i phyir yul nges pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩji lta'i rang rkyen la ltos nas //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yul nges pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur zhe na / ji lta'i rang rkyen la ltos nas //
translated: why do they occur in terms of the determination of the object, etc.?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúIn accordance with the conditions that are their own.‚Äù

original: ltos par byed pas na ltos pa ste ltos pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos par byed pas na ltos pa ste ltos pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Dependence‚Äù means dependence on something else.

original: rkyen gyi bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rkyen gyi bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú In accordance with the conditions that are their own‚Äù means in accordance with the nature of the conditions.

original: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med na yang rnam par rig pa rang dbang gis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med na yang rnam par rig pa rang dbang gis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Even without depending on external objects, the representations occur autonomously.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: rnam par rig pa la la'i rgyud yongs su gyur pa 'ga' zhig skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa la la'i rgyud yongs su gyur pa 'ga' zhig skye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The cause of the arising of some transformation of the continuum of some consciousness.

original: de ltar na rkyen gyi bdag nyid ji ltar nye ba bzhin du rnam pa 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na rkyen gyi bdag nyid ji ltar nye ba bzhin du rnam pa 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, it shows that some aspect arises in accordance with the nature of the conditions that are present.

original: phyin ci log 'khrul pa de yang rnam pa thams cad dus bon med pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: phyin ci log 'khrul pa de yang rnam pa thams cad dus bon med pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, that error of misconception does not exist in any way without a seed.

original: 'on kyang de'i sa bon 'di nyid ces bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i sa bon 'di nyid ces bstan par mi nus te /
translated: However, it cannot be shown that this is its seed.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of mind and mental factors.

original: gal te bstan par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin de ji ltar yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bstan par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin de ji ltar yod pa yin zhe na /
translated: If its nature cannot be shown, how can it exist?

original: gal te de med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If it did not exist,

original: med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ji ltar mi lam na dmigs pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi rmi lam na dmigs pa de ltar sad pa na yang /
analyzed: med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ji ltar mi lam na dmigs pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi rmi lam na dmigs pa de ltar sad pa na yang /
translated: then, because nonexistence is undifferentiated, just as the objects perceived in a dream are not perceived when one awakens,

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: All the conventions of birth, death, etc.

original: skyes bu mthong ba po bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu mthong ba po bzhin no //
translated: are applicable, just like the person who is the seer.

original: med pa 'di dag la bye brag ci yod de /
analyzed: med pa 'di dag la bye brag ci yod de /
translated: What is the difference between these two, the existent and the nonexistent?

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa gtan nas @195b / med pa'i ngo bo yang skye ba dang 'chir bar 'gyur te /üîΩmngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu bzhin nam 'di yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa gtan nas @195b / med pa'i ngo bo yang skye ba dang 'chir bar 'gyur te / mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu bzhin nam 'di yang ma yin te /
translated: The son of a barren woman, etc., which are utterly nonexistent, would also be born and die.

original: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because there is no difference.

original: de ltar na 'khrul pas bon med pa ni phyin ci log tu snang ba can yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'khrul pas bon med pa ni phyin ci log tu snang ba can yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the nonexistence of the seed, which is imagined by error, would not occur even in a mistaken appearance.

original: de ni de nyid rigs can min /
analyzed: de ni de nyid rigs can min /
translated: It is not the domain of those who are not supreme seers.

original: gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: gang dag gis she na /
translated: By whom is it not the domain?

original: mchog mthong min pa thams cad kyis /üîΩsangs rgyas las gzhan pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pas bslad pa'i gnas skabs can dag gis te /
analyzed: mchog mthong min pa thams cad kyis / sangs rgyas las gzhan pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pas bslad pa'i gnas skabs can dag gis te /
translated: By all who are not supreme seers.üîΩIt is the domain of only the Buddha, not of others, who are in a state of error in regard to subject and object.

original: sangs rgyas kho nas de kho na nyid mkhyen gyis gzhan gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kho nas de kho na nyid mkhyen gyis gzhan gyis ma yin no //
translated: The Buddha alone knows reality, not others.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyin ci log gi rnam pa nyid rnam par phye ba can nyid yin yang ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag par mdzad pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyin ci log gi rnam pa nyid rnam par phye ba can nyid yin yang ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag par mdzad pa /
translated: The Lord Buddha has taught that even though the aspects are of the nature of error, they are posited as they are seen.

original: de ltar na zhen pa mnga' ba'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zhen pa mnga' ba'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus he has taught the cause of the adherence.

original: mchog mthong ba yin pas de nyid rigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: mchog mthong ba yin pas de nyid rigs pa ma yin na /
translated: Since it is not the seeing of reality, it is not reasonable.

original: gzung dang zhes bya ba la sogs smos pa la /
analyzed: gzung dang zhes bya ba la sogs smos pa la /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe apprehended and the apprehender,‚Äù and so on.

original: mchog mthong ba ma yin pa de rnams ni bzung dang 'dzin pa'i bslad pa dag med par med phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog mthong ba ma yin pa de rnams ni bzung dang 'dzin pa'i bslad pa dag med par med phyir ro //
translated: Those who do not see the supreme do not exist without the contamination of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: rtag tu bzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas bslad pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba dang bslad pa de 'dra ba ni mchog dang khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu bzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas bslad pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba dang bslad pa de 'dra ba ni mchog dang khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin no //
translated: Since they are always contaminated by the aspects of the apprehended and the apprehender, that seeing and contamination is not the supreme and the sublime.

original: de dag la gnyis kyis dben pa mchog mthong ba yang yod pa ma yin na gang gis na de kho na nyid de shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag la gnyis kyis dben pa mchog mthong ba yang yod pa ma yin na gang gis na de kho na nyid de shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Since they do not have the seeing of the supreme, which is the absence of duality, how could they know thatness?

original: gnyis kyi bag chags rtsa nas bton pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi bag chags rtsa nas bton pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the habitual tendencies of the two are not completely removed.

original: gang gi tshe de dag gis gnyis kyis dben pa mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag gis gnyis kyis dben pa mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they see the absence of the two, then they see reality,

original: 'di gnyis kyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latter is characterized by the absence of the two.

original: des te de'i phyir /
analyzed: des te de'i phyir /

analyzed: de nyid don btang snyoms can de kho na nyid kyi don mtshan nyid dang bral ba btang snyoms su mdzad pa can /

analyzed: de ltar na gzugs sna tshogs pa dang blo sna tshogs pa dag kyang skyon mtshungs pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: Thus, although the various forms and the various minds are similar in being faults,üîΩin terms of which aspect,

original: rnam pa gang gis blo gcig yin par brjod kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis blo gcig yin par brjod kyi /
translated: it is said that the mind is one.üîΩIn that case, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: gzugs sna tshogs pa yang ma yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs pa yang ma yin pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: shes pa sngo sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa sngo sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The cognition of blue and so on.

original: shes pa sna tshogs pa la /
analyzed: shes pa sna tshogs pa la /
translated: In the various cognitions,

original: sngo sna tshogs snang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: sngo sna tshogs snang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa /
