original: shes khyad par yin shes pa'i bye brag yin te nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes khyad par yin shes pa'i bye brag yin te nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the particular cognition, the distinction of cognition, which is said to be of the nature of experience.

original: de nyid gcig yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid gcig yin gyi /
translated: That is one.

original: gzhan rten min shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa gcig nyid bzhin du don gzhan la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan rten min shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa gcig nyid bzhin du don gzhan la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not dependent on another, because it is the nature of cognition, and thus, like the cognition itself, it is not dependent on another object.

original: sna tshogs par mthong ba der snang ba'i ngang tshul can de 'dra bar gyur pa de de las gzhan pa'i ser po la sogs pa'i snang ba tha dad pa yan gar ba mthong nus ma yin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs par mthong ba der snang ba'i ngang tshul can de 'dra bar gyur pa de de las gzhan pa'i ser po la sogs pa'i snang ba tha dad pa yan gar ba mthong nus ma yin te /
translated: When one sees a variety, the mode of appearance is such that one is unable to see a separate, independent appearance of yellow and so on that is different from that.

original: der snang ba na de las gzhan pa shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid can thams cad kyang nges par snang ba'i phyir dang / gcig mi snang bas kyang gzhan yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der snang ba na de las gzhan pa shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid can thams cad kyang nges par snang ba'i phyir dang / gcig mi snang bas kyang gzhan yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When it appears as that, all other objects that are of the same nature as that consciousness definitely appear, and because one does not see one, one does not see the other.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'jal bar byed pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'jal bar byed pas /
translated: When one ascertains blue and so on,üîΩone distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.

original: de la ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de las gzhan pa ser po la sogs pa dag las sngon po'o //üîΩ/'di ser po'o zhes shes pa gzhan gyis 'byed par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de las gzhan pa ser po la sogs pa dag las sngon po'o // /'di ser po'o zhes shes pa gzhan gyis 'byed par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.

original: rnam pa de lta de ltar /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta de ltar /
translated: When one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.

original: 'byed byed pa na shes pa de tshol bar byed pa ma yin te /üîΩde ni de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byed byed pa na shes pa de tshol bar byed pa ma yin te / de ni de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: When one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on.üîΩWhen one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow and so on, one distinguishes blue from other objects such as yellow

original: don la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: don la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: It is the object that is engaged.

original: don nyid la de'i shes pa 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don nyid la de'i shes pa 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the object that causes the cognition of it to engage.

original: de bas na rnam pa gcig snang bar gyur pa na yang thams cad pa'am cung zhig kyang ma yin pa de ltar na shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba tha dad par byed nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa gcig snang bar gyur pa na yang thams cad pa'am cung zhig kyang ma yin pa de ltar na shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i snang ba tha dad par byed nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even when a single aspect appears, it is not all and it is not a part. Thus, it is not possible to make a distinction in the appearance of blue, etc., in cognition.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, external objects are not various.

original: de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa gcig @196b chod pa na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na sngon po la sogs pa gcig @196b chod pa na yang /
translated: Thus, when one blue, etc., is apprehended,

original: gzhan la 'jug pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir don yang cig car ram so so nas 'dzin bar 'gyur na shes pa ni de ltar 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la 'jug pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir don yang cig car ram so so nas 'dzin bar 'gyur na shes pa ni de ltar 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: since it is seen to engage with another, the object is apprehended either simultaneously or separately. But cognition is not apprehended in that way.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / shes pa ji ltar snang gang yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes pa ji ltar snang gang yin //
translated: Whatever appears in cognition

original: de ni de ltar nyams myong 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de ltar nyams myong 'gyur //
translated: is experienced in that way.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang /
translated: Even if it is of some aspect,

original: de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa gags byed pa yod na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa gags byed pa yod na yang ma yin no //
translated: it is not if another aspect obstructs it.

original: de ltar gcig ngo bor 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gcig ngo bor 'gyur /
translated: Thus, it would be a single entity.

original: gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be a single thing.

original: sems ni sna tshogs pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sems ni sna tshogs pa mthong ba'o //
translated: The mind is seen to be various.

original: rnam pa ni sna tshogs pa ste nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo sna tshogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni sna tshogs pa ste nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo sna tshogs par snang ba'o //
translated: The aspects are various, appearing as the various natures of experience.

original: de'i phyir gang sna tshogs pa rnam par phye bar nus pa can de ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa yin pa de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhugs pa med pas ma nges pa ma yin
analyzed: de'i phyir gang sna tshogs pa rnam par phye bar nus pa can de ni gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa yin pa de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhugs pa med pas ma nges pa ma yin
translated: Therefore, the reason, ‚ÄúThat which is able to discriminate the various is not of the nature of a single thing,‚Äù is qualified. Thus, it is not inconclusive because it does not apply to the discordant side.

original: no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: blo sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa ma yin na yang /
analyzed: blo sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa ma yin na yang /
translated: Even though it does not discriminate like the mind that apprehends the various aspects,

original: rma bya la sogs pa sna tshogs pa der 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: rma bya la sogs pa sna tshogs pa der 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: it apprehends the various things such as peacocks,

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa so so tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa so so tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it apprehends the individual differences of blue and so on.

original: des na phyi rol sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na phyi rol sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the external is of the nature of various things.

original: blo'i ni ma yin te de'i snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: blo'i ni ma yin te de'i snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid yin na /
translated: It is not the mind, because if it were, it would be the various appearances of the mind.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not the mind, because the various appearances of the mind are mutually different.

original: phyi rol gyi ras dang rma bya la sogs pa de la yang sngon po la sogs pa re re chod pa ni gzhan mchod pa tha dad par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ras dang rma bya la sogs pa de la yang sngon po la sogs pa re re chod pa ni gzhan mchod pa tha dad par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yang /
translated: And in the case of cloth, peacocks, etc., which are external, the various colors, blue, etc., are mutually different.

original: yan lag rnams kyi gzugs yin gyi /
analyzed: yan lag rnams kyi gzugs yin gyi /
translated: The various colors of the parts are not the various colors of the whole.

original: yan lag can gyi ma yin na gang gis sna tshogs pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi ma yin na gang gis sna tshogs pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If the various colors of the parts are not the various colors of the whole, how can there be variegation?

original: de'i phyir ras dang rma bya la sogs pa'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig yin no zhe na /üîΩgal te de ltar ras la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir ras dang rma bya la sogs pa'i yan lag can gyi ngo bo gcig yin no zhe na / gal te de ltar ras la sogs pa'i ngo bo gcig yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the whole, such as cloth, etc., is one.

original: ras sogs gzugs ni gcig yin na /
analyzed: ras sogs gzugs ni gcig yin na /
translated: If the nature of cloth, etc., is one,

original: khas len na de ltar tha dad med par 'gyur /
analyzed: khas len na de ltar tha dad med par 'gyur /
translated: then, if you accept that, it will not be variegated.

original: de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni blo yod pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni blo yod pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt will not be variegated‚Äù means that it will not be variegated like the various aspects of the mind.

original: re zhig yan lag chod pa can gyi yan lag can gyi ngo bor 'dzin pa'i blo yang tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig yan lag chod pa can gyi yan lag can gyi ngo bor 'dzin pa'i blo yang tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: The cognition apprehending the nature of the whole as having parts that are cut off would also be non-different.

original: sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo snang ba mtshang ba med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin na /üîΩ'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo snang ba mtshang ba med pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin na / 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: The meaning is that the appearance of a variety of natures would be without fault.üîΩBut that is not the case.

original: de ni gcig nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gcig nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a single unit.

original: yan lag gi ngo bo de dang de tha dad par bzung bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag gi ngo bo de dang de tha dad par bzung bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the nature of the parts apprehended as different?

original: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe yan lag rnams bzung bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de'i tshe yan lag rnams bzung bar gyur pa na /
translated: If that were so, when the parts are apprehended,

original: ji ltar @197a * //
analyzed: ji ltar @197a * //
translated: how could

original: blo la yan lag gi ngo bo snang ba de ltar /
analyzed: blo la yan lag gi ngo bo snang ba de ltar /
translated: the nature of the whole appear to the mind?

original: yan lag can gyi ngo bo yang tha dad par rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi ngo bo yang tha dad par rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of the whole would also be apprehended as different by way of its own nature.

original: 'di ltar tha dad can ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad can ni /
translated: In that case,

original: gzugs la sogs pa yan lag gi ngo bo rnams rnam phye bas na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yan lag gi ngo bo rnams rnam phye bas na /
translated: since the natures of the parts such as form are distinguished,

original: blos tha dad par byas pa ste /
analyzed: blos tha dad par byas pa ste /
translated: the mind would make them different.

original: bor na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bor na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúif they are lost‚Äù is that.

original: tha dad med can ni yan lag can gyi ngo bo gzhan mi mthong /
analyzed: tha dad med can ni yan lag can gyi ngo bo gzhan mi mthong /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is not different‚Äù refers to the fact that the nature of the whole is not seen as different from the nature of the parts.

original: yan lag gi ngo bo las tha dad pa la'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi ngo bo las tha dad pa la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is different‚Äù refers to the fact that the nature of the parts is not seen as different from the nature of the whole.

original: 'dis ni de med pa la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni de med pa la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the non-apprehension of a nature is due to the non-existence of that nature.

original: gzhan gyis ji ltar dbang po las 'das pa'i rdul phra rab so so tha dad pa mthong ba'i lam du mi 'gyur ba de ltar bsags pa na yang de dag nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ji ltar dbang po las 'das pa'i rdul phra rab so so tha dad pa mthong ba'i lam du mi 'gyur ba de ltar bsags pa na yang de dag nyid yin pas na /
translated: The opponent might say that the individual atoms that are beyond the senses are not seen on the path of seeing, but that they are seen when they are aggregated.

original: gal te yan lag can gyi ngo bo med par 'gyur na 'ga' zhig kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa gang yin pa 'di la yang /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can gyi ngo bo med par 'gyur na 'ga' zhig kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa gang yin pa 'di la yang /
translated: The opponent might say that if the nature of the whole does not exist, then nothing would be seen.

original: rdul phra rab so so tha dad pa la nus pa med na yang /
analyzed: rdul phra rab so so tha dad pa la nus pa med na yang /
translated: The individual atoms that are beyond the senses do not have the ability to produce a cognition of themselves.üîΩHowever, when they are in a state of aggregation, they are the cause of a cognition of themselves.

original: gal te so so re re phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rkyen las gzhan dang gzhan las /
analyzed: gal te so so re re phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rkyen las gzhan dang gzhan las /
translated: The opponent might say that the individual atoms that are beyond the senses do not have the ability to produce a cognition of themselves.üîΩHowever, when they are in a state of aggregation, they are the cause of a cognition of themselves.üîΩThe opponent might say that the individual atoms that are beyond the senses do not have the ability to produce a cognition of themselves.üîΩHowever, when they are in a state of aggregation, they are the cause of a cognition of themselves.üîΩThe opponent might say that the individual atoms that are beyond the senses do not have the ability to produce a cognition of themselves.üîΩHowever, when they are in a state of aggregation, they are the cause of a cognition of themselves.üîΩThe opponent might say that the individual atoms that are beyond the senses do not have the ability to produce a cognition of themselves.üîΩHowever, when they are in a state of aggregation, they are the cause of a cognition of themselves.üîΩThe opponent might say that the individual atoms that are beyond the senses do not have the ability to produce a cognition of themselves.

original: skye phul byung bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: skye phul byung bar gyur pa na /
translated: However, when they are in a state of aggregation, they are the cause of a cognition of themselves.üîΩThe opponent might say that the individual atoms that are beyond the senses do not have the ability to produce a cognition of themselves.

original: mang po blo'i rgyu ni 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: mang po blo'i rgyu ni 'gyur ba la /
translated: However, when they are in a state of aggregation, they are the cause of a cognition of themselves.üîΩThe opponent might say that the individual atoms that are beyond the senses do not have the ability to produce a cognition of themselves.

original: de'i tshe 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'gal ba dag ni ci zhig yod /
translated: However, when they are in a state of aggregation, they are the

original: gang gis na yan lag can rtogs par byed /
analyzed: gang gis na yan lag can rtogs par byed /
translated: How could it be that the parts are the cause of the cognition of the whole?

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dbang po la sogs bzhin /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs bzhin /
translated: Like the sense faculties, etc.

original: dper na bdag dang dbang po dang yid la sogs pa so so tha dad pa 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa ;
analyzed: dper na bdag dang dbang po dang yid la sogs pa so so tha dad pa 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa ;
translated: For example, the self, the sense faculties, the mind, etc., individually and separately are not the cause of the arising of the effect, consciousness.

original: phyis phan tshun tshogs nas de skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyis phan tshun tshogs nas de skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: Later, having come together, they are the cause of its arising.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the way it is.

original: rdul phra rab rnams rgyu nyid yin pas bzlog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams rgyu nyid yin pas bzlog pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the atoms are the cause, because they are not the object of the cognition.

original: sngar dbang po las bdas pa phyis kyang yul du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngar dbang po las bdas pa phyis kyang yul du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they were the cause, they would be the object even before the sense faculties, but later they would not be the object.

original: de ni rgyu'i dngos po ma gtogs par gzhan gzung ba zhes bya ba gzhan ci yang med /
analyzed: de ni rgyu'i dngos po ma gtogs par gzhan gzung ba zhes bya ba gzhan ci yang med /
translated: There is nothing else called the object apart from the cause.

original: de ltar na rgyur gyur pa'i don de la gang gi rnam can blo /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyur gyur pa'i don de la gang gi rnam can blo /
translated: Thus, the object that is the cause is the form of the cognition.

original: don gang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i blo de'i gzugs de ni gzung bar brjod /
analyzed: don gang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i blo de'i gzugs de ni gzung bar brjod /
translated: The cognition that conforms to the nature of the object is said to apprehend that form.

original: 'di ltar rnam par 'jog par nus pa rgyu nyid ni yul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par 'jog par nus pa rgyu nyid ni yul yin no //
translated: In this way, the cause itself is the object, for it is capable of being posited as such.

original: du ma cig car gzung ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang cig car du ma 'dzin pa ma yin na /üîΩji ltar rang gi yan lag bcas //
analyzed: du ma cig car gzung ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang cig car du ma 'dzin pa ma yin na / ji ltar rang gi yan lag bcas //
translated: But it is not the case that many are apprehended simultaneously.üîΩHow is it that the whole is apprehended

original: cig car yan lag can bzung yin //
analyzed: cig car yan lag can bzung yin //
translated: Simultaneously with its parts?

original: 'di yang du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir gzung ba ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di yang du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir gzung ba ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not apprehended because it is many,

original: gzung ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba yang yin te /
translated: it is apprehended,

original: 'di ltar lkog shal la sogs mthong med par ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar lkog shal la sogs mthong med par ni /
translated: because, without seeing the dewlap and so on,

original: ba lang shes pa mthong ba med //
analyzed: ba lang shes pa mthong ba med //
translated: the cognition of an ox does not occur.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa yan lag rnams gzung ba med par @197b ba lang mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na du ma gzung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa yan lag rnams gzung ba med par @197b ba lang mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na du ma gzung ba nyid yin no //
translated: Without seeing the parts, the dewlap and so on, the cognition of an ox does not occur. Thus it is apprehended as many.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te yon tan gtso bo dag / cig car 'dzin par 'dod na yang //
analyzed: gal te yon tan gtso bo dag / cig car 'dzin par 'dod na yang //
translated: if you maintain that the qualities and the primary substance are apprehended simultaneously,

original: phan tshun khyad par med par gyur pa rdzas du ma 'dzin pa mi 'dod la yon tan dang gtso bor gyur pa'i du ma yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun khyad par med par gyur pa rdzas du ma 'dzin pa mi 'dod la yon tan dang gtso bor gyur pa'i du ma yang ma yin no //
translated: then you must admit that many substances are apprehended simultaneously, but you do not admit this. And the many qualities and the primary substance are not apprehended simultaneously.

original: lkog shal la sogs pa'i yan lag ni ba lang gi rdzas kyi khyad par du gyur pa yin pas na /
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa'i yan lag ni ba lang gi rdzas kyi khyad par du gyur pa yin pas na /
translated: Since the parts such as the dewlap are the specific substances of the cow,

original: de dag lhan cig 'dzin pa'i rigs pa yin pa de ltar rdul phran ma yin pa'i phyir de dag lhan cig 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /üîΩgal te de lta yin na gang gi tshe /
analyzed: de dag lhan cig 'dzin pa'i rigs pa yin pa de ltar rdul phran ma yin pa'i phyir de dag lhan cig 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no zhe na / gal te de lta yin na gang gi tshe /
translated: it is logical that they are apprehended together. But since the particles are not like that, it is illogical that they are apprehended together.

original: yan lag khyad par can du gyur pa gcig nyid kyi skyes bus /
analyzed: yan lag khyad par can du gyur pa gcig nyid kyi skyes bus /
translated: If that is so, then when a person apprehends a specific part,

original: ji ltar rva can dang lkog shal dang ldan pa yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar rva can dang lkog shal dang ldan pa yin no zhes shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: how could he know, ‚ÄúI possess horns and a dewlap‚Äù?

original: khyad par du ma'i 'brel ba'i nges pa cig car byed par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: khyad par du ma'i 'brel ba'i nges pa cig car byed par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: At that time, since it is impossible to simultaneously ascertain the connection with many specific parts,

original: yan lag khyad par du gyur pa gcig nyid 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /üîΩlhag ma dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag khyad par du gyur pa gcig nyid 'dzin par 'gyur gyi / lhag ma dag ni ma yin te /
translated: he would apprehend only the specific part he possesses.

original: yan lag rdzogs can de las gzhan pa'i yan lag dang lhan cig mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: yan lag rdzogs can de las gzhan pa'i yan lag dang lhan cig mi 'dzin to //
translated: He would not apprehend the rest, because he would not apprehend the other parts that are not complete parts of the cow.

original: de ltar na yan lag de dag phan tshun khyad par can gyi gzhi'i dngos po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag de dag phan tshun khyad par can gyi gzhi'i dngos po ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus, those parts are not the basis of a thing that is distinct from each other.

original: yan lag can yang /
analyzed: yan lag can yang /
translated: And the whole

original: yan lag re re rnam grangs kyis khyad par du nye bar gnas pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: yan lag re re rnam grangs kyis khyad par du nye bar gnas pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: is not a thing that is distinct from the parts.

original: gcig po de dag dang lhan cig 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gcig po de dag dang lhan cig 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is grasped together with those individual parts,

original: de las gzhan pa'i yan lag dang lhan cig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yan lag dang lhan cig ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with any other parts.

original: yon tan sogs ldan cig car yang 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan sogs ldan cig car yang 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: It is also grasped simultaneously as possessing qualities and so on.

original: yon tan ni snang ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gang yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: yon tan ni snang ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gang yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: The quality is the nature of the blue and so on that is the quality of appearance and so on.

original: spyi ni rna ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi ni rna ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The universal is the nature of being an ear and so on.

original: las ni g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: las ni g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'i /
translated: The action is the nature of the movement and so on.

original: khyad par de ni rdzas ma yin pa de ltar na de dang lhan cig 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par de ni rdzas ma yin pa de ltar na de dang lhan cig 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: That particular is not a substance, and thus it is not grasped together with it.

original: yan lag rnams la yon tan la sogs pa'i rdzas 'du ba dang ldan pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: yan lag rnams la yon tan la sogs pa'i rdzas 'du ba dang ldan pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The parts possess the substance of qualities and so on, and thusüîΩthey are grasped together with those.

original: don gcig la mngon par 'brel pas 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: don gcig la mngon par 'brel pas 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: If the apprehension of a single object is due to the connection of the object with the cognition,

original: gang 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: then what is apprehended by one would be apprehended by all,

original: brgyud pas 'brel pa rtog pa na thams cad dang lhan cig 'brel ba 'ga' zhig yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyad par dang ni khyad par gzhi //
analyzed: brgyud pas 'brel pa rtog pa na thams cad dang lhan cig 'brel ba 'ga' zhig yod pa'i phyir ro // khyad par dang ni khyad par gzhi //
translated: because when there is a conceptual cognition of a connection through a series, there is a connection with all.üîΩThe cognition of a whole that possesses parts is not due to a particular and a universal, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag rdzogs pa can gyi yan lag can 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //üîΩkhyad par gyi gzhi'i rnam par @198a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag rdzogs pa can gyi yan lag can 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i gzhung 'dzugs par byed do // khyad par gyi gzhi'i rnam par @198a * //
translated: The author of the treatise establishes this by saying, ‚ÄúA particular and a universal, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhag ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhag ba ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of a whole that possesses parts is not due to a particular and a universal.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: gang gi tshe brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang khyad par nyid dam khyad par gyi gzhi nyid du brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i tshe khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang khyad par nyid dam khyad par gyi gzhi nyid du brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i tshe khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhir 'gyur te /
translated: When one wishes to express a particular that is dependent on something else, or that which is the basis of a particular, then there is a particular and a universal.

original: 'di lta ste dper na ba lang gi rdzas kyi khyad par ni rva yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na ba lang gi rdzas kyi khyad par ni rva yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a horn is a particular of a cow.

original: de'i tshe ba lang rva can yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ba lang rva can yin no //
translated: At that time, it is the horn of an ox.

original: gang gi tshe rva can 'di nyid khyad par yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rva can 'di nyid khyad par yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When this horn itself is the distinction, at that time,

original: ba lang gi rva yin pa de ltar na rva nyid gtso bo yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang gi rva yin pa de ltar na rva nyid gtso bo yin gyi /
translated: it is the horn of an ox. Thus, the horn itself is primary,
